name: abort
short: This cancels execution of a program script and returns control to the application. The database is not updated. The function has the same effect in both 3GL and 4GL scripts.

name: abort.io
short: This cancels the current database transaction.

name: abort.transaction
short: This cancels the current database transaction. No changes are stored in the database.

name: abs
short: This function returns the absolute value of the supplied numeric value.

name: acos
short: This computes the arc cosine of x. The value of x must be in the range [-1, 1].

name: act.and.sleep
syntax: function long act.and.sleep (string procname(.) [, string arg1, arg2, ...])
short: This activates the specified process and places it in the sleeping process queue. It remains there until it is activated by calling the reactivate() function. You can remove the process with the kill() function. The process is automatically removed when the process group to which it belongs is killed.

name: activate
syntax: function long activate (string procname(.) [, string arg1, arg2, ...])
short: This activates the specified process and places it in the running process queue. Execution starts when the bshell schedules CPU time for the process.

name: activate.search
short: This forces a random search action on the main table. You call the function immediately after input to a field during insertion of a new record (standard command ADD.SET or DUPL.OCCUR) or during MODIFY.SET (if the predefined variable modify.prim.key is set to TRUE).

name: add.message.button
syntax: function long add.message.button (string msgCode, string buttonLabel, string library, string fnc, long autg, string Session)
short: Add an additional button to a message or a question. This button will execute the specified function from the specified Library.

name: add.sync.fields

short: This function maps a variable in the multi-main table controller session to a fields in the satellite session. This variable must be declared as external.

syntax: function void add.sync.fields.nokey (const string satelliteSessionCode, const string ...)
short: This function maps a variable in the multi-main table controller session to a variable in the session. Both of these variables must be declared as external.

name: add.sync.fields.once
syntax: function void add.sync.fields.once (const string satelliteSessionCode, const string ...)
short: This function maps a variable in the multi-main table controller session to a fields in the satellite session. This variable must be declared as external.

name: add.variable.to.defaults
syntax: function void add.variable.to.defaults (string var_name, long var_type)
short: Save other variables in the user defaults which are not on the form. All form fields are stored automatically in the user�s defaults when the save.defaults command is executed.

syntax: function void add.view.field (long index.nr, const string fname)
short: Deprecated. This function is supported for compatibility reasons, do not use this function anymore but use for conditional view-fields remove.field.from.view() .

name: after.change.object
short: This hook is called after the current record has been changed, but not yet updated in the database. It marks the end of changing the current record.

name: after.commit.transaction
short: Use this to update other database tables after an update of the current table has been committed to the database.

name: after.destroy.object
short: Use this to update referenced tables after the current object has been deleted.

name: after.get.object
short: Use this, to program checks that determine whether reading a record is permitted. The checks are performed after the record has been retrieved from the database. The dir argument is set by the STP and specifies the object being read. The possible values are:

name: after.new.object
short: This hook is called after a new record has been created, but not yet saved in the database. It marks the end of creating a new record.

name: after.save.object
short: Use this to update referenced tables after a record has been added or updated. The mode argument is set by the 4GL engine . The possible values are:

name: alloc.mem
syntax: function long alloc.mem (ref variable, long dimension1 [, long dimension2, ...])
short: This allocates memory space to the specified variable at run time. The variable can be a string or an array (of any type). It must be declared as BASED. With multi-dimensional arrays, each dimension must be initialized to 1 at declaration. Once alloc.mem() has allocated memory for a variable, that variable behaves in the same way as any other variable.

name: appl.delete.excl
short: This removes a specified exclusive application lock. Only the owner of the lock can delete it. And a lock can be deleted only from within the same process in which it was set.

name: appl.get.user

name: appl.get.user.excl

name: appl.modify

name: appl.set

short: This creates an application lock for the current application.

name: artm.begin.transaction
syntax: function long artm.begin.transaction (long artm.transaction.class.id [, long metric.type] [, void metric.value])
short: Marks the beginning of a transaction. Each time a transaction starts, artm.begin.transaction() must be called at the beginning of each transaction instance the user wants to monitor.

name: artm.define.transaction.class
syntax: function long artm.define.transaction.class (string tran.name(128), string tran.detail(128) [, long metric.type] [, string metric.name(44)])
short: Assigns a unique identifier to a transaction class, and optionally to describe the format of additional data passed on by artm.begin.transaction (), artm.update.transaction(), and the artm.end.transaction() calls. This is normally done during the initialization of the specified application. The value returned by artm.define.transaction.class() is passed as a parameter in artm.begin.transaction() calls to identify which class of transaction is starting.

name: artm.end.transaction
syntax: function long artm.end.transaction (long artm.transaction.id, long tran.status [, long metric.type] [, void metric.value])
short: Marks the end of a transaction instance that was started with artm.begin.transaction(). artm.end.transaction () should be called from the application program just after each transaction instance ends.

name: artm.redefine.transaction.class
syntax: function long artm.redefine.transaction.class (string tran.name(128) [, long metric.type] [, string metric.name(44)])
short: Updates the metrics of a predefined session transaction class at the beginning of a session.

syntax: function long artm.update.transaction (long artm.transaction.id [, long metric.type] [, void metric.value])
short: This function is not required, and can thus be omitted if not needed. It can be used for two purposes, namely:

name: asin
short: This computes the arc sine of x. The value of x must be in the range [-1, 1].

name: ask.enum
syntax: function bset ask.enum (string quescode, bset default_enumval [, void arg, ...])
short: This displays a message box containing a question and a number of possible responses. The responses are presented as push buttons. To respond to the question and close the message box, the user selects one of the push buttons.

name: at.base
syntax: function long at.base (long process_id, string basic_variable_name, void unused [, long position, ...], <ref|const> <type> based_variable [, long length, ...])
short: Use this function to base one variable (the based_variable ) on an external variable in another process (the basic_variable ). The two variables then use the same memory area.

name: atan
short: This computes the arc tangent of x.

name: aud_close_audit
short: Discards the specified sequence identifier. seqid is the identifier returned by aud_open_audit() aud_open_audit when the particular sequence file was opened. When the last sequence file associated with an info file is closed, the info file is also closed.

name: aud_get_audit_dd
syntax: function void aud_get_audit_dd (const string seqhdr(), ref string colnames(,), ref long colinfo(,))
short: This retrieves the audit data dictionary information from the sequence header of a particular sequence file.

name: aud_get_col_info
syntax: function void aud_get_col_info (const string seqhdr(), long col_no, ref string col_name(), ref long col_type, ref long col_dep, ref long col_len)
short: This retrieves information about a specified field from the sequence header of a particular sequence file. It retrieves the same information as aud_get_audit_dd() , but for a single field only.

name: aud_get_fld_values
syntax: function long aud_get_fld_values (long colno, const long colinfo, const string rec_buff(), ref string values(,))
short: This retrieves the values of a specified field from an audit record. You can use this for records of type insert, delete, and update only. For records of type insert and delete, you can retrieve the values of any field. For records of type update, you can retrieve the values of changed fields and primary key fields only.

name: aud_get_hdr_size
short: Because the audit DD of a table can differ in different sequence files, the size of the sequence header can also differ from sequence file to sequence file.

name: aud_get_info_seq_hdr_size
syntax: function long aud_get_info_seq_hdr_size (long seqid, long seqno)
short: Because the audit DD of a table can differ in different sequence files, the size of the sequence header can also differ from sequence file to sequence file.

name: aud_open_audit
syntax: function long aud_open_audit (const string host_name(), const string table_name(), long compno, long seqno)
short: This opens a specified sequence file. You identify the file to open by the table/company combination with which it is associated, the host on which it is located, and the sequence file number. The function returns a unique identifier for the file. Other audit functions use this identifier (referred to as the sequence identifier) to refer to this particular sequence file.

name: aud_read_audit_rec
syntax: function long aud_read_audit_rec (long seqid, long rec_no, ref string rec_buff())
short: This retrieves a specified audit record from the current transaction. You can use aud_read_next_audit_rec() to retrieve the next and subsequent records from the transaction. You can access information in the audit record using the Macros - transaction record .

name: aud_read_info_hdr
syntax: function long aud_read_info_hdr (const string host_name(), const string table_name(), long compno, ref string info_hdr())
short: This retrieves the header of the info file associated with a specified table and company number combination. You can access information in the info header using the Macros - info header .

name: aud_read_info_seq_hdr
syntax: function long aud_read_info_seq_hdr (long seqid, long seqno, ref string seqhdr)
short: This reads the header information for a particular sequence file from the associated info file. You can access information in the sequence header using the Macros - sequence header .

name: aud_read_next_audit_rec
syntax: function long aud_read_next_audit_rec (long seqid, ref string rec_buff)
short: This reads the next audited record from the current transaction. You can use aud_read_audit_rec() to read a specific audit record and then use aud_read_next_audit_rec() to read the next and subsequent records. You can access information in the audited record using the Macros - transaction record

name: aud_read_next_tran
syntax: function long aud_read_next_tran (long seqid, ref string tran_hdr())
short: This reads the next transaction header in the specified sequence file. You can use aud_read_tran() to read a specific transaction header and then use aud_read_next_tran() to read the next and subsequent transaction headers. You can access information in the transaction header using the Macros - transaction header .

name: aud_read_seq_hdr
syntax: function long aud_read_seq_hdr (long seqid, ref string seqhdr)
short: This retrieves the header information from a specified sequence file. You can access information in the sequence header with the Macros - sequence header .

name: aud_read_tran
syntax: function long aud_read_tran (long seqid, long tran_no, ref string tran_hdr())
short: This reads a specified transaction header from a specified sequence file. You can use aud_read_tran() to read a specific transaction header and then use aud_read_next_tran() to read the next and subsequent transaction headers. You can access information in the transaction header with the Macros - transaction header .

name: aud_select_host
syntax: function long aud_select_host (const string table_name(), long compno, long user_interaction, ref string host_name())
short: Audit files can be located on more than one host (for example, on the local host and a remote host, or on two or more remote hosts). The system maintains a list of hosts where audit files for particular table and company number combinations are located. When accessing audit files, this host list is used to select the particular host on which the files are to be accessed.

name: aud_update_infofile
syntax: function long aud_update_infofile (long seqid, const string seqhdr)
short: This writes sequence header information to the info file associated with the specified sequence file. You can set the information for the sequence header with the Macros - sequence header

name: aud_write_info_hdr
syntax: function long aud_write_info_hdr (long host_name(), string table_name(), long compno, const string info_hdr)
short: This writes info header information to a specified info file. You can set the information for the info header with the Macros - info header

name: aud_write_seq_hdr
syntax: function long aud_write_seq_hdr (long seqid, const string seqhdr())
short: This writes header information to a specified sequence file. You can set the information for the sequence header with the Macros - sequence header .

name: aud.audit.is.on.for.table
syntax: function boolean aud.audit.is.on.for.table (const string table.code(), long company)
short: This function checks whether audit is on for a specific database table.

name: aud.close.selection
short: The opening of the audit trail is not done explicitly in comparison to the low-level audit library functions. To close the opened files again, the developer must use the aud.close.selection. During the invocation of aud.select.transactions() and all functions beginning with aud.get.next, each file that is opened but not closed will be registered within the Infor ERP Enterprise Audit Management. The function aud.close.selection() will use this information to close the files that are registered as being open. The function also closes the selection of transactions that have been created using the aud.select.transactions function.

name: aud.get.field.ids
syntax: function long aud.get.field.ids (long selection.id, long table.id, long number.of.fields, const string field.names(,), ref long field.ids())
short: aud.get.next.action() stores the contents of the action row internally: old value, new value and status of each field. To retrieve this information, the application needs to have a reference for each field. These references are called field ids. Only when the meta data is changed do the field ids change, so only in such a case does this function have to be used. This function also enables the user to filter only those fields that are relevant to the application by means of a field.names array. This array contains the field names for which an id has to be retrieved.

name: aud.get.field.info
syntax: function void aud.get.field.info (long selection.id, long table.id, long field.id, ref long field.depth, ref long field.type, ref long field.length)
short: Returns the format of the field at the time it was audited. The information consists of the type, the depth and the size of the field. This function will not check the input, because of performance reasons. Instead the combination selection.id , table.id , field.id is assumed to refer to an existing field, as returned by aud.get.field.ids() . This means that if the input parameters are not valid, an error message will be presented to the end user

name: aud.get.field.list
syntax: function long aud.get.field.list (long selection.id, long table.id, ref string field.names(,))
short: Use this function to get the field names of all fields logged for a database table in the audit trail. This function is especially useful if the user is not aware or interested in the table fields but simply needs the names of all fields. In this case the user uses the aud.get.number.of.fields() to determine how many fields are available and also uses aud.get.field.list() to obtain the field ids for each field. The information of these two function can be used to further retrieve field info as well as the value of the field using the functions: aud.get.field.info() , aud.get.field.status() and aud.put.old.field.value() and aud.put.new.field.value() .

name: aud.get.field.status
syntax: function string aud.get.field.status (long selection.id, long table.id, long field.id)
short: Retrieves the status of a field in a database action (insert, update or delete).

name: aud.get.next.action
syntax: function long aud.get.next.action (long selection.id, ref long table.id, ref long company, ref string table.code, ref bool meta.data.changed, ref long current.action.number, ref string action.type)
short: Determines and reads the next action from the list of tables that was constructed by the aud.get.next.transaction() function.

name: aud.get.next.transaction
syntax: function long aud.get.next.transaction (long selection.id, long number.of.retries, long retry.interval, ref string transaction.id, ref long commit.time, ref string session, ref string user)
short: After the transactions to be selected have been specified using aud.select.transactions() the next step is to retrieve the audit data from the audit trail. The retrieved audit data can be processed in combination with the acquired meta data. The aud.get.next.transaction function fetches the next transaction data based on the selection defined with the aud.select.transactions() function. When a transaction is read successfully, the function returns the transaction header, consisting of transaction.id , commit.time , session and user .

name: aud.get.number.of.fields
syntax: function long aud.get.number.of.fields (long selection.id, long table.id, ref long number.of.fields)
short: Use this function to determine the number of fields, read from the data dictionary, that are stored in the sequence files. This function is especially useful if the user is not aware or interested in the table fields but simply needs to pick up the value of all fields. In this situation the user uses this function together with the aud.get.field.list() to read all the information of all fields.

name: aud.put.new.field.value
syntax: function void aud.put.new.field.value (long pid, string variable.name, long selection.id, long table.id, long field.id, long element [, bool endian])
short: Use aud.put.new.field.value to retrieve the value of a field from the new value string. The retrieved value is put into the variable supplied by the application.

name: aud.put.old.field.value
syntax: function void aud.put.old.field.value (long pid, string variable.name, long selection.id, long table.id, long field.id, long element [, bool endian])
short: Use aud.put.old.field.value to retrieve the value of a field from the old (new) value string. The retrieved value is put into the variable supplied by the application.

name: aud.select.transactions
syntax: function long aud.select.transactions (long nr.tables, const string table.codes(,), const long companies(), const string selection.criteria, ref long selection.id)
short: Before transactional data can be read from the audit trail the developer has to select the transactions. This function selects transactions from the audit trail using a list of tables and, if required, some additional selection criteria. The selection.criteria is given in a SQL 'where' like fashion and is used to filter the desired transactions.

name: brp.close
short: This stops the report writer for the specified report. brp_id is the report ID returned by brp.open() or brp.open.language() when the report was activated. The report is sorted (if necessary) and sent to the printer spooler.

name: brp.open
syntax: function long brp.open (string rep_name(16), string device(14), long mode)
short: This activates a specified report and opens a specified spooler device (if it is not already open). Several reports can be active simultaneously. In a 4GL script, the name of the current report is stored in the predefined variable spool.report . This variable is available in the on.choice subsection of a choice.print.data section.

name: brp.open.language
syntax: function long brp.open.language (string rep_name(16), string lang, string device(14), long mode)
short: This is the same as brp.open() in most respects, except that it includes a language argument. This enables you to specify a language for the report other than the default user language.

name: brp.ready
short: This signals the report writer that a record is ready to be imported into a particular report. The report writer then prints the record. You call this function after filling the fields of a record that the report writer can process. The fields are specified in the report and must be declared as EXTERN in the program script.

name: bs$

name: bse.dir$
short: This returns a string containing the name of the directory where the Baan Software Environment is installed. The function uses the environment variable BSE to retrieve the information. If this variable is not filled, bse.dir$() returns the string "/usr/bse".

name: bse.release$
short: This returns a string of 3 characters that contains the release number of BAAN Tools. For example, "6.2".

name: bse.tmp.dir$
short: This returns a string containing the name of the directory where temporary files can be created by the application. The function uses the environment variable BSE_TMP to retrieve the information. If this environment variable is not filled, bse.tmp.dir$() returns the string "$BSE/tmp". If the environment variable BSE is not filled, the function returns the string "/usr/tmp".

name: change.field.label
syntax: function long change.field.label (const string fname, long element, const string label1 [, const string label2] [, const string label3])
short: Use this to set the label for a specified field. A field can have up to three lines of text (label-lines). The new label-line(s) replace the current label-line(s). The function requires that the specified field already has a (dummy) label in the form-definition. When the field is not in the grid, the label in the form-definition should have at least the same number of label-lines, as specified with this function.

name: change.group.label
syntax: function long change.group.label (const long groupId, const string label)
short: Use this to set the label for a specified group. The new label replace the current label. The function requires that the specified group already has a (dummy) label in the form-definition.

name: change.picture
syntax: function long change.picture (const string fname, const string icon [, const string absolute.file])
short: Static pictures stored on the server can be displayed on a form. Pictures can be added to the form using the DFE. For display of an icon, the picture must be one of the pictures in the Icon Group "form_<pp>", where pp is the package-code of the picture's session. For display of an image from a local file on the server, the optional argument absolute.file must be filled.

name: change.progress.delay
short: Changes the delay time of the progress indicator. The delay time is the time in milliseconds after which the progress indicator will appear to the user. This can be used to prevent flashing progress indicators, in case the number of elements to process is low, (i.e. a progress indicator that starts and stops within one or two seconds). By setting the delay time this flashing can be prevented.

name: choice.again
short: This cancels execution of a standard command and transfers control to the 4GL engine . Statements programmed after this function will never be executed. You can call this function during execution of a standard command. You can also call the function in field sections, as these are called indirectly during execution of some commands.

name: choice.report
short: This returns the name of a report from the session data in the data dictionary. The report is taken from the group defined in the predefined variable reportgrp (default = 1). If there is more than one report in the group, the user is presented with a menu from which to select the required report.

name: choose.time.zone.from.list
short: This starts a session where the user can choose a time zone from a list. The function then calls set.timezone() with the time zone selected by the user.

name: chr$
short: This function returns a single character string corresponding to the supplied code point.

name: cipher.decrypt.finalize
syntax: function long cipher.decrypt.finalize (long Handle, string data.out, long data.out.length)
short: Most cipher algorithms operate in block mode, which means the output is always a multiple of the block size. Because the input is not necessarily a multiple of that block size, this function returns the last (partial) block. It also frees up the resources that are used by the encryption and invalidates (closes) the handle

name: cipher.decrypt.initialize
syntax: function long cipher.decrypt.initialize (long crypt.type, string key, string iv)
short: Initializes the state of the Decrypt Algorithm and selects the appropriate decryption algorithm.

name: cipher.decrypt.update
syntax: function long cipher.decrypt.update (long handle, string data.out, long data.out.size, string data.in, long data.in.size)
short: Feeds data to the decryption algorithm to be decrypted using the key (and optionally IV) given in cipher.decrypt.initialize() .

name: cipher.encrypt.finalize
syntax: function long cipher.encrypt.finalize (long handle, string data.out, long data.out.length)
short: Most cipher algorithms operate in block mode, which means the output is always a multiple of the block size. Because the input is not necessarily a multiple of that block size, this function returns the last (partial) block. It also frees up the resources that are used by the encryption and invalidates (closes) the handle .

name: cipher.encrypt.initialize
syntax: function long cipher.encrypt.initialize (long crypt.type, const string key, const string iv)
short: Initializes the state of the Encryption Algorithm and selects the appropriate encryption algorithm.

name: cipher.encrypt.update
syntax: function long cipher.encrypt.update (long handle, ref string data.out, ref long data.out.size, const string data.in, long data.in.size)
short: Feeds data to the encryption algorithm to be encrypted using the key (and optionally the IV) given in cipher.encrypt.initialize() .

short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: clean.mess
short: This removes a message that was displayed by using the mess() function with its mode argument set to 0.

name: clear.query.extend.in.zoom
short: This clears a query extension that was previously defined in the selection.filter section. The 4GL engine automatically clears the extension in the after.zoom section of the session. Use this function to force an earlier removal of the query extension. For example, to clear the query extension before defining an extension for another zoom session.

name: client.add.download.file
short: Add a file to the list of files to be downloaded to the client. The mime.type can be used to indicate the file type such that the browser has the option to start the client application which is associated with this mime.type. When the mime.type is not specified, the mime.type will be determined based on the file extension of the file specified in the optional target argument. When the optional target argument is also not specified, the mime.type will be determined based on the file extension of the file specified in the source argument Conversion of CRLF characters is only done for text files (file extension .txt or mime.type "text/plain"). All other file types are copied in binary mode. This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.delete.upload.file.object
short: Delete the result object returned by client.upload.files . This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.download.file
short: Download the server file passed in the source argument to the client. Calling this function will result in a download dialog in which the user can choose to select the file for download. This function will return when the user closes the download dialog. The mime.type can be used to indicate the file type such that the browser has the option to start the client application which is associated with this mime.type. When the mime.type is not specified, the mime.type will be determined based on the file extension of the file specified in the optional target argument. When the optional target argument is also not specified, the mime.type will be determined based on the file extension of the file specified in the source argument. Conversion of CRLF characters is only done for text files (file extension .txt or mime.type "text/plain"). All other file types are copied in binary mode. This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.get.media.type
short: Returns the MIME media type based on the extension of the filename.

name: client.get.upload.file
short: Get the details about a file which is uploaded with function client.upload.files . This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.get.upload.filecount
short: Get the number of files which are uploaded with function client.upload.files . This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.prepare.download
short: Prepare the download of one or more server files. This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.show.file
short: Show the server file passed in the source argument in the browser. The browser can show some file types natively in a browser window (like for example plain text and pdf files). For other file types, the browser will show a browser specific download dialog.

name: client.show.url
short: This function opens a URL in a Document Viewer session. This function is only supported in the WebUI and LN UI.

name: client.start.download
short: Start a download dialog showing a list of files constructed in advance with the functions client.prepare.download and client.add.download.file This function will return when the user closes the download dialog. This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.upload.file
short: Upload a single file from the client and save this file on the server in the file location passed as the destination argument. Conversion of CRLF characters is only done for text files (file extension .txt or mime.type "text/plain"). All other file types are copied in binary mode. This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client.upload.files
short: Upload one or more files from the client and save these files in a server directory. Conversion of CRLF characters is only done for text files (file extension .txt or mime.type "text/plain"). All other file types are copied in binary mode. This function returns an id that can be used in the function client.get.upload.file to obtain information of an uploaded file. This function is only supported for LN UI.

name: client2server

short: This compares the values of two variables or arrays. By default, the values are compared for the length of the shortest argument. If you specify the optional count argument, the function compares the first count numbers or characters of both arguments. The number of numbers or characters compared will, however, never exceed the length of the shortest argument.

syntax: function long copy.image (string source.guid, string source.tablename, string target.guid, string target.tablename [, boolean overwrite])
short: This function will copy an image or set of images based on its guid into then image repository refered by the target guid. This function can be used when copying records.

name: copy.image.to.company
syntax: function long copy.image.to.company (long source.company, string source.guid, string source.tablename, long target.company, string target.guid, string target.tablename [, boolean overwrite] [, boolean omit.transaction])
short: This function will copy an image or set of images based on its guid into the image repository referred to by the target guid and company. This function can be used when copying records to a different company.

name: copy.mem
syntax: function void copy.mem (ref void destination, void source [, long count])
short: This copies the memory space from the source argument to the destination argument. By default, the total length of source is copied. But, if the destination argument is shorter than the source argument, then source is truncated. Use the optional count argument to copy a specified number of array elements only.

name: cos
short: This computes the cosine of x , in radians. The x argument can be a long or a double.

name: cosh
short: This computes the hyperbolic cosine of x .

short: Counts the number of records that exist in the maintable for the current view. Any filter or query extension that has been set is taken into account.

short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: cps.add.child
syntax: function long cps.add.child (const string session.code, long bars, const string title, long splitpane)
short: Add a child session to this controller, which will be shown and started in the frame of the composite controller. This session will be shown in the passed split pane. To a split pane exactly two objects must be added: sessions and/or split panes. The order of adding these objects to the split pane determines the order on the screen (left/right or top/bottom).

name: cps.create.splitpane
syntax: function long cps.create.splitpane (long orientation, long divider [, long splitpane])
short: Create a split pane which can either hold another split pane or a child session. There can only be one top-level split pane created. This function may not be called before the call to cps.init()

name: cps.init
short: Initialize the Composite Session Controller. This must be the first cps function called by the 3GL-Script. When this session was started from a parent session in modeless mode, this function will reactive the parent session. So any imports which must be done by this session from the parent should be done before this function is called.

name: cps.start
short: Activates the Composite Session Controller and the related child sessions. This function will only return when the user decides to close this composite session.

name: cps.status.mess
short: This function displays the specified message in the status bar of a composite session. To clear this message, an empty message string must be passed. This function can be called from composite child sessions (GBF or 4GL). When this function is called from other session types, it will do nothing.

name: cr$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: creat.tmp.file$
short: This creates a temporary file. By default, the file is created in the current directory. To create the file in a different directory, use the optional pathname argument to specify the full path to the required directory.

name: create.extra.toolbar
syntax: function long create.extra.toolbar (string form_command, string gif_file [, string form_command] [, string gif_file])
short: This adds a secondary toolbar to a session.

name: create.keyfields.collection
short: Create an object which can hold a collection of key fields objects

name: create.keyfields.object
syntax: function long create.keyfields.object (const string tablename [, long collection])
short: Create an object which can hold the key fields and the corresponding values referring to one record of the passed database table. The key fields of index 1 are used.

name: create.local.directory
short: Deprecated. This creates a specified directory on a client system. You must have write permission in the parent directory to do this. Access permissions for the new directory are set to read and write for all users.

name: create.local.file
short: Deprecated. This creates a specified file on a client system. You must have write permission in the parent directory to do this. Access permissions for the new file are set to read and write, for all users. When the file does already exist, it will be truncated.

syntax: function long create.object (long type, long parent_object [, long attribute, value [, size]], ...)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: create.progress.indicator
syntax: function long create.progress.indicator (string title [, long mode])
short: This creates a progress indicator with the specified title displayed in its title bar. The progress indicator is activated after the first update (using change.progress.indicator() ). It is removed again using destroy.progress.indicator() , or automatically if PROGRESS.NOAUTODESTROY is not specified.

name: create.sub.object
syntax: function long create.sub.object (long object, long type [, long attribute, value [, size]], ...)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: create.sub.object.by.id
syntax: function long create.sub.object.by.id (long object, long sub_object_id, long type, long attribute, void value [, long size])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: create.tree
syntax: function long create.tree (string tree_name, string tree_title)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: create.tree.button
syntax: function void create.tree.button (string tree_name, long button_id, string button_desc [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: cs$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: csqlannotation_selectalldatalanguages
short: Data is selected on the basis of the condition specified in the SELECT statement. The operations between SELECTDO and ENDSELECT are performed on each record from the selected set. The loop ends either when the program has handled the entire set or the program encounters a BREAK command.

name: curl
short: No description available

name: curl.cleanup
short: End cURL session.

name: curl.escape.decode$
short: curl.escape.decode$() offers the inverse functionality of curl.escape.encode$().

name: curl.escape.encode.ext$
syntax: function string curl.escape.encode.ext$ (const string(2,128) EscapeTable, const string SomeText)
short: Escape special characters

name: curl.escape.encode$
short: Escape a string

name: curl.escape.gettable
short: Returns a string array with an escapetable.

name: curl.get.errorbuffer$
short: Descriptive message on result of previous action

name: curl.getinfo
short: This isn't the actual function. This help topic lists all curl.getinfo functions.

name: curl.perform
short: Execute the action.

name: curl.reset
short: Resets all options.

name: curl.reset.errorbuffer
short: Clear the error buffer.

name: curl.setopt
short: This is not an actual function. This help topic lists all curl.setopt functions.

name: curl.slist.append
syntax: function long curl.slist.append (ref long listId, const string text)
short: curl.slist.append() appends a specified string to a linked list of strings. This linked list can be used in some curl.setopt functions. The allowed value(s) of the passed string depend on the context where it is used. If the listId is zero, then a new list is created. The listId should be passed as the first argument if the string need to be appended to an existing list. The specified string has been added to the list when this function returns. The return value is the listId upon success or 0 upon error. The list should be freed after usage with curl.slist.free.all() .

name: curl.slist.free.all
short: curl.slist.free.all() frees a linked list of strings. The listId will be reset to zero after completion.

name: curl.sso.user.gettable
short: Returns a string array with an escapetable.

name: curl.strerror$
short: Descriptive message on result of previous action

name: curl email example
short: No description available

name: curl examples
short: No description available

name: curl ftp example
short: No description available

name: curl mime example
short: No description available

name: curl.create.oauth1.authorization.header
short: Creates an OAuth 1.0 authorization header. Note that this function returns the header value, it must added to the HTTP request with header name "Authorization".

name: curl.download.data
short: Downloads data from the specified url and writes it to the specified data buffer. Note that the buffer must be large enough to store all downloaded data.

name: curl.download.file
short: Downloads data from the specified url and writes it to the specified file.

name: curl.download.stream
short: Downloads data from the specified url and writes it to the specified stream, which can be either a file or a memory stream.

name: curl.download.string
short: Downloads data from the specified url and writes it to the specified string buffer. Note that the string buffer must be large enough to store all data. The data will be null terminated, if possible.

name: curl.http.status$
short: Returns a english descriptive text for a given HTTP Status Code. E.g. when 200 (HTTP_STATUS_OK) is passed "OK" is returned, or when 503 (HTTP_STATUS_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE) is passed, "Service Unavailable" is returned.

name: curl.upload.data
short: Uploads binary data to the specified url.

name: curl.upload.file
short: Uploads a file to the specified url.

name: curl.upload.stream
short: Uploads data from a stream (a file or a memory stream) to the specified url.

name: curl.upload.string
short: Uploads a (null terminated) string to the specified url.

name: curl.version
short: Retrieves the current version of the cURL library that is being used and the versions of the other major components (like OpenSSL), as space-separated strings. This can be used to easily verify the level of support offered by the current bshell. The website of cURL lists the "available from version" for every feature and option.

name: current_date
short: No description available

name: current_timestamp
short: No description available

name: current.display
short: This returns the identification number of the current display. It is provided to support the use of multiple displays in future versions of the software. Currently it always returns zero (0)

name: current.window
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: d.expr
syntax: function double d.expr (long expr_id [, void value] [, boolean suppressError])
short: Executes (or evaluates) an expression previously compiled by expr.compile() . The result is always converted to a double.

name: dal.any.parent.changed
short: The function dal.any.parent.changed() determines whether any of the fields, from which the current field depends, is changed. This function can only be used in combination with dal.require.field() .

name: dal.change.object
short: Use this to indicate the DAL that the current record is about to be changed. After this call, fields can be changed with dal.set.field() . And after that, the record can be saved with dal.save.object() .

name: dal.check.field
short: Checks whether the given field has a valid value. This performs the DAL check hooks in the given mode (default is DAL_UPDATE).

name: dal.clear.error.messages
short: This clears all DAL error messages from the message buffer. Abbreviation for dal.reset.error.messages(0).

name: dal.clear.messages
short: This clears all DAL messages of the specified type from the message buffer. Abbreviation for dal.reset.messages(i.type, 0).

name: dal.copy.object
short: Use this to indicate the DAL that a record is about to be copied. In contrary to dal.new.object() , this function does not call the set.object.defaults() hook!

name: dal.count.error.messages
short: This returns the number of DAL messages of type MSG.ERROR currently in the message buffer.

name: dal.count.messages
short: This returns the number of DAL messages of the specified type that are currently in the message buffer.

name: dal.destroy
short: Use this to delete a database record. The function encapsulates the db.delete() function with the DAL hooks of the object set. If the before.destroy.object() hook fails, the database operation is cancelled.

name: dal.destroy.object
short: Deletes a record of the given table. The record must have been locked for update. This function does the same as dal.destroy() , however it does more detailed permission checking. Further, the method.is.allowed() hook is always called ( dal.destroy() allows you to skip this hook by passing FALSE to the prop_check parameter).

name: dal.field.depends.on
short: Use this to define that a field depends on one or more other fields. Dependencies are defined in terms of field hooks.

name: dal.get.error.message
short: This retrieves the most recent DAL message of type MSG.ERROR from the message buffer. The message is removed from the buffer.

name: dal.get.error.msgcode
short: This retrieves the message code of most recent DAL error message from the message buffer. The message is not removed from the buffer.

name: dal.get.field.mode
short: Returns the mode of the given field. The mode indicates if the field has changed.

name: dal.get.first.error.message
syntax: function long dal.get.first.error.message (ref string mesg, ref string code)
short: This retrieves the oldest DAL message of type MSG.ERROR from the message buffer, together with the message code. The message is removed from the buffer.

name: dal.get.first.message
syntax: function boolean dal.get.first.message (long i.type, ref string o.code, ref string o.text [, ref long o.type])
short: Returns the code and text of the oldest message of the given type. In case MSG.ALL is passed as the type, then the type of the message is returned in the 4th argument.

name: dal.get.last.message
syntax: function boolean dal.get.last.message (long i.type, ref string o.code, ref string o.text [, ref long o.type])
short: Returns the code and text of the most recent message of the given type. In case MSG.ALL is passed as the type, then the type of the message is returned in the 4th argument. The message is removed from the buffer.

name: dal.get.object
short: Reads a record of the given table. In case the lock parameter is set to true, the record is locked for update. This function accepts a list of primary key field/value pairs.

name: dal.get.property.flag
short: Use this to retrieve the value of the has_changed flag (see Property hooks ) for any database property dat.get.property.flag. The property must have been changed by the dal.set.property() function.

name: dal.is.copy.active
short: You can use this in the before.save.object() and after.save.object() hooks in DAL_NEW mode, to test whether the current record is being inserted, or being copied.

name: dal.is.field.changed
short: Use this to test whether a field has changed. It is equivalent to:

name: dal.new
short: Use this to add a new record to the database. The function encapsulates the db.insert() function with the DAL hooks of the object set. If the before.save.object() hook fails, the database operation is cancelled.

name: dal.new.object
short: Use this to indicate the DAL that a new record is about to be inserted. This function set record defaults, by calling db.set.to.default() and the set.object.defaults() hook.

name: dal.parent.caused.update
short: This function may only be called within an .update() hook. It checks whether this call to this hook was triggered by a change in field fld.name .

name: dal.peek.error.message
short: This retrieves the DAL message of type MSG.ERROR from the message buffer at position n. The message is not removed from the buffer.

name: dal.peek.error.msgcode
short: This retrieves the message code from the message buffer at position n . The message is not removed from the buffer.

name: dal.peek.message
syntax: function void dal.peek.message (long i.type, long i.index, ref string o.code, ref string o.text [, ref long o.type])
short: Returns the code and text of the message of the specified type that is located at the given index in the message buffer. In case you specify MSG.ALL as the type, the type of the message is returned in the 5th argument.

name: dal.recall
short: Makes a request to recall the checked-out business object that is identified by the current record.

name: dal.reject
short: Rejects any changes and/or actions done to the current checked-out Business Object and sets the given reason for rejecting.

name: dal.require.field
short: This function can be used to determine a specific order for the calls to the update hooks. The function only works properly if update hooks are triggered by the 4GL engine (amdll), and not called from the application itself.

name: dal.reset.error.messages
short: This clears the most recent DAL messages of type MSG.ERROR from the message buffer.

name: dal.reset.messages
syntax: function void dal.reset.messages (long i.type, long i.count)
short: Removes the most recent messages of the given type from the DAL message buffer. The 2nd argument determines how many messages will remain in the buffer.

name: dal.save.object
short: Saves a record of the given table. In case a dal.new.object() or a dal.copy.object() was done, the record is inserted in the database. In case a dal.change.object() was done, the record is updated in the database.

name: dal.set.array.field
short: Sets the value of the given array field and informs the DAL that the field is changed. This function assigns a complete array at once. If you want to set only one or a few array elements, use function dal.set.field() .

name: dal.set.error.message
syntax: function void dal.set.error.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...]) function void dal.set.warning.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...]) function void dal.set.info.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...])
short: These functions add a message to the DAL message buffer of type MSG.ERROR , MSG.WARNING , or MSG.INFO .

name: dal.set.field
short: Sets the value of the given field and informs the DAL that the field is changed.

name: dal.set.info.message
syntax: function void dal.set.error.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...]) function void dal.set.warning.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...]) function void dal.set.info.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...])
short: These functions add a message to the DAL message buffer of type MSG.ERROR , MSG.WARNING , or MSG.INFO .

name: dal.set.message
syntax: function void dal.set.message (long i.type, const string i.mess.or.code [, void arg ...])
short: Adds a message of the specified type to the DAL message buffer.

name: dal.set.messages.off
short: Turns off dal.set.error.message() . After calling dal.set.messages.off(), any calls to dal.set.error.message() are ignored.

name: dal.set.messages.on
short: Turns on dal.set.error.message .

name: dal.set.property
short: In order to notify the DAL about a change to the value of a property, you must use this function to change the value. Using this function ensures that the relevant property hooks are executed when the value is changed. If you use an assignment or the db.* functions to change a property value, the DAL is not notified of the change. Consequently, the property checks in the DAL are not executed.

name: dal.set.property.with.check
short: In order to notify the DAL about a change to the value of a property, you must use this function to change the value. Using this function ensures that the relevant property hooks are executed when the value is changed. If you use an assignment or the db.* functions to change a property value, the DAL is not notified of the change. Consequently, the property checks in the DAL are not executed.

name: dal.set.warning.message
syntax: function void dal.set.error.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...]) function void dal.set.warning.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...]) function void dal.set.info.message (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...])
short: These functions add a message to the DAL message buffer of type MSG.ERROR , MSG.WARNING , or MSG.INFO .

name: dal.skip.never.applicable.checks
short: By default, the 4GL engine will check fields that are defined as never applicable. You can skip these checks by calling this function in the before.open.object.set() hook in the DAL.

name: dal.start.business.method
short: This starts a specified business method.

name: dal.submit
short: Assigns the Pending status to the checked-out Business Object that is identified by the current record.

name: dal.undo.check.out
short: Undoes a check-out of the business object to which the active record belongs. The undo check-out fails in case the business object is not checked-out, or if the state of the object is other than DBCM_STATUS_DRAFT , DBCM_STATUS_DRAFT_REV , or DBCM_STATUS_REJECTED .

name: dal.update
short: Use this to update an existing database record. The function encapsulates the db.update() function with the DAL hooks of the object set. If the before.save.object() hook fails, the database operation is cancelled.

name: data.input
syntax: function void data.input (string options(.), ref string result(.), string default(.), ref long event(EVTMAXSIZE), ref long char_value)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: date.num
short: This returns the number of days from 01-01-0001 to the system date.

name: date.to.date
syntax: function long date.to.date (long in_date, long in_time, const string in_zone, const string out_zone, ref long out_date, ref long out_time)
short: This converts a date and time in one time zone to the corresponding date and time in a different time zone.

name: date.to.inputstr$
syntax: function string date.to.inputstr$ (long dayno, string format(7), long length)
short: This converts a specified number of days since 01-01-0001 to a date input string.

name: date.to.num
syntax: function long date.to.num (long yearno, long monthno, long month_dayno)
short: This returns the number of days since 01-01-0001 for a specified year, month, and day of the month.

name: date.to.utc
syntax: function domain ttutc date.to.utc (long yearno, long monthno, long month_dayno, long hours, long minutes, long seconds)
short: This converts the specified local date and time to UTC long format. Input values must be in the signed 32-bit value range.

name: date.with.timezone.info.to.utc
syntax: function domain ttutc date.with.timezone.info.to.utc (long yearno, long monthno, long month_dayno, long hours, long minutes, long seconds, long utcdiff)
short: This converts the specified local date and time to UTC long format. For this conversion it will NOT use the timezone of the user, but the difference in seconds to UTC as supplied in the variable utcdiff. Input values must be in the signed 32-bit value range.

name: date constant
short: No description available

name: dates, times, time zones
short: No description available

name: db.after.delete
short: This hook is called in case data is deleted, either by the user pressing the delete button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.destroy.object() or dal.destroy() is called.

name: db.after.insert
short: This hook is called in case data is inserted, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.new.object() or dal.new() is called.

name: db.after.update
short: This hook is called in case data is updated, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.save.object() or dal.update() is called.

name: db.before.delete
short: This hook is called in case data is deleted, either by the user pressing the delete button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.destroy.object() or dal.destroy() is called.

name: db.before.insert
short: This hook is called in case data is inserted, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.new.object() or dal.new() is called.

name: db.before.update
short: This hook is called in case data is updated, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the function dal.update() .

name: db.bind
syntax: function long db.bind (string table_name(9) [, ref string buffer(.)] [, long comp_nr])
short: This creates a pointer to a specified table. It returns a table ID that you use in other database calls to identify the table. The pointer is to a table with a particular company number and record buffer. You can create additional pointers to the same table by calling the function with a different company number and/or record buffer.

name: db.blob.append
syntax: function long db.blob.append (const string blob.locator, long num.bytes, const string bytes.array [, long mode] [, long eflag])
short: This function appends data to the BLOB, to which the BLOB locator refers. Before calling db.blob.append() , the BLOB locator must be read from the database.

name: db.blob.append.xml
syntax: function long db.blob.append.xml (const string blob.locator, long xml.node [, long mode] [, long eflag])
short: This function appends data from an XML tree to the BLOB, to which the BLOB locator refers. Before calling db.blob.append.xml() , the BLOB locator must be read from the database.

name: db.blob.clear
syntax: function long db.blob.clear (const string blob.locator [, long mode] [, long eflag])
short: This function clears the BLOB, to which the BLOB locator refers. Before calling db.blob.clear() , the BLOB locator must be read from the database.

name: db.blob.read
syntax: function long db.blob.read (const string blob.locator, long offset, long num.bytes, ref string bytes.array, ref long num.bytes.read)
short: This function reads data from the BLOB, to which the BLOB locator refers. Before calling db.blob.read() , the BLOB locator must be read from the database. For example, the following code retrieves the BLOB locator that refers to a certain picture from a table, and then retrieves the first 256 bytes of the picture:

name: db.blob.read.xml
syntax: function long db.blob.read.xml (const string blob.locator, long offset, ref long bytes.read, ref long xml.node, ref string error, long whitespacehandling)
short: This function reads data from the BLOB, to which the BLOB locator refers, and parses it to an XML tree. Before calling db.blob.read.xml() , the BLOB locator must be read from the database. For example, the following code retrieves the BLOB locator that refers to a certain picture from a table, and then retrieves the first 256 bytes of the picture:

name: db.blob.read.xml.ns
syntax: function long db.blob.read.xml.ns (const string blob.locator, long offset, ref long bytes.read, ref long xml.node, ref string error, long whitespacehandling)
short: This function reads data from the BLOB, to which the BLOB locator refers, and parses it to an XML tree. Before calling db.blob.read.xml.ns() , the BLOB locator must be read from the database. For example, the following code retrieves the BLOB locator that refers to a certain picture from a table, and then retrieves the first 256 bytes of the picture:

name: db.blob.size
syntax: function long db.blob.size (const string blob.locator, ref long num.bytes)
short: This function retrieves the size of the BLOB, to which the BLOB locator refers. Before calling db.blob.size() , the BLOB locator must be read from the database. For example, the following code retrieves the BLOB locator that refers to a certain picture from a table, and then retrieves the size of the picture:

name: db.change.order
syntax: function long db.change.order (long table_id, long index_nr [, long compnr])
short: This makes a specified index the current index. After this action, the record pointer is undefined.

name: db.check.restricted
syntax: function long db.check.restricted (long table_id, long mode, ref string message(256))
short: In a table definition, it is possible to set restrictions on update and/or delete actions for records that are referenced by other tables. These restrictions mean that you cannot delete and/or update the primary key that is referenced by another table. This function checks whether there are references to the current record with delete and/or update restrictions. This function can take a long time to complete if no reference counter is kept (lookup mode).

name: db.check.row.changed
short: This function checks whether a record that has been delayed locked and changed by the current process has been changed by another process ("user"). It does not check whether the row has been modified in the current process. In a way it answers the question: "If I would update the current record now, would I get the infamous EROWCHANGED error?"

name: db.check.row.dlocked
short: This checks whether the row, identified by its primary key columns is delayed locked or not. If the row is already locked, the function returns the dlock number of the row. This function can result in a considerable performance gain as it eradicates the need for multiple reads of the same record.

name: db.check.row.domains
syntax: function long db.check.row.domains (long table_id, ref string fld_name)
short: This checks whether the current record of a specified table conforms to the domain definitions in the data dictionary. All fields of the record are checked in turn until an error occurs. The function returns when the first error is encountered.

name: db.clear.table
syntax: function long db.clear.table (long table_id [, long flag] [, long comp_nr])
short: This deletes all data from a specified table. Reference counters are automatically updated.

name: db.columns.to.record
short: The record buffer of a table is used for reading records from, or writing records to, that table. When you bind to a table (see db.bind() ) and specify that the default record buffer is to be used, the contents of the table fields are automatically copied to the buffer. This does not happen when you specify a record buffer other than the default buffer.

name: db.create.table
syntax: function long db.create.table (long table_id, long compnr)
short: This creates a new database table.

name: db.curr
syntax: function long db.curr (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads the current record from a specified table.

name: db.delete
syntax: function long db.delete (long table_id [, long mode] [, long eflag])
short: This deletes the current record. The record pointer is not changed, so the current record is undefined after the record has been deleted.

name: db.drop.table
syntax: function long db.drop.table (long table_id [, long flag] [, long comp_nr])
short: This deletes a specified table. Data and indices associated with the table are also deleted. Reference counters are automatically updated.

name: db.eq
syntax: function long db.eq (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads from a specified table the record whose key value equals a certain predefined value. Before calling db.eq() , you must assign the required value to the key field. For example, the following code retrieves the item with item number 001 from the items table:

name: db.error
short: Use this to retrieve the error code returned by the most recent database action. If you specify a table ID, the function retrieves the most recent error code returned by an action on that table.

name: db.error.message
short: Some errors returned by a database action have an associated error message. This message provides additional information about the error. Use the db.error.message() function to retrieve the error message (if any) associated with the most recent error code returned by a database action.

name: db.first
syntax: function long db.first (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads the first record from a specified table. It uses the current index to search the table.

name: db.flush
short: All buffered actions are flushed to the database.

name: db.ge
syntax: function long db.ge (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads from a specified table the record whose key value is greater than or equal to a certain predefined value. Before calling db.ge() , you must assign the required value to the key field. For example:

name: db.get.error.bypass
short: This function returns the current value of error.bypass and, optionally, the current value of error.bypass.with.retry. It is allowed to call this function without having called the db.set.error.bypass.on() function.

name: db.get.physical.compnr
syntax: function long db.get.physical.compnr (string tblname, long logical.compnr)
short: Use this to retrieve the physical company number for the specified table ( tblname ) and logical company number ( logical.compnr ).

name: db.gt
syntax: function long db.gt (long table_id, long lock)
short: This reads from a specified table the record whose key value is greater than a certain predefined value. Before calling db.gt() , you must assign the required value to the key field. For example:

name: db.indexinfo
syntax: function long db.indexinfo (long table_id, long index_nr, ref long index_info(32, 3), ref long indexparts, ref boolean indexdups, ref boolean indexactive)
short: This returns information about the parts of a specified index.

name: db.insert
syntax: function long db.insert (long table_id [, long mode] [, long eflag])
short: This adds a new record to a specified table. The record pointer does not change.

name: db.last
syntax: function long db.last (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads the last record from a specified table. It uses the current index to search the table.

name: db.le
syntax: function long db.le (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads from a specified table the record whose key value is less than or equal to a certain predefined value. Before calling db.le() , you must assign the required value to the key field. For example:

name: db.lock.table
short: This locks a specified table. Other users cannot then write to or delete the table or any parts of the table. Nor can they lock the table or any parts of the table. The lock is released by commit.transaction() or abort.transaction()

name: db.lt
syntax: function long db.lt (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads from a specified table the record whose key value is less than a certain predefined value. Before calling db.lt() , you must assign the required value to the key field. For example:

name: db.max.retry
short: This function returns the value of the MAX_RETRY resource setting, which indicates how often the system may return to a retry point as a result of an abort in an update action.

name: db.next
syntax: function long db.next (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads the next record from a specified table. It uses the current index to search the table. If there is no current record, the function returns an error message.

name: db.nr.indices
syntax: function long db.nr.indices (long table_id, ref long nr_indices)
short: This returns the number of indices that exist on a specified table.

name: db.nr.rows
syntax: function long db.nr.rows (long table_id, ref long nr_rows [, long comp_nr])
short: This returns the number of rows that a specified table contains.

name: db.permission
syntax: function long db.permission (long table_id, string field [, ref string buffer])
short: Use this to check the access permissions that a user has to a specified table or table field.

name: db.prev
syntax: function long db.prev (long table_id [, long lock])
short: This reads the previous record from a specified table. It uses the current index to search the table. If there is no current record, the function returns an error message.

name: db.record.changed
syntax: function boolean db.record.changed (long table_id [, long size])
short: Tests whether the current value of the record buffer belonging to the given table id has changed since the last call of db.store.record() .

name: db.record.to.columns
short: When you bind to a table (see db.bind() and specify that the default record buffer is to be used, the contents of the buffer are automatically copied to the table fields in your program script. This does not happen when you specify a record buffer other than the default buffer.

name: db.ref.handle.mode
syntax: function long db.ref.handle.mode (string table_name, long mode)
short: Use this to check whether a full table scan (FTS) is necessary during delete or update operations. Delete and update operations can take a long time to complete when the table is referenced by other tables but no reference counter is kept (cascade, nullify, or lookup mode). When there is no index on the foreign key in the child table, normally a full table scan is required to search for referring records.

name: db.restore.record
short: This restores the record of the given table that was stored previously with db.store.record() . Also the table's field values will be restored.

name: db.retry.hit
short: Use this to check whether the client database layer has returned to a retry point. You must set the retry point by using db.retry.point() before you call db.retry.hit(). See also Database handling overview .

name: db.retry.point
short: This sets a retry point for the current transaction. The program returns to this point if an error occurs during the transaction; the transaction is then retried. When you include a retry point for a transaction, you must set it before the start of the transaction.

name: db.row.length
syntax: function long db.row.length (long table_id, ref long row_length)
short: Use this to retrieve the length of records in a specified table.

name: db.set.error.bypass.off
short: This function resets the values of error.bypass and error.bypass.with.retry to the previous values. The function must be called exactly once for each time the function db.set.error.bypass.on() is called. Calling this function more often than calling db.set.error.bypass.on() is a programming error and results in a fatal error.

name: db.set.error.bypass.on
short: This function flushes all buffered database actions in the current transaction before setting the error.bypass and error.bypass.with.retry flags. If any of the database actions results in a retryable error a jump is made to the db.retry.point(). If any of the actions results in a fatal error, then the process is terminated. If any error occurs then the values of error.bypass and error.bypass.with.retry are not modified. After successful flush, sets the value of error.bypass to true. The value of error.bypass.with.retry is set to the value specified by the with.retry argument, or to false if the argument is not given.

name: db.set.to.default
short: This sets bound variables in the program script to the default values defined in the data dictionary.

name: db.store.record
syntax: function void db.store.record (long table_id [, long size])
short: Creates a copy of the current value of the record buffer belonging to the given table id. Later on this copied value can be restored by calling db.restore.record() .

name: db.unbind
short: This deletes the specified table pointer.

name: db.update
syntax: function long db.update (long table_id [, long mode] [, long eflag])
short: This rewrites the current record. When updating a record with this function, you are permitted to update the primary key of the record.

name: dbcm.checked.out.objects.present
syntax: function boolean dbcm.checked.out.objects.present (long comp [, string tbl.name$])
short: Checks if checked-out objects exist in given company and (if provided) given table.

name: dbcm.find.object.by.workflow.id
syntax: function long dbcm.find.object.by.workflow.id (const string wf.id$, ref string toid$)
short: Finds a checked-out business object using the given workflow instance id. When the object is found, the Typed Object Id is returned.

name: dbcm.get.cm.action$
short: Retrieves the Change Management action id of the Object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id.

name: dbcm.get.cm.status
short: Retrieves the Change Management status of the Object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id.

name: dbcm.get.functional.id$
syntax: function string dbcm.get.functional.id$ (const string toid$ [, long comp])
short: Retrieves the functional object id for a checked-out object.

name: dbcm.get.object.action$
short: Returns the currently selected object action (as selected with dbcm.select.object.action() ), or an empty string in case no object action has been selected.

name: dbcm.get.object.id$
short: Returns the id of the currently selected object instance (as selected with dbcm.select.object.instance() ), or an empty string in case no object instance is selected or if a previously selected object instance is out of scope.

name: dbcm.get.object.type$
short: Returns the currently selected object type (as selected with dbcm.select.object.type() ), or an empty string in case no object type is selected or if the previously selected object type is out of scope.

name: dbcm.get.rcd.action
short: Retrieves the CM Action of the current record of the given table id.

name: dbcm.get.rcd.prst
short: Retrieves the checked-in value of the workflow application status field (identified by dbcm.get.app.status.field() )of business object related to the current record buffer.

name: dbcm.get.rcd.toid$
short: Retrieves the Typed Object ID of the current record of the given table id.

name: dbcm.get.root.table$
short: Returns the root table of an either an Object or an Object Type.

name: dbcm.get.type.name
syntax: function long dbcm.get.type.name (const string tbl.name$, ref string obj.type$)
short: Returns the object type for the given table, as defined in the Object Configuration Management model for the current package combination.

name: dbcm.get.user
syntax: function long dbcm.get.user (const string toid$, ref string user$)
short: Retrieves the user who last 'touched' the Business object which is identified by the specified type object id.

name: dbcm.get.workflow.definition
syntax: function long dbcm.get.workflow.definition (const string toid$, ref string wf.def$)
short: Retrieves the workflow definition id of the checked-out business object which is identified by the specified Typed Object Id.

name: dbcm.get.workflow.id
syntax: function long dbcm.get.workflow.id (const string toid$, ref string wf.id$)
short: Retrieves the workflow instance id of the checked-out business object which is identified by the specified Typed Object Id.

name: dbcm.is.action.active
short: Tests whether the currently selected object action (as selected with dbcm.select.object.action() ) is active according to the Object Configuration Management deployment.

name: dbcm.is.cm.active
syntax: function boolean dbcm.is.cm.active (const string tbl.name$ [, long comp])
short: Tests whether Change Management is active for the given table (and optionally the company number), as defined in the Object Configuration Management deployment for the current package combination.

name: dbcm.is.root.table
short: Tests whether the given table is an Object Type root table, as defined in the Object Configuration Management model for the current package combination.

name: dbcm.object.check.out.is.being.undone
short: Checks if the check-out of the specified object is being undone. That is, if the dbcm.undo.check.out.object() function is in progress.

name: dbcm.object.is.being.checked.in
short: Tests whether the business object identified by the specified Typed Object Id is being checked-in.

name: dbcm.object.is.checked.in
short: Tests whether the business object identified by the specified Typed Object Id is checked-in.

name: dbcm.object.is.checked.out
short: Tests whether the business object identified by the specified Typed Object Id is checked-out.

name: dbcm.object.remains.checked.in
syntax: function long dbcm.object.remains.checked.in (ref long tbl.id, long cmac, ref boolean b.eval)
short: Tests whether the business object related to the current record buffer remains checked in.

name: dbcm.read.object
syntax: function long dbcm.read.object (const string toid$ [, long comp])
short: Reads and makes the business object current, based on the the given typed object id. In case the business object consists of multiple tables, the root table is accessed.

name: dbcm.reject
syntax: function long dbcm.reject (const string toid$, const string reason$)
short: Rejects any changes and/or actions done to the checked-out business object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id and sets the given reason for rejecting.

name: dbcm.select.checked.in.mode
short: Sets the checked in mode

name: dbcm.select.object.action
short: Selects the specified object action.

name: dbcm.select.object.instance
short: Selects the specified Object instance.

name: dbcm.select.object.type
short: Selects the specified Object Type.

name: dbcm.set.approved
short: Assigns the Approval Received status to the checked-out Business Object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id. Afterwards the business object will be checked-in.

name: dbcm.set.draft
short: Assigns the Draft status to the checked-out Business Object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id.

name: dbcm.set.not.started
short: Assigns the Not Started status to the checked-in Business Object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id and has the Approved status. This indicates that a previous request to recall the already started workflow process has been processed and acknowledged.

name: dbcm.set.object.type
short: Sets the specified Object Type in a 4GL session.

name: dbcm.set.rcd.toid
syntax: function void dbcm.set.rcd.toid (long tbl.id, const string toid$)
short: Sets the given Typed Object ID in the (default) record buffer the given table.

name: dbcm.set.recalled
short: Assigns the Draft (Revision) status to the checked-out Business Object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id. This indicates that a previous request to recall the already started workflow process has been processed and acknowledged.

name: dbcm.set.submitted
syntax: function long dbcm.set.submitted (const string toid$, const string wf.id$)
short: Sets the workflow instance id of the checked-out business object that is identified by the given Typed Object Id. This indicates that a previous submit has been confirmed and that the Workflow has been started.

name: dbcm.set.workflow.definition
