name: gbf.update.object
short: All but gbf.update.object() are defines and these functions are defined as:

name: get_function
syntax: function long get_function (long dll_id, string funct_name)
short: This loads a specified function from a previously loaded DLL. It returns an identification number for the function.

name: get.active.satellite
short: This function returns the active satellite and can be used in UI scripts for multi main table controller sessions to determine which satellite is currently active. It can be used after the first satellite has been started; it cannot be used in the before.program section.

name: get.appl.data.company
syntax: function long get.appl.data.company (string package(2), string application.id(30) Application Identifier see ttadv4589m000)
short: This function read the application data company for a user. First a search for the setting of the current user is done. If there is no setting for the current user available, the generic settings for the environment is read.

name: get.arg.type
short: This function returns the type of the specified argument.

name: get.argc
short: This function returns the number of arguments supplied to the currently executing function (i.e. the function in which get.argc() is called). Once you know this number, you can read from and write to particular arguments using the other functions.

name: get.bi.server.location
short: This function returns the location of the BI Server linked to the current package combination. If the current package combination has no specific BI server linked to it, the function returns the BI server that is not linked to any package combination.

name: get.boolean.arg
short: The function get.boolean.arg() returns the value of the specified argument, converted to a boolean.

name: get.bw.hostname
short: This returns the hostname of the bw client (if available)

name: get.bw.ip.address
short: This returns the ip-address of the system of the BW, WebUI or LN UI client (if available)

name: get.bw.username
short: This returns the Windows username of the user that started the BW client

name: get.client.directory
short: Deprecated. This function returns the folder, on the local client, related to a given id. In case of Baan Windows this is the folder that is defined by the ${id} environment variable on the local client. In case of WebUI, this is a folder, on the client machine on which the Internet Browser is running, related to the id.

name: get.client.hostname
short: This returns the hostname of the local client (if available). In case of Baan Windows this is the client machine on which BW is running. In case of WebUI, this is the client machine on which the Internet Browser is running.

name: get.client.ip.address
short: Get the IP address of the local client. In case of Baan Windows this is the client machine on which BW is running. In case of WebUI, this is the client machine on which the Internet Browser is running

name: get.client.timezone
short: This returns the current Windows Timezone name of the local client (if available).

name: get.col
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.company
short: This returns the name of the current company.

name: get.compnr
short: This returns the ID number of the current company.

name: get.cp
syntax: function void get.cp (ref long x, ref long y)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.current.field.label
syntax: function long get.current.field.label (const string fname, long element, ref string label1 to label3)
short: This retrieves the current label text associated with the specified field. The function is relevant to dynamic forms only.

name: get.display.data
short: This retrieves information about the display server. It stores the information in the array server_data . The predefined constant SRVMAXSIZE indicates the maximum size of the array.

name: get.double.arg
short: The function get.double.arg() returns the value of the specified argument, converted to a double.

name: get.field.label
syntax: function long get.field.label (const string fname, long element, ref string label1 to label3)
short: This retrieves the label text associated with the specified field. The function is relevant to dynamic forms only.

name: get.financial.compnr
short: This returns the ID number of the current financial company.

name: get.first.keyfields.object
short: Get the first key fields object in this collection.

name: get.image.path
syntax: function string get.image.path (string guid, long sequ [, string tablename] [, long width] [, long height])
short: This function will get the full path for an image.

name: get.indexed.var
syntax: function [long] get.indexed.var (long processno, string variable_name, ref void destination, long dim1 [, dim2, dim3, dim4 ])
short: This retrieves the value of the specified variable. It is the same as get.var() except that it enables retrieval of individual array elements.

name: get.initial.field.label
syntax: function long get.initial.field.label (const string fname, long element, ref string label1 to label3)
short: This retrieves the initial label text associated with the specified field. The function is relevant to dynamic forms only.

name: get.keyfields.table
short: Return the name of the table associated with the passed key fields object.

name: get.local.filename
short: Deprecated. This function returns the last client filename used by the function server2client() or client2server() . When the last server2client() or client2server() function failed, this function will return an empty string.

name: get.logistic.compnr
short: This returns the ID number of the current logistic company.

name: get.long.arg
short: The function get.long.arg() returns the value of the specified argument, converted to a long.

name: get.long.byte.count
short: This function returns the value BitCountOfLong /8, that is the amount of bytes used to store a variable of type long .

name: get.next.keyfields.object
short: Get the next key fields object in a collection.

name: get.num.keyfields.object
short: Get the number of key field objects in this collection.

name: get.numformat.symbols
syntax: function long get.numformat.symbols (ref string decimal$, ref string grouping$)
short: Determine which decimal sign and thousand separator are currently being used.

name: get.object
syntax: function long get.object (long object_id, long attribute, void value, long size)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.pgrp
short: This returns the identification number of the process group to which the specified process belongs. If you specify an unknown process ID, -1 is returned.

name: get.pixmap.info
syntax: function long get.pixmap.info (ref string buffer, ref long num_colors, ref long width, ref long height)
short: This retrieves information about a picture, in .gif format, that has been read with the seq.read() function. It returns the number of colors in the picture and the picture's width and height. When a picture is used in an object, the width and height values are necessary for determining the amount of memory that must be allocated for the picture.

name: get.prev.value
short: This function retrieves the field's previous value. The previous value is converted to the type of the output parameter.

name: get.resource$
short: This function returns the value associated with the given bshell resource of the current user. Resources are specified in the u<user> file in the '$BSE/lib/user' directory, but also in the files '$BSE/lib/defaults/<logical_name_of_bshell>' and '$BSE/lib/defaults/all'. The logical name of the bshell is the name you specify for the Bshell in BW.

name: get.row
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.screen.defaults
short: The save.defaults standard command enables users to save the current field values of a session as the default values for that session. The get.screen.defaults() function displays the default values for all fields on all forms of the current session. It is often used at the start of update or print programs, where the user must specify some parameters before executing the session.

name: get.session.permission
short: Retrieves the permission of the session ( session ) in a bit pattern (see return values). Each of the listed 'return values' represents one bit. Multiple values can be bitwise OR-ed into one pattern and returned by the function. In cases of internal errors in the function, the value SESSION_NO_PERMISSION will be returned.

name: get.string.arg
short: The function get.string.arg() returns the value of the specified argument, converted to a string.

name: get.sub.object
syntax: function long get.sub.object (long object, long sub_object_id [, long attribute] [, ref void value] [, ref long size])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.tenant.id
short: Returns the tenant id of the tenant under which the user is logged in. If the user is not logged in under a tenant then id "infor" is returned.

name: get.time.zone
short: Returns the current time zone. The program must supply a buffer of at least a size of 50 to store the result, otherwise the result is truncated.

name: get.tree.default
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.tree.node.dpress
syntax: function void get.tree.node.dpress (ref long event, ref long process_id, ref string node_id)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.tree.node.press
syntax: function void get.tree.node.press (ref long event, ref long process_id, ref string node_id)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.tree.push.button
syntax: function void get.tree.push.button (ref long event, ref long process_id, ref string button_id, ref string node_id)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: get.ui.mode
short: This returns a long value that indicates the UI mode in which this session is running. The possible values are:

name: get.user.default
syntax: function boolean get.user.default (const string session.code, const string field, ref string field.value)
short: Returns the default value for the passed sessioncode, field combination. The default is retrieved using the current user and current company.

name: get.utc.byte.count
short: This function returns the value ByteCountOfUtc , that is the amount of bytes used when a UTC long format value is stored in or retrieved from a sequence of bytes.

name: get.var
syntax: function [long] get.var (long processno, string variable_name, ref void destination)
short: This retrieves the value of the specified variable. The variable can be a single variable of any type or an array.

name: get.window.attrs
syntax: function long get.window.attrs (long wind_id, ref long attrs(WINMAXSIZE))
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: getcwd
short: This returns the current path as a string. Note that on Windows NT systems, pathnames can include drive letters (for example, c:/baan/bin ).

name: getenv$
short: This returns the value of a specified environment variable of the operating system. It returns an empty string if the variable is not available.

name: grab.mwindow
syntax: function void grab.mwindow (long mwindow, long process_group)
short: This specifies the process group to which a particular main window must send its events. After calling this function, all events that occur in the main window are sent to the process group. grab.mwindow() is mainly used immediately after creation of a new process group.

name: group.exists
short: This checks whether a specified group is defined on the system. Whether group names are case-sensitive or case-insensitive is a system-dependent feature.

name: group.invisible
short: This hides the specified group completely, including all associated fields, labels, and subgroups. The group.nr argument specifies the group number, as defined in the form editor. The group cannot be made visible again.

name: halfadj
syntax: function double halfadj (double value, long diga)
short: This rounds a given value to a specified number of decimal places.

name: header.value
short: Returns the HTTP header value of an http.header object.

name: hex2bytes
syntax: function long hex2bytes (const string hex, ref string bytes)
short: Converts a string of hexadecimal characters to bytes.

name: hide.selection.column
short: This hides the selection column in thin-client sessions completely.

name: hostname$
short: This returns the hostname of the local machine.

name: http.connect
short: Sends a CONNECT HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.delete
short: Sends a DELETE HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.get
short: Sends a GET HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.head
short: Sends a HEAD HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.header.name
short: Returns the HTTP header name of an http.header object.

name: http.header.next
short: Returns an http.header object's next http.header object.

name: http.headerlist.add
syntax: function void http.headerlist.add (long object.headerlist, const string name, const string value)
short: Adds a name-value HTTP header pair to an http.headerlist object.

name: http.headerlist.add_list
syntax: function void http.headerlist.add_list (long object.headerlist, long list)
short: Adds the contents of another http.headerlist to an http.headerlist object. When an HTTP header already exists, it is overwritten.

name: http.headerlist.delete
short: Deletes an http.headerlist object.

name: http.headerlist.first
short: Returns the first http.header object of an http.headerlist. This can be used to iterate all HTTP headers in the list.

name: http.headerlist.get
short: Gets the HTTP header with the specified name from an http.headerlist object. The HTTP header is returned as an http.header object.

name: http.headerlist.new
short: Constructs a new http.headerlist object. It is possible to initialize the http.headerlist object with HTTP header name-value pairs.

name: http.options
short: Sends an OPTIONS HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.patch
short: Sends a PATCH HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.post
short: Sends a POST HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.put
short: Sends a PUT HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.queryparamlist.add
syntax: function void http.queryparamlist.add (long object.queryparamlist, const string name, const string value)
short: Adds a name-value query parameter pair to an http.queryparamlist object.

name: http.queryparamlist.add_list
syntax: function void http.queryparamlist.add_list (long object.queryparamlist, long name)
short: Adds the contents of another http.queryparamlist to an http.queryparamlist object.

name: http.queryparamlist.delete
short: Deletes an http.queryparamlist object.

name: http.queryparamlist.new
short: Constructs a new http.queryparamlist object. It is possible to initialize the http.queryparamlist object with name-value query parameter pairs. When the http.queryparamlist object is passed to eg. http.get(), the name and value pairs will be used to build a url-encoded querystring. The querystring is then appended to the url after the '?' sign. Example:

name: http.response.bodystream
short: Returns the body stream id of the response. It is not necessary to rewind the stream, the position is already at the start of the data retrieved from the server. In case a stream id was passed using the HTTP_RESPONSE_BODY option, this returns that stream id.

name: http.response.curlcode
short: Returns the cURL code stored in the response object. A cURL code of 0 means OK. Any other code indicates that the HTTP request did not succeed. Use function http.response.error_message() to retrieve an english description of the error.

name: http.response.delete
short: Deletes an http.response object. If the response object contains a body stream that was automatically opened, the stream will be closed as well.

name: http.response.error_message
short: Call this to retrieve an error message in case there was an error while sending the request. In case the cURL code is zero (0), this returns "No error"

name: http.response.headerlist
short: Returns the list of HTTP headers received from the server.

name: http.response.request_method
short: Returns the HTTP method of the request for which the response was created. The HTTP method and the URL are stored to identify to what request the response object belongs

name: http.response.request_url
short: Returns the URL of the request for which the response was created. The HTTP method and the URL are stored to identify to what request the response object belongs

name: http.response.statuscode
short: Returns the HTTP response statuscode, like 200, 404 or 500, etc.

name: http.response.statustext
short: Returns the HTTP response status text, like "OK" (for 200), "Not Found" (for 404), "Internal Server Error" (for 500), etc

name: http.routeparamlist.add
syntax: function void http.routeparamlist.add (long object.routeparamlist, const string name, const string value)
short: Adds a name-value route parameter pair to an http.routeparamlist object.

name: http.routeparamlist.add_list
syntax: function void http.routeparamlist.add_list (long object.routeparamlist, long list)
short: Adds the contents of another http.routeparamlist to an http.routeparamlist object. If route parameters already exist, they are replaced.

name: http.routeparamlist.delete
short: Deletes an http.routeparamlist object.

name: http.routeparamlist.new
short: Constructs a new http.routeparamlist object. It is possible to initialize the http.routeparamlist object with name-value route parameter pairs. When the http.routeparamlist object is passed to eg. http.get(), the name and value pairs will be used to fill in route parameters in the url. Example:

name: http.send
syntax: function long http.send (const string method, const string url, ... )
short: Sends an HTTP request to a URL.

name: http.trace
short: Sends a TRACE HTTP request to a URL.

name: import
syntax: function [long] import (string variable_name, ref void value)
short: Import retrieves the value of the specified variable of the parent process. This parent process is not always identified by the variable parent in case of dynamic index switching. When using dynamic index switching, the parent process is sometimes killed and restarted. This causes a different parent process, whereas the variable parent is not updated.

name: import.4gl.var
syntax: function void import.4gl.var (string variable_name, ref void value)
short: Imports a 'predefined' 4GL variable. Like number.of.marks which is actually a macro.

name: ims.clearerr
short: Resets the error and end-of-byte-array indicator.

name: ims.close
short: Closes the byte array. This is done automaticallly when you leave your process.

name: ims.eof
short: Detects if the end of the byte array is reached.

name: ims.error
short: Detects if an error has occurred while reading from or writing to the byte array.

name: ims.getc$
short: Returns the next character from the byte array.

name: ims.getproperties
syntax: function long ims.getproperties (long bytearray, ref string buffer [, ref long size])
short: Returns the properties of the byte array.

name: ims.gets
syntax: function long ims.gets (ref string line, long size, long bytearray [, long skip.mode] [, long there.was.more])
short: Reads characters from the byte array into a buffer ( line ).

name: ims.openfba
syntax: function long ims.openfba (string buffer, long size, string type)
short: Opens a Fixed Byte Array (FBA).

name: ims.openvba
syntax: function long ims.openvba (string type [, long initialSize] [, long increment])
short: Opens a Variable Byte Array (VBA).

name: ims.putc$
syntax: function string ims.putc$ (string char, long bytearray)
short: Writes a character to the current position in the byte array.

name: ims.puts
syntax: function long ims.puts (string line, long bytearray)
short: Writes a line (and a new-line character) to the byte array.

name: ims.r.long
short: Reads a 32-bit value from the byte array. The 4 bytes read from the byte array are interpreted as the 32-bit two�s complement representation of a signed integer value.

name: ims.r.short
short: Reads a 16-bit value from the byte array. The 2 bytes read from the byte array are interpreted as the 16-bit binary representation of an unsigned integer value.

name: ims.r.utc
syntax: function long ims.r.utc (long bytearray [, long byte.count])
short: Reads a specified amount of bytes from the byte array. The bytes read from the byte array are interpreted as the two�s complement representation of a signed integer value.

name: ims.read
syntax: function long ims.read (ref string buffer, long nrBytes, long bytearray)
short: Reads a number of bytes from the byte array into a buffer.

name: ims.rewind
short: Sets the position in byte array to the beginning.

name: ims.seek
syntax: function long ims.seek (long offset, long opt, long bytearray)
short: Changes the current position within the byte array.

name: ims.setvbaproperties
syntax: function long ims.setvbaproperties (long bytearray, long increment)
short: Sets the properties of the Variable Byte Array (VBA).

name: ims.skip
syntax: function long ims.skip (long nrbytes, long bytearray)
short: Skips forward a number of bytes in the byte array.

name: ims.spool.line
syntax: function long ims.spool.line (ref string line, long bytearray)
short: Spools a line and writes it to the byte array. The characters in the line are copied to the byte array until the last non-white character in the line is encountered. After that, the contents of the line is cleared.

name: ims.tell
short: Returns the current offset within the byte array relative to the begin of the byte array.

name: ims.w.long
syntax: function long ims.w.long (long value, long bytearray)
short: Writes a 32-bit integer value into the byte array.

name: ims.w.short
syntax: function long ims.w.short (long value, long bytearray)
short: Writes a 16-bit integer value into the byte array.

name: ims.w.utc
syntax: function long ims.w.utc (long value, long bytearray [, long byte.count])
short: Writes an integer value into the byte array.

name: ims.write
syntax: function long ims.write (string buffer, long nrBytes, long bytearray)
short: Appends a given number of bytes from the buffer into the byte array, beginning at the current position in the byte array.

name: inherit.object
syntax: function void inherit.object (long process_nr, long object_id)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: input.again
short: After input by a user, this forces the user to input the data again. If there is an input error, it is preferable to use set.input.error() in the check.input subsection for the field.

name: input.to.utc
syntax: function domain ttutc input.to.utc (const string value(), const string format())
short: This converts a string to a local date or local time based on a format.

name: inputfield.invisible
short: This hides the specified field(s) completely. In dynamic sessions, associated label and button are also hidden. To hide a particular element of an array field, append the element number (in parentheses) to the field name. For example: "ttadv301.labl(2)" .

name: inputfield.password
short: This causes input to the specified field to be displayed as asterisks (*). To specify a particular element of an array field, append the element number (in parentheses) to the field name. For example: "ttadv301.labl(2)" .

name: inputfield.visible
short: Use this to redisplay one or more fields made invisible by inputfield.invisible() . To redisplay a particular element of an array field, append the element number (in parentheses) to the field name. For example: "ttadv301.labl(2)" .

name: inputstr.to.date
syntax: function long inputstr.to.date (string inputstr(.), string format(7))
short: This converts a date input string to the number of days since 01-01-0001.

name: inputstr.to.utc
syntax: function domain ttutc inputstr.to.utc (const string date.inputstr(), string date.format(7), const string time.inputstr(), string time.format(7))
short: This converts the specified local date and time input strings to UTC long format.

name: insch$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: insertln$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: int
short: The function int() performs explicit double to long type conversion .

name: is.administrator
short: This checks whether or not the user that is running the bshell has administrator rights on the server that the bshell is running. On UNIX systems, the function returns TRUE if the user has root access to the system. On Windows NT systems, the function returns TRUE if the user belongs to the administrator group.

name: is.composite.child
short: This function checks whether the current session is running as a composite child session or not. This function can be useful when a session can be run in standalone mode and as a child within a composite session. This function can be called from a 4GL-Session or from a GBF session.

name: is.field.invisible
short: This checks whether a specified field is currently visible or invisible. To specify a particular element of an array field, append the element number (in parentheses) to the field name. For example: "ttadv301.labl(2)".

name: is.field.multi.currency
short: This returns whether a specified field is a multi currency field.

name: is.graph.present
short: This function indicates whether there are active graph defined for this session. This function can be used to determine if additional operations/calculations are needed for a graph.

name: is.image.changed
short: This function can be used to check if an image has been changed onto the image field or the image is changed which is not yet saved or discarded.

name: is.image.dropped
short: This function can be used to check if an image has been dropped onto the image field or the image is deleted which is not yet saved or discarded.

name: is.landlord.bse
short: This function returns TRUE if the current BSE is a landlord BSE; FALSE otherwise.

name: is.mmt.controller
short: This function checks whether the current session is running as a multi-main table controller session or not. This function can be usefull when a session can be run in standalone mode or as a controller within a multi-main table session.

name: is.mmt.satellite
short: This function checks whether the current session is running as a multi-main table satellite session or not. This function can be usefull when a session can be run in standalone mode or as a satellite within a multi-main table session.

name: is.multi.tenant.enabled
short: Returns TRUE if the current BSE is multi-tenant enabled; FALSE otherwise.

name: is.rbhp.mode
short: This function can be used to check if this 4GL session is directly started from a Role Based Home Page.

name: is.tenant.bse
short: This function returns TRUE if the current BSE is a tenant BSE; FALSE otherwise.

name: is.view.field
short: This function can be used to check whether a field is currently a view field. This is useful when, for example, the view can be personalized and a total line only makes sense with a specific field in the view.

name: is.webpart.session
short: This function checks whether the current session is running as a primary session in a Workspace WebPart. This function can be useful when a session can be run in different modes.

name: isdigit
short: This function tests whether the supplied string is the textual representation of an integer value.

name: iso.to.utc
syntax: function domain ttutc iso.to.utc (const string iso.string)
short: This converts a string, representing a time in ISO-8601 format into a utc.

name: isspace
short: This tests whether the result of string_expr contains only spaces or is empty.

name: java.destroy.queue
short: Removes a queue, given the queue id. This will also remove all buckets on that queue!!

name: java.execute.static.application.method
syntax: function long java.execute.static.application.method (long Handle, ref string JavaReturnValue, string class.name, string method.name [, void ...])
short: Executes a versioned, dynamically loaded, Java method. These Java mehods can also return a (string) value to the 3 GL.

name: java.execute.static.method.sync
syntax: function long java.execute.static.method.sync (string class.name, string method.name [, void ...]) function long java.execute.static.method.async (string class.name, string method.name [, void ...])
short: Executes a Java static method, with no return type, within the JavaVM.

name: java.get.bucket
syntax: function long java.get.bucket (long Queue.id, ref string body, long length [, ref string header])
short: Retrieves a bucket from the queue (if available). The message is removed from the queue afterwards.

name: java.install.listener
syntax: function long java.install.listener (long Queue.id [, long become.owner])
short: Installs a listener at the Infor ERP Enterprise side. Whenever a message arrives on the queue specified by queue.id, the 3GL process will be notified by an EVT_CHANNEL_EVENT event. For installation of a listener at the Java side, see the Java IQeueListener interface definition.

name: java.load.application
short: Load the most recent version of a Java application and return a handle to be used in subsequent operations. A Java virtual machine (JVM) is started when required (or an existing one is used), see Java VM integration - Infor ERP Enterprise Server 3GL for details.

name: java.lookup.queue
syntax: function long java.lookup.queue (long Queue.id [, ref string header])
short: Checks whether a queue is still valid and, if so, if the queue contains a message. The message is not removed from the queue.

name: java.new.queue
short: Creates a new queue for buckets. Upon return, the new queue.id is returned, or an error code is presented. NOTE: queues are removed automatically if the process that created it (or the process that called java.install.listener(�) on that queue) is finished !! See also the 3GL function java.install.listener.

name: java.put.bucket
syntax: function long java.put.bucket (long Queue.id, string body, long length [, string header])
short: Places a message onto a queue. The message contains a header (of type string) and a body (which can contain any character).

name: java.uninstall.listener
short: Uninstalls a listener at the Infor ERP Enterprise side. All buckets on this queue will remain available. The listener can only be uninstalled by the process that installed the listener.

name: java.unload.application
short: Unloads an application loaded by java.load.application .

name: job.add.field
syntax: function void job.add.field (string fld_name [, long fld_element] [, long fld_type] [, string fld_descr])
short: Save other fields in the jobdata which are not on the form. All form fields are stored in the jobdata.

name: json.add
syntax: function long Json.add (long json, long value)
short: Adds a JSON value at the end of a JSON array.

name: json.addboolean
syntax: function long Json.addBoolean (long json, boolean value)
short: Convenience function for directly adding a 3GL boolean value to a JSON array. The 3GL boolean value is first converted to a JSON boolean value which is then added to the array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.add(json, Json.newBoolean(value))

name: json.addnull
short: Convenience function for adding a JSON null value to a JSON array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.add(json, Json.newNull())

name: json.addnumber
short: Convenience function for directly adding a 3GL long or double value to a JSON array. The 3GL long or double value is first converted to a JSON number value which is then added to the array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.add(json, Json.newNumber(value))

name: json.addstring
syntax: function long Json.addString (long json, string value)
short: Convenience function for directly adding a 3GL string value to a JSON array. The 3GL string value is first converted to a JSON string value which is then added to the array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.add(json, Json.newString(value))

name: json.at
syntax: function long Json.at (long json, long idx)
short: Returns the JSON value that is stored at the specified index in a JSON array.

name: json.boolean
short: Returns the value of a JSON boolean value.

name: json.booleanat
syntax: function boolean Json.booleanAt (long json, long idx)
short: Convenience function for directly returning the 3GL boolean value of the JSON boolean value that is stored at the specified index in a JSON array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.boolean(Json.at(json, idx))

name: json.copy
short: Returns a (deep) copy of a JSON value. In case the JSON value is of type JSON_TYPE_OBJECT or JSON_TYPE_ARRAY, all contained members are copied as well.

name: json.count
short: Returns the number of JSON values stored in a JSON array.

name: json.del
syntax: function void Json.del (long json, string key)
short: Deletes the specified key from a JSON object. The associated JSON value is deleted as well.

name: json.delete
short: Deletes a JSON value. In case the JSON value is of type JSON_TYPE_OBJECT or JSON_TYPE_ARRAY all contained members are deleted as well.

name: json.detach
short: Detaches a JSON value from its parent JSON object or JSON array. After calling this function, the JSON value is no longer a member of its parent. The member of the parent JSON object or array is assigned the JSON null value.

name: json.get
syntax: function long Json.get (long json, string key)
short: Returns the JSON value associated with the specified key of a JSON object.

name: json.getboolean
syntax: function long Json.getBoolean (long json, string key)
short: Convenience function for directly returning the 3GL boolean value of the JSON boolean value associated with the specified key of a JSON object. The function is a shorthand for: Json.boolean(Json.get(json, key))

name: json.getnumber
syntax: function long Json.getNumber (long json, string key)
short: Convenience function for directly returning the 3GL long or double value of the JSON number value associated with the specified key of a JSON object. The function is a shorthand for: Json.number(Json.get(json, key))

name: json.getstring
syntax: function string Json.getString (long json, string key)
short: Convenience function for directly returning the 3GL string value of the JSON string value associated with the specified key of a JSON object. The function is a shorthand for: Json.string(Json.get(json, key))

name: json.has
syntax: function boolean Json.has (long json, string key)
short: Tests whether a JSON object contains the specified key.

name: json.isjson
short: Tests whether parameter 'json' is a JSON value.

name: json.isnull
short: Tests whether a JSON value is a JSON null value.

name: json.iter
short: Returns an iterator which can be used to traverse the members of a JSON object or JSON array. On return the iterator points to the first member.

name: json.iterkey
syntax: function string Json.iterKey (long json, long iter)
short: Returns the key name to which the specified iterator is pointing.

name: json.iternext
syntax: function long Json.iterNext (long json, long iter)
short: Moves the iterator to the next member of a JSON object or JSON array.

name: json.itervalue
syntax: function long Json.iterValue (long json, long iter)
short: Returns the JSon value to which the specified iterator is pointing.

name: json.newarray
short: Creates a new empty JSON array.

name: json.newboolean
short: Creates a new JSON boolean value, containing the passed boolean value.

name: json.newnull
short: Creates a new JSON null value.

name: json.newnumber
short: Creates a new JSON number value, containing the passed long or double value. Internally the value is stored with a precision of 15 digits.

name: json.newobject
short: Creates a new empty JSON object.

name: json.newstring
short: Creates a new JSON string value, containing the passed string value.

name: json.number
short: Returns the value of a JSON number value.

name: json.numberat
syntax: function long Json.numberAt (long json, long idx)
short: Convenience function for directly returning the 3GL long or double value of the JSON number value that is stored at the specified index in a JSON array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.number(Json.at(json, idx))

name: json.path
short: Returns the JSON value in a JSON object or array, which is located at the specified path. The parameters passed to this function determine the path that is chosen to locate the the JSON value. Example:

name: json.put
syntax: function long Json.put (long json, long idx, long value)
short: Puts a JSON value at the specified index in a JSON array. The existing JSON value is deleted and replaced with the new JSON value.

name: json.putboolean
syntax: function long Json.putBoolean (long json, long idx, boolean value)
short: Convenience function for directly putting a 3GL boolean value at the specified index in a JSON array. The 3GL boolean value is first converted to a JSON boolean value which is then put into the array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.put(json, idx, Json.newBoolean(value))

name: json.putnull
syntax: function long Json.putNull (long json, long idx)
short: Convenience function for putting a JSON null value at the specified index in a JSON array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.put(json, idx, Json.newNull())

name: json.putnumber
syntax: function long Json.putNumber (long json, long idx, ... value)
short: Convenience function for directly putting a 3GL long or double value at the specified index in a JSON array. The 3GL long or double value is first converted to a JSON number value which is then put into the array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.put(json, idx, Json.newNumber(value))

name: json.putstring
syntax: function long Json.putString (long json, long idx, string value)
short: Convenience function for directly putting a 3GL string value at the specified index in a JSON array. The 3GL string value is first converted to a JSON string value which is then put into the array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.put(json, idx, Json.newString(value))

name: json.read
syntax: function long Json.read (long stream, ref string errStr [, long options])
short: Reads JSON text from a stream, parses it and creates a JSON value object from it. The stream can be an already opened file, or an in-memory stream. By default:

name: json.readfile
syntax: function long Json.readFile (const string path, ref string errStr [, long options])
short: Reads JSON text from a file, parses it and creates a JSON value object from it. By default:

name: json.readstring
syntax: function long Json.readString (const string jsonStr, ref string errStr [, long options])
short: Reads JSON text from a string, parses it and creates a JSON value object from it. By default:

name: json.set
syntax: function long Json.set (long json, const string key, long value)
short: Associates a JSON value with a key in a JSON object. In case the key does not yet exist, it is created first. In case the key already exists, its current JSON value is deleted and replaced by the new value.

name: json.setboolean
syntax: function long Json.setBoolean (long json, const string key, boolean value)
short: Convenience function for directly associating a 3GL boolean value with a key in a JSON object. The 3GL boolean value is first converted to a JSON boolean value which is then associated with the specified key. The function is a shorthand for: Json.set(json, key, Json.newBoolean(value))

name: json.setnull
syntax: function long Json.setNull (long json, const string key)
short: Convenience function for associating a JSON null value with a key in a JSON object. The function is a shorthand for: Json.set(json, key, Json.newNull())

name: json.setnumber
syntax: function long Json.setNumber (long json, const string key, ... value)
short: Convenience function for directly associating a 3GL long or double value with a key in a JSON object. The 3GL long or double value is first converted to a JSON number value which is then associated with the specified key. The function is a shorthand for: Json.set(json, key, Json.newNumber(value))

name: json.setstring
syntax: function long Json.setString (long json, const string key, const string value)
short: Convenience function for directly associating a 3GL string value with a key in a JSON object. The 3GL string value is first converted to a JSON string value which is then associated with the specified key. The function is a shorthand for: Json.set(json, key, Json.newString(value))

name: json.string
short: Returns the value of a JSON string value.

name: json.stringat
syntax: function string Json.stringAt (long json, long idx)
short: Convenience function for directly returning the 3GL string value of the JSON string value that is stored at the specified index in a JSON array. The function is a shorthand for: Json.string(Json.at(json, idx))

name: json.type
short: Gets the type of a JSON value.

name: json.write
syntax: function long Json.write (long json, long stream [, long options])
short: Writes a JSON value object to a stream as JSON text. This can be an already opened file, or an in-memory stream. By default:

name: json.writefile
syntax: function long Json.writeFile (long json, const string path [, long options])
short: Writes a JSON value object to a file as JSON text. By default:

name: json.writestring
syntax: function long Json.writeString (long json, ref string str [, long options])
short: Writes a JSON value object to a string as JSON text. By default:

name: keyfields.to.object
short: Store the current value of the key fields to the passed key field object.

name: keyin$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: kill
short: This deletes the specified process from the bshell process queue. If the process is in a running state, it is interrupted.

name: kill.pgrp
short: This ends all processes within the specified process group. All windows and graphical parts of the processes are removed.

name: kill.timer
short: This ends a specified timer.

name: l.expr
syntax: function long l.expr (long expr_id [, void value] [, boolean suppressError])
short: Executes (or evaluates) an expression previously compiled by expr.compile() . The result is always converted to a long.

name: last.window
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: len
short: This returns the number of characters in string_expr . For strings declared as FIXED, the total length of the string is returned. For non-fixed strings, the current length is returned. To retrieve the length of FIXED strings, excluding trailing spaces, use strip$() .

name: len.in.bytes
short: This returns the number of bytes in string_expr . In the case of ASCII characters, the number of bytes equals the number of characters. In the case of multibyte characters, each character can consist of one or four bytes.

name: lf$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: load_dll
syntax: function long load_dll (string dll_name [, long overload])
short: This loads a specified DLL.

name: load.byte
short: The function load.byte() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes. The byte read from the string is interpreted as the 8-bit binary representation of an unsigned integer value.

name: load.double
syntax: function double load.double (string record$ [, long swap])
short: The load.byte(), load.short(), load.long(), load.float() and load.double() functions treat the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes, without trying to interpret that sequence of bytes as the encoding of a sequence of characters. Instead, the bytes are interpreted as the encoding of numerical values.

name: load.float
syntax: function double load.float (string record$ [, long swap])
short: The load.byte(), load.short(), load.long(), load.float() and load.double() functions treat the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes, without trying to interpret that sequence of bytes as the encoding of a sequence of characters. Instead, the bytes are interpreted as the encoding of numerical values.

name: load.long
syntax: function long load.long (string record$ [, long endian])
short: The function load.long() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes. The 4 bytes read from the string are interpreted as the 32-bit two�s complement representation of a signed integer value.

name: load.short
syntax: function long load.short (string record$ [, long endian])
short: The function load.short() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes. The 2 bytes read from the string are interpreted as the 16-bit two�s complement representation of a signed integer value.

name: load.utc
syntax: function long load.utc (string record$ [, long endian] [, long byte.count])
short: The function load.utc() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes. The bytes read from the string are interpreted as the two�s complement representation of a signed integer value.

name: local.to.utc
syntax: function long local.to.utc (long local_days, long local_time, ref long utc [, string local_dst])
short: This converts a local date and time to UTC long format. Input values for local date and time must be in the signed 32-bit value range.

name: local.with.timezone.info.to.utc
syntax: function domain ttutc local.with.timezone.info.to.utc (long local_days, long local_time, long utcdiff, ref domain ttutc utc)
short: This converts a local date and time to UTC long format. For the conversion, it will NOT use the timezone of the user, but the difference in seconds to UTC as supplied in the variable utcdiff. Input values for local date and time must be in the signed 32-bit value range.

name: log
short: This computes the natural logarithm of x . The value of x must be greater than zero.

name: log10
short: This computes the base 10 logarithm of x . The value of x must be greater than zero.

name: lower.object
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: lpow
syntax: function long lpow (long x, long y)
short: This computes the value of x raised to the power of y . The y argument must be positive.

name: ltob
short: Cast a long to a boolean.

name: ltoe
short: This returns the named constant corresponding to a specified numeric code. The numeric code represents one of the values in an enumerated domain.

name: lval
short: This function performs explicit string to long type conversion . If the resulting value is within the limits of the signed BitCountOfLong -bit range, that value is returned. Otherwise, the concerned bound is returned.

name: make.current
short: This reads the current main table record and displays it on screen. Calling this function is similar to calling execute(find.data), except that if the specified record is not present, make.current() does not read the next record.

name: make.path.absolute
short: Makes path absolute given in path_name . It gives the full path back also in path_name .

name: map.object
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: map.window
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: mark.handler
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: mark.occ
short: This marks the specified occurrence with a reverse bar, makes the marked record the current record in the database, and sets the predefined variable actual.occ to the marked occurrence.

name: max
short: No description available

name: mb.cast.to.str$
short: This function converts a specified string to a single-byte string. The content of the string remains the same.

name: mb.cast$
short: This function converts a specified string to a multibyte string. The content of the string remains the same.

name: mb.char
short: This function tests if a specified character code represents a multibyte character. It is mainly used in conjunction with the next.event() function, which returns a character as a long value.

name: mb.char.info
short: This function identifies the character set to which a TSS Encoding character belongs. It returns the character set ID for the first character in the specified string.

name: mb.coerce.to.sb
syntax: function long mb.coerce.to.sb (ref string string$ [, long setid])
short: This function converts a string from the TSS Encoding character set to the external, native character set, assuring that each resulting character is a single byte. By default, the setting of the current user locale (singlebyte or multibyte environment) or the installation locale (Unicode environment) determines the character set to which the string is converted. Code features in the string are skipped.

name: mb.display
syntax: function long mb.display (string string_expr, ref string substr$, long space [, long flags])
short: This function returns that part of a specified string that fits in a specified display space. The substring is equal to the source string if the source string fits in the display space. If one or more characters do not fit in the display space, a ghost character (default is >) is appended to the substring.

name: mb.export.raw
syntax: function long mb.export.raw (ref string target$, string source$ [, long setid])
short: This function converts a string from the TSS Encoding character set to the external, native character set. By default, the setting of the current locale determines the character set to which the string is converted. This function is almost identical to mb.export$(), but in contrast to that function, no special conversion is done for code features in source$.

name: mb.export$
syntax: function long mb.export$ (ref string target$, string source$ [, long setid])
short: This function converts a string from the TSS Encoding character set to the external, native character set. By default, the setting of the current locale determines the character set to which the string is converted. Code features in the string are skipped.

name: mb.hasbidi
short: Deprecated. This function is supported for backward compatibility reasons only. As of object TIV level 2200 (specified with the -T option of the compiler ) using this function will trigger a compilation error.

name: mb.import.raw
syntax: function long mb.import.raw (ref string target$, string source$ [, long setid])
short: This function converts a string from the external, native character set to the TSS Encoding character set. By default, the setting of the current locale determines the native character set from which the string is converted. Unlike mb.import$(), no special conversion is done for Code Features.

name: mb.import$
syntax: function long mb.import$ (ref string target$, string source$ [, long setid])
short: This function converts a string from the external, native character set to the TSS Encoding character set. By default, the setting of the current locale determines the native character set from which the string is converted. Code features are restored.

name: mb.isbidi
short: This function checks whether the current environment is a bidirectional one.

name: mb.isbidi.language
short: This function checks whether the specified language is a bidirectional one. To use the function, you must link to the ttdllbidi library. The function checks the flag � %TF@ttaad110.bidi� in the table �%TB@ttaad110�.

name: mb.locale.enumerate
short: This function returns information about one specific locale or about all locales.

name: mb.locale.info
syntax: function string mb.locale.info (long info_flag [, const string locale_name])
short: This function returns information about the current locale.

name: mb.localename$
short: This function returns the name of the current locale as defined in the file '$bse/lib/user/u< user >'. The file �$BSE/lib/tss_locale x.x � (where x.x is the bshell version) contains all locales that the system supports.

name: mb.long.to.str$
short: This function converts a character code to the equivalent string value. It accepts single byte and multibyte character codes only. Do not use it for other character codes, such as function keys.

name: mb.nsets
short: This function returns the number of TSS character sets currently defined. This is useful for retrieving character set information using mb.set.info() .

name: mb.rev$
syntax: function string mb.rev$ (string string_expr [, long flags])
short: Deprecated. This function is supported for backward compatibility reasons only. As of object TIV level 2200 (specified with the -T option of the compiler ) using this function will trigger a compilation error.

name: mb.scrpos
syntax: function long mb.scrpos (string string_expr, long pos)
short: This function converts a string position to a screen position. Code features are ignored.

name: mb.set.info
syntax: function long mb.set.info (long setid, ref string name, string desc, ref long n_items)
short: This function returns information about a specified character set.

name: mb.strpos
syntax: function long mb.strpos (string string_expr, long pos)
short: This function converts a screen position to a string position. Code features are ignored.

name: mb.type
short: This function tests if a specified string is a multibyte string. It does not test the content of the string.

name: mb.width
short: This function returns the display width of a specified string; that is, the number of positions the string will occupy on the screen.

name: mess
syntax: function void mess (string messcode, long separate_window [, void arg ...])
short: This retrieves a message from the data dictionary and displays it on screen. Using this function makes your program script language independent.

name: message
syntax: function void message (string mess_str [, void arg ...])
short: This displays the specified message string on screen in a separate window, and waits until the user closes it. This is applicable in case the message mode of the concerning user is set to "Interactive". In case of a "Non-interrupting" message mode, ERP Enterprise displays the message strings in a separate "Messages" window without interruption.

name: method.is.allowed
short: This is a special hook for handling centralized authorizations. Use it to perform checks that determine whether certain Data Access Methods are permitted for an object. The method argument specifies the method to check.

name: min
short: No description available

name: mkdir
syntax: function long mkdir (string path_name$ [, long access_level])
short: This creates the specified directory. You must have write permission in the parent directory to do this. Access permissions for the new directory are set to read, write, and execute for all users.

name: ml_get_baselang
short: Returns the base language of the environment.

name: ml_get_datalang
short: Returns the current data language of the user.

name: ml_get_datalang_of_softlang
short: Returns the data language of the specified software language.

name: ml_is_active
short: Tests whether Multi Language support is active on runtime for the current environment.

name: ml_one_lang
syntax: function string ml_one_lang (const string mlv [, const string language])
short: This function retrieves the value in a specific data language from a string variable.

name: ml_set_datalang
short: Sets a new data language for the user.

name: move.window
syntax: function void move.window (long col, long row)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: mtime
short: This measures the time elapsed since the first mtime() call. The function is common to all processes within the same bshell. That is, when it is called by a process, the result is the number of milliseconds since the function was first called by a process in the same bshell.

name: ncrs.is.session.empty
short: This function can be used in a print or a processing session in an init.form section. The function can be used to decide whether the functional default command should be triggered. Possible the default command is another one, than the command that actually trigges the wanted functionality. The function tells whether the session has no fields left, because the selection group has been made invisible.

name: new.window
syntax: function long new.window (long height, long width, long row, long col)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: no.scroll
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: not.curr
short: This switches the current and previous values of the specified variable. This is considered a value change by the checking mechanism. So if you subsequently call changed() , that function will return TRUE.

name: not.fixed
short: You can fill a string with or without specifying a start position. If you specify a start position, unused positions in the string are filled with spaces. You can prevent the string from being filled out with spaces by calling not.fixed() before filling the string. Note that, when you assign a new value to the string variable, positions after the new value are not changed.

name: num.to.date
syntax: function long num.to.date (long dayno, ref long yearno, ref long monthno, ref long month_dayno)
short: This converts a specified number of days since 01-01-0001 to the corresponding year, month, and day of the month.

name: num.to.date$
syntax: function string num.to.date$ (long dayno, long mode)
short: This converts a specified number of days since 01-01-0001 to the corresponding date, formatted as a date string. The sequence of day, month, and year in the string depends on the user data settings defined in the data dictionary (default is "YYMMDD"). The separator character used is also defined in the data dictionary (default is '/').

name: num.to.week
syntax: function long num.to.week (long dayno, ref long week_dayno, ref long year_dayno, ref long weekno [, ref long yearno])
short: This converts a specified number of days since 01-01-0001 to the corresponding day of the week, day of the year, and week number of the year.

name: object.to.keyfields
short: Restore the value of the key fields from the passed key field object.

name: occ.independent.view.field
short: This defines the specified field as occurrence independent. This means that its value is not stored in one of the records that is shown in the grid. An example is an order total field that is shown in the grid. Another example is a field that is used to filter out records.

name: off.change.check
short: This switches off the checking mechanism for the specified variable. Changes to the variable are no longer monitored by the checking mechanism.

name: on.change.check
short: This starts the checking mechanism by setting a checkpoint for the specified variable. The current value of the variable becomes the checkpoint value.

name: on.drop
syntax: function void on.drop (long from.pid, long collection, boolean copy)
short: Call back function which is passed in function enable.drop() . This function will be called when a drop event from the associated session arrives. In this function the business logic related to the drop operation must be implemented. In case database table updates are done in this function, the function must also commit the transaction.

name: on.main.table
short: This copies the contents current record of the main table to the record buffer of that table, saves the record, and executes the specified function. After that the saved record buffer is restored. This enables you to perform actions on the record contents without affecting the values in the table.

name: on.old.occ
syntax: function void on.old.occ (const string function_name, const string ...)
short: This executes the specified function for the current occurrence, using the old values of the record. The record must have been previously modified.

name: on.recall
short: This hook is executed in case Workflow Document Authorization is active for the Business Object of which the table of this DAL, is the root table, as defined in the OCM Workflow Model. In case any changes made to the Business Object must be recalled, the DBCM layer will execute this hook. This hook must then publish a Workflow BOD to ION with a request to recall a previous request for approval.

name: on.reject
short: This hook is executed in case Workflow Document Authorization is active for the Business Object of which the table of this DAL is the root table, as defined in the OCM Workflow Model. In case any submitted changes made to the Business Object have been rejected in ION, the DBCM layer will execute this hook.

name: on.set.approved
short: This hook is executed in case Workflow Document Authorization is active for the Business Object of which the table of this DAL is the root table, as defined in the OCM Workflow Model. In case any submitted changes made to the Business Object have been approved in ION, the DBCM layer will execute this hook.

name: on.set.draft
short: This hook is executed in case Workflow Document Authorization is active for the Business Object of which the table of this DAL is the root table, as defined in the OCM Workflow Model. In case any submitted changes made to the Business Object have been approved in ION, the DBCM layer will execute this hook.

name: on.set.recalled
short: This hook is executed in case Workflow Document Authorization is active for the Business Object of which the table of this DAL is the root table, as defined in the OCM Workflow Model. In case a previous request to recall a started Workflow in ION is confirmed, the DBCM layer will execute this hook.

name: on.submit
short: This hook is executed in case Workflow Document Authorization is active for the Business Object of which the table of this DAL, is the root table, as defined in the OCM Workflow Model. In case any changes made to the Business Object are submitted, the DBCM layer will execute this hook. This hook must then publish a Workflow BOD to ION with a request for approval.

name: open.message
syntax: function long open.message (long project, string name$, long action [, long fast])
short: Use this to create a new mailbox or to connect to an existing mailbox. You must call this function before you can read from or write to the mailbox.

name: open.url.local
short: This function opens a URL in an (embedded) browser. This function is only supported in WebUI and LN UI.

name: ostype
short: This function returns a long value that indicates the operating system environment. The possible values are:

name: par.abort.client.server
short: This function can be used in the client as well in the server. When there are (application) problems in the client or server, an abort message will be sent to the client and all servers. After this function call, all servers are stopped and all communication will be ended.

name: par.client.close.servers
short: This function will close all servers in a group. Normally this call should only be done when all servers are ready, so after a call to par.client.wait.ready() . Closing the servers means that the application servers will terminate.

name: par.client.get.message
syntax: function long par.client.get.message (long group.id, ref string comm.string)
short: This function will check if a message has been sent by one of the servers in the indicated server group. A server process can sent a message back to the client with the function: par.server.send.message() . This function will not wait for any messages from a server process.

name: par.client.get.status
syntax: function long par.client.get.status (long group.id, long server.number, ref long messages)
short: Returns the current status of the specified server.

name: par.client.running
short: This function will return whether the current session is running in parallel processing client mode. It will be true when function par.init.client.to.server() was called successfully. This function can be useful in DLL�s.

name: par.client.send.message
syntax: function boolean par.client.send.message (long group.id [, string comm.string] [, long server.number])
short: Send a message to the indicated group or application server. When a server.number is passed, the message is sent to that particular server. Otherwise the message is sent to the first server in the group which is ready. This function will wait until the message has been sent to a server. This does however not mean that the message is already processed by this server when this function returns.

name: par.client.start.servers
syntax: function boolean par.client.start.servers (long group.id [, long options])
short: This function is used to actually start the application servers (Bshells) for the indicated group.

name: par.client.wait.ready
syntax: function boolean par.client.wait.ready ( [long group.id] [, long server.number])
short: This function will wait until servers are ready with processing messages. When no group.id and no server.number are specified, this function will wait for all servers in all groups to become ready. When only a group.id is specified, this function will wait for all servers in the specified group to become ready. When both a group.id and a server.number is specified, this function will wait for one specific server to become ready.

name: par.get.no.of.server
short: This function will return the number of servers configured for this client session. See the section Parallel Application Processing Configuration .

name: par.init.client.to.server
syntax: function long par.init.client.to.server (long nr.of.servers, string server.session [, string support.session])
short: This function is used to initialize the client to server communication for one group. Starting the application servers (Bshells) will be done when the function par.client.start.servers() is called.

name: par.init.server.to.client
syntax: function boolean par.init.server.to.client (ref long group.number, ref long server.number [, ref long tot.nr.servers])
short: This function is used to initialize the communication to the client. This function must be called rather in the beginning of a program which can be started as server. This because of the fact that the client function has a time out time (default 2 minutes) on starting each server (receiving the 'known' command).

name: par.server.get.message
short: This function will inform the client that this server is ready and wait for a new message from the client.

name: par.server.id
short: This function will return the identification of a server within its group. This function can be useful in includes or DLL�s to determine if the session is running in the context of parallel processing.

name: par.server.question
syntax: function boolean par.server.question (string question, ref string answer)
short: This function can be used by a server session to send a question message to the "support" session in the client. The "support" session in the client must use function par.support.get.question() to receive questions from server processes and function par.support.send.answer() to sent an answer message to the server. The function par.server.question() waits until an answer message is received from the "support" session.

name: par.server.retry.hit
short: This function must be called in a server after a real db.retry.hit() call. When this function is called x times and x = MAX.RETRY-1, this function will do an abort of the client server communication with the abort message "Too many retry hits in server". See section: Parallel Application Processing Database Retries for a further explanation.

name: par.server.retry.point
short: This function is used for setting a not real retry point after a db.retry.point (). It must be used together with function par.server.retry.hit() . See section: Parallel Application Processing Database Retries for a further explanation.

name: par.server.running
short: This function will return whether the current session is running in parallel processing server mode. It will be true when function par.init.server.to.client() was called successfully. This function can be useful in DLL�s.

name: par.server.send.message
short: Send a message to the client. This function will return as soon as the message has been sent.

name: par.support.get.question
short: This function will wait for a question message from any server. When this function returns -1, the support session must end processing and exit.

name: par.support.init
syntax: function boolean par.support.init (ref long group.number, ref long tot.nr.servers)
short: This function is used to initialize the communication for a support session. This function must be called at the start of a session which can be used as a parallel processing support session.

name: par.support.running
short: This function will return whether the current session is running in parallel processing support session mode. It will be true when function par.support.init() was called successfully. This function can be useful in DLL�s.

name: par.support.send.answer
syntax: function boolean par.support.send.answer (string answer, long server.number)
short: Send an answer message to a server session. This function will return as soon as the message has been sent.

name: parse_and_exec_function
syntax: function long parse_and_exec_function (string dll_name, string function_call [, ref void return_value] [, ref string return_call])
short: This function is similar to exec_dll_function() . It loads a specified DLL and parses and executes a specified function within that DLL. If the DLL is already loaded, the identification number of the loaded DLL is used to search for the specified function. Otherwise, a load_dll(dll_name, 0) call is executed automatically.

name: path.change.extension
syntax: function string path.change.extension (const string path, const string extension [, long os.type])
short: Changes the extension of the specified path string. By default the path string is interpreted according to the Operating System of the ERP Enterprise server.

name: path.combine
syntax: function string path.combine (const string path, ..., long os.type)
short: Combines one ore more strings into a path.

name: path.dir.separator
short: Provides a platform-specific character used to separate directory levels in a path string that reflects a hierarchical file system organization.

name: path.directory
syntax: function string path.directory (const string path [, long os.type])
short: Returns the directory information for the specified path string.

name: path.exists
syntax: function boolean path.exists (const string path [, long access_level])
short: This function returns true if the given path exists, and false otherwise. If the current BSE is a tenant BSE, path is always interpreted as a relative path.

name: path.extension
syntax: function string path.extension (const string path [, long os.type])
short: Returns the extension of the specified path string.

name: path.filename
syntax: function string path.filename (const string path [, long os.type])
short: Returns the filename and extension of the specified path string.

name: path.filename.without.extension
syntax: function string path.filename.without.extension (const string path [, long os.type])
short: Returns the filename of the specified path string without the extension.

name: path.has.extension
syntax: function boolean path.has.extension (const string path [, long os.type])
short: Determines whether a path string includes a file name extension.

name: path.is.absolute
short: This checks if path_name is an absolute path.

name: path.separator
short: Returns a platform-specific separator character (":" or ";") used to separate path strings in environment variables.

name: pathname
syntax: function long pathname (string file_basename, string file_type, ref string file_path [, long log.options])
short: This searches for and returns the location of a specified file.

name: pc$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pcm.activate.session
syntax: function long pcm.activate.session (ref string session, string title)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pcm.change
syntax: function void pcm.change (long plan_id, ..., long flag, long value)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pcm.change.object
syntax: function void pcm.change.object (long plan_id, long object_id [, long flag] [, long value,])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pcm.create
syntax: function long pcm.create ( [long flag] [, long value,...])

name: pipe.clearerr
short: This resets the error and end-of-file indicators on the specified pipe.

name: pipe.close
short: This clears any buffers associated with the specified pipe and closes the file. Buffers allocated by the standard input/output system are also cleared. Note that pipe.close() is performed automatically when the process exits.

name: pipe.eof
short: This checks the end-of-file indicator on the specified pipe. Note that the end-of-file indicator lasts until the pipe is closed, unless you explicitly clear it by calling pipe.clearerr() .

name: pipe.error
short: This checks the error indicator on the specified pipe to determine whether an error has occurred when reading or writing to the pipe. Note that the error indicator lasts until the pipe is closed, unless you explicitly clear it by calling pipe.clearerr() .

name: pipe.flush
short: This writes any buffered data associated with a pipe to the related file. The stream remains open.

name: pipe.gets
syntax: function long pipe.gets (ref string line, long nr_of_bytes, long pipe_id)
short: This reads a maximum of one line from the specified pipe.

name: pipe.open
syntax: function long pipe.open (string pathnm, string openmode)
short: This creates a UNIX process with the specified name and links an input and/or output stream to it. It returns a pointer to the pipe; this is used to identify the pipe in subsequent operations.

name: pipe.puts
syntax: function long pipe.puts (string line, long pipe_id)
short: This writes data to the specified pipe. It automatically appends a newline character to the data.

name: pipe.read
syntax: function long pipe.read (ref string buffer, long nr_of_bytes, long pipe_id)
short: This reads a specified number of bytes from the specified pipe.

name: pipe.write
syntax: function long pipe.write (string buffer, long nr_of_bytes, long pipe_id)
short: This appends a specified number of bytes to the specified pipe.

name: plcm.activity.action.performed
short: Callback-function for when the activity is double-click upon.

name: plcm.activity.deleted
short: Callback-function for when the activity is about to be deleted in the UI.

name: plcm.activity.moved
syntax: function boolean plcm.activity.moved (string activity.id, long start.date, long end.date)
short: Callback-function for when the activity end-date and/or start-date have been changed in the UI.

name: plcm.add.activity
syntax: function long plcm.add.activity (string parent.activity.id, string activity.id, string activity.name [, long start.date] [, long end.date] [, long completion.percentage])
short: Adds a child activity to an activity. This will cause the parent activity to be displayed as a summary bar.

name: plcm.add.activity.marker
syntax: function long plcm.add.activity.marker (string activity.id, long icon.id, long date_time, string tooltip, string legend.id)
short: Adds a marker to an activity. The marker will be visualized by an icon.

name: plcm.add.activity.property
syntax: function long plcm.add.activity.property (string property.id, string property.label)
short: Adds a property to an activity. The property will be visualized as a column in the table part of the Gantt view.

name: plcm.add.command
syntax: function long plcm.add.command (string command.id, string command.text [, enum ecatg] [, boolean command.checked])
short: Adds a custom command. This command will appear in the specific menu of the plan chart.

name: plcm.add.constraint
syntax: function long plcm.add.constraint (string activity.id.from, string activity.id.to, long constraint.type)
short: Adds a constraint between two activities.

name: plcm.add.reservation
syntax: function long plcm.add.reservation (string activity.id, string resource.id)
short: Assigns an activity to a resource.

name: plcm.add.resource
syntax: function long plcm.add.resource (string parent.resource.id, string resource.id, string resource.name [, long quantity])
short: Adds a child resource to a resource.

name: plcm.add.resource.property
syntax: function long plcm.add.resource.property (string property.id, string property.label)
short: Adds a property to a resource. The property will be visualized as a column in the table part of the Schedule view.

name: plcm.add.root.activity
syntax: function long plcm.add.root.activity (string root.activity.id, string root.activity.name)
short: Call this function only once. The root activity will serve as highest level parent for all other activities. Therefore it will be displayed as summary bar in the Gantt view.

name: plcm.add.root.resource
syntax: function long plcm.add.root.resource (string root.resource.id, string root.resource.name)
short: Call this function only once. The root resource will serve as highest level parent for all other resources

name: plcm.clear
short: Clears the plan chart in order to build up a new schedule.

name: plcm.command.performed
syntax: function long plcm.command.performed (string command.id, const long activities.context.count, const string activities.context(), const long resources.context.count, string resources.context())
