name: plcm.constraint.deleted
syntax: function boolean plcm.constraint.deleted (const string activity.id.from, const string activity.id.to, const long constraint.type)
short: Callback-function for when the constraint is about to be deleted in the UI.

name: plcm.create.legend.entry
syntax: function long plcm.create.legend.entry (string legend.id, long color, string description)
short: Defines a legend entry. This function must be called before the plcm.start() is called. The legend will be visualized in the underneath the plan chart.

name: plcm.delete.activity
short: Deletes an activity.

name: plcm.delete.constraint
syntax: function long plcm.delete.constraint (string activity.id.from, string activity.id.to, long constraint.type)
short: Deletes a constraint between two activities.

name: plcm.delete.reservation
syntax: function long plcm.delete.reservation (string activity.id, string resource.id)
short: Deletes a reservation.

name: plcm.delete.resource
short: Deletes a resource.

name: plcm.get.default.availability
short: Callback-function for the initial setting value of the show availability.

name: plcm.get.resource.unavailability
syntax: function void plcm.get.resource.unavailability (const string resource.id(), const long i.start.date, const long i.end.date)
short: Callback-function when the scope of the view of unavailabilities of the resource is changed in the UI.

name: plcm.init
syntax: function long plcm.init (string title, string initial.types [, long options])
short: This function must be the first to be called, it initializes the global data structures of the plan chart.

name: plcm.move.activity
syntax: function long plcm.move.activity (string activity.id, long start.date, long end.date)
short: Sets a new start/end date for an activity

name: plcm.reservation.changed

short: Callback-function for when a reservation is about to change in the UI.

name: plcm.reservation.deleted
syntax: function boolean plcm.reservation.deleted (const string activity.id, const string resource.id)
short: Callback-function for when the reservation is about to be deleted in the UI.

name: plcm.resource.deleted
short: Callback-function for when the resource is about to be deleted in the UI.

name: plcm.set.activity.completion.percentage
syntax: function long plcm.set.activity.completion.percentage (string activity.id, long completion.percentage)
short: Change the completion.percentage of an activity.

name: plcm.set.activity.end.date
syntax: function long plcm.set.activity.end.date (string activity.id, long end.date)
short: Change the end.date of an activity.

name: plcm.set.activity.name
syntax: function long plcm.set.activity.name (string activity.id, string name)
short: Change the name of an activity.

name: plcm.set.activity.property
syntax: function long plcm.set.activity.property (string activity.id, string property.id, string property.value)
short: Sets an activity property. The property will be visualized in the table part of the Gantt view.

name: plcm.set.activity.start.date
syntax: function long plcm.set.activity.start.date (string activity.id, long start.date)
short: Change the start.date of an activity.

name: plcm.set.activity.unavailability

short: Sets the unavailabilities of an activity. This show the bars of unavailabilities on the background of the row of the activity and provide an insight of the availability of the activity.

name: plcm.set.legend.for.activity
syntax: function long plcm.set.legend.for.activity (string activity.id, string legend.id)

name: plcm.set.legend.for.activity.division
syntax: function long plcm.set.legend.for.activity.division (string activity.id, string legend.id, long Start.percentage, long End.percentage [, long Num.decimals])

name: plcm.set.resource.name
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.name (string resource.id, string name)
short: Change the name of a resource.

name: plcm.set.resource.property.value
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.property.value (string resource.id, string property.id, string property.value)
short: Sets a resource property. The property will be visualized in the table part of the Schedule view.

name: plcm.set.resource.quantity
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.quantity (string resource.id, long quantity)
short: Change the quantity of a resource.

name: plcm.set.resource.unavailability
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.unavailability (const string resource.id(), const long no.elements, const long start.date(), const long end.date(), const string description() mb, const string legend.id() mb)
short: Sets the unavailabilities of an resource. This show the bars of unavailabilities on the background of the row of the activity and provide an insight of the availability of the resource.

name: plcm.set.slack.for.activity
syntax: function long plcm.set.slack.for.activity (string activity.id, long start.date, long end.date, string legend.id)
short: Sets the slack attributes of an activity. The slack will get the color of the legend.

name: plcm.start
short: Activates the plan chart,in other words it takes over control from the application. See also plcm.init() for more information.

name: pos
syntax: function long pos (string source, string part [, long offset])
short: This returns the start position of a specified substring ( part ) in a specified string ( source ). source and part can be either strings or string expressions.

name: pow
syntax: function double pow (double x, double y)
short: This computes the value of x raised to the power of y . If x is zero, y must be positive. If x is negative, y must be an integer.

name: prcm.bms.is.notification
short: Tests whether the specified bms command is a notification of a subject. If no bms command is passed to this function, the predefined 4GL variable bms.sender.command is checked.

name: prcm.get.aspect
syntax: function observer processes can call prcm.get.aspect ()
short: Returns the last decoded aspect of the subject that did a notification.

name: prcm.get.data
short: Returns the last data passed by the subject that did a notification.

name: prcm.get.subject
short: Returns the last decoded subject that did a notification.

name: prcm.notify
syntax: function void prcm.notify (const string subject [, string aspect(32)] [, long data])
short: Is called by a subject process to notify other processes that it has changed. Optionally, an aspect can be specified to indicate what aspect of the subject process has changed.

name: prcm.register
syntax: function void prcm.register (const string subject [, string aspect(32)])
short: Is called by an Observer process (i.e. the current process) to register/subscribe itself for a certain Subject (and optionally Aspect). Afterwards, if the subject notifies its observers, this process will be notified by the Process Change Manager.

name: prcm.unregister
syntax: function void prcm.unregister (const string subject [, string aspect(32)])
short: Is called by an Observer process (i.e. the current process) to unregister/unsubscribe itself for a certain Subject (and optionally Aspect). Afterwards, this process will no longer be notified by the Process Change Manager if the subject tries to notify its observers.

name: print.const
short: This displays a specified constant string value in the current form field. The current value of the database field is not affected.

name: progress.indicator.exists
short: This checks if a progress indicator was already created.

name: pstat
syntax: function long pstat (long pid, ref string progname, ref long info(PSMAXSIZE))
short: This returns status information about a specified process.

name: publish.check
syntax: function long publish.check (const string bus.component.name, ref long result.xml)
short: This function checks whether a destination (bus component) is available for publishing events. Note that publish.open() and publish.message() will not always report errors, but will send messages to an error handler or log file instead. To avoid publishing many message to the error handler or log file, this check function can be used before using publish.open().

name: publish.close
syntax: function long publish.close (long publication.id, ref long result.xml)
short: This function closes a publication channel. After using this function, publish.message() and publish.error.message() cannot be used anymore unless a new publish.open() is done first.

name: publish.error.message
syntax: function long publish.error.message (long publication.id, long error.xml, ref long result.xml)
short: This function reports an error instead of publishing a message. It can be used if a message could not be created or sent successfully. Note that the error message is not sent to the bus component as specified in publish.open(). Instead, the Adapter configuration specifies an error handler for the bus component and the error message is sent to that error handler. If the error handler cannot be found or is unavailable, the Adapter will take care that the error is logged.

name: publish.message
syntax: function long publish.message (long publication.id, long message.xml, ref long result.xml)
short: This function publishes the specified message.

name: publish.open
syntax: function long publish.open (const string bus.component.name, ref long result.xml)
short: This function initializes the publishing.

name: publish.webpart.message
syntax: function void publish.webpart.message (const string type, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Sends a message to the Companyon shell, where it is passed on to any webparts registered to this message type.

name: put.boolean.arg
syntax: function long put.boolean.arg (long arg_no, boolean value)
short: The function put.boolean.arg() assigns the supplied boolean value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

name: put.double.arg
syntax: function long put.double.arg (long arg_no, double value)
short: The function put.double.arg() assigns the supplied double value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

name: put.indexed.var
syntax: function [long] put.indexed.var (long processno, string variable_name, void value, long dim1 [, dim2, dim3, dim4 ])

name: put.long.arg
syntax: function long put.long.arg (long arg_no, long value)
short: The function put.long.arg() assigns the supplied long value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

name: put.string.arg
syntax: function long put.string.arg (long arg_no, string value)
short: The function put.string.arg() assigns the supplied string value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

name: put.var
syntax: function [long] put.var (long processno, string variable_name, void value)

name: qss.search
syntax: function long qss.search (long flag, void search, ref void array, ref long def [, long dept])
short: This searches a specified array for a particular value, which is referred to as the search key. By default, it reads the array sequentially until it finds the specified value (that is, it performs a linear search). To perform a binary search instead, you must first sort the data, for example with qss.sort() and then call qss.search() with the flag argument set to QSS.SRC.IS.SORTED. If the same search key occurs more than once, then you should also specify the QSS.SRC.DUPL.ALLOWED option, or else it is not predictable which one of the duplicate records is found.

name: qss.sort
syntax: function long qss.sort (ref void array, ref long def [, long dept])
short: This function performs a fast sort of a specified array.

name: query.define.sort.order
syntax: function long query.define.sort.order (long table.index, const string field.var, direction.var [, const string ..., ...])
short: With this function the direction of an index-field or the whole index of an table-index can be set.

name: query.extend.fld.from
syntax: function long query.extend.fld.from (string select_column, string extension_string)
short: With the query.extend.fld� interface the metadata is stored in the 4gl engine. The query.extend.fld� information is used to build the standard query for retrieving requested data, inclusive the application fields. The result is used for the display of the field. The value of easy filter on the application field and the query.extend.fld� information is used to extend the WHERE clause of the standard query. The standard query is used to display the session.

name: query.extend.fld.select
syntax: function long query.extend.fld.select (string select_column, string select_expression)
short: With the query.extend.fld� interface the metadata is stored in the 4gl engine. The query.extend.fld� information is used to build the standard query for retrieving requested data, inclusive the application fields. The result is used for the display of the field. The value of easy filter on the application field and the query.extend.fld� information is used to extend the WHERE clause of the standard query. The standard query is used to display the session.

name: query.extend.fld.where
syntax: function long query.extend.fld.where (string select_column, string where_condition)
short: With the query.extend.fld� interface the metadata is stored in the 4gl engine. The query.extend.fld� information is used to build the standard query for retrieving requested data, inclusive the application fields. The result is used for the display of the field. The value of easy filter on the application field and the query.extend.fld� information is used to extend the WHERE clause of the standard query. The standard query is used to display the session.

name: query.extend.from
syntax: function void query.extend.from (string extension_string [, long mode])
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the FROM clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.from.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

name: query.extend.from.in.zoom
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the FROM clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.from() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

name: query.extend.hint
syntax: function void query.extend.hint (string extension_string [, long mode])
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the HINT clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.hint.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

name: query.extend.hint.in.zoom
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the HINT clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.hint() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

name: query.extend.select
syntax: function void query.extend.select (string extension_string [, long mode])
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the SELECT clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.select.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

name: query.extend.select.in.zoom
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the SELECT clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.select() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

name: query.extend.where
syntax: function void query.extend.where (string extension_string [, long mode])
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the WHERE clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.where.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

name: query.extend.where.in.zoom
short: Use this to construct a query extension for the WHERE clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.where() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

name: query.object
syntax: function long query.object (long object_id, long attribute_in, void value_in, long size_iin, long attribute_in, ref void value_out, ref long size_out)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: query.sub.object
syntax: function long query.sub.object (long object_id, long sub_object_id, long attribute_in, value_in, size_in, void value_in, long size_in, long attribute_in, ref void value_out, ref long size_out)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: quoted.string
short: quoted.string() assures that the contents of the variable can be used as a string for the query processor. If the string_expr contains a quote or double quote, the query processor will generate an error. This function inserts the necessary escapes for the string.

name: raise.object
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: random
short: This function uses a system-independent random number generator. On all systems, the generator will generate the same random numbers, provided that the same seed is supplied.

name: rbhp.get.parameter
short: This function returns the named drillback parameter value which was passed by the Role Based Home Page drillback URL. This function can be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back(). This function can also be called from a 4GL session when it was started from a Role Based Home Page drillback.

name: rbhp.query.extend.from
short: Set the FROM clause extension to be used when starting the session. No syntax checking on the passed extension will be done. This extension will be appended to the extension set by the session. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

name: rbhp.query.extend.select
short: Set the SELECT clause extension to be used when starting the session. No syntax checking on the passed extension will be done. This extension will be appended to the extension set by the session. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

name: rbhp.query.extend.where
short: Set the WHERE clause extension to be used when starting the session. No syntax checking on the passed extension will be done. This extension will be appended to the extension set by the session. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

name: rbhp.set.error.message
short: Set error message and/or error code to be reported to the end user when during the tcint.dll0001.drill.back() function an error occurred. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

name: rbhp.set.session
short: Set the session to be started, the mode of this session, the company number in which this session and the start index of the session. This function can only be called by either the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back() or the tools function icm.drillback() of the tticmdll0002 library.

name: rdi.audit.hosts
syntax: function long rdi.audit.hosts (string table_name(9), long comp_nr, ref string hosts())
short: This returns the names of the hosts on which audit information for a particular table is stored.

name: rdi.column
syntax: function long rdi.column (string column_name(18), ref string domain_name(14), ref long offset, ref long size, ref long dept, ref long type, ref long flag, ref string default_value(.))
short: This returns information about a specified table column.

name: rdi.column.combined
syntax: function long rdi.column.combined (string column_name(18), string ref child_colums(18, 32))
short: This returns information about the child columns of a specified column.

name: rdi.ctoe
syntax: function long rdi.ctoe (string domain_name(14), string enum_name)
short: This gets an enum as string and returns the enum-value as long belonging to it in the specified domain.

name: rdi.date.input.format$
syntax: function string rdi.date.input.format$ (string date_format(7) [, ref string display_format()])
short: This returns the input format defined in the data dictionary for a specified date format. The input format can be any combination of day-in-week (D), week-in-year (W), and year (Y), or any combination of day-in-month (D), month-in-year (M), and year (Y). For example, if the function returns MDY, the input format on a form field must be month, day-in-month, and year (for example, 12311998).

name: rdi.domain

name: rdi.domain.combined

name: rdi.domain.enum

syntax: function long rdi.domain.enum.value (string domain_name, long enum_item, string language, ref string keyword(.), ref string descr(.), ref long value)

name: rdi.domain.float
syntax: function long rdi.domain.float (string domain_name(14), ref long digits_before, ref long digits_after, ref long divide_factor, ref long round_code)
short: This returns information about a domain of type DB.FLOAT.

name: rdi.domain.integer
syntax: function long rdi.domain.integer (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
short: This returns information about a domain of type DB.INTEGER.

name: rdi.domain.long
syntax: function long rdi.domain.long (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
short: This returns information about a domain of type DB.LONG.

name: rdi.domain.raw
syntax: function long rdi.domain.raw (string domain_name(14), ref long length)
short: This returns information about a domain of type DB.RAW.

name: rdi.domain.set
syntax: function long rdi.domain.set (string domain_name(14), ref long no_enum_items)
short: This returns information about a domain of type DB.BITSET.

name: rdi.domain.set.value
syntax: function long rdi.domain.set.value (string domain_name(14), long enum_item, string language, ref string keyword(.), string descr(.), ref string value)
short: This returns information about a specified item in a set-type domain.

name: rdi.domain.string
syntax: function long rdi.domain.string (string domain_name(14), ref long length, ref long convert)
short: This returns information about a domain of type DB.STRING.

name: rdi.domain.text
syntax: function long rdi.domain.text (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
short: This returns information about a domain of type DB.TEXT.

name: rdi.etoc$
syntax: function string rdi.etoc$ (string domain_name(14), long enum_value as long)
short: This gets an enum-value as long and returns a string representing it in the specified domain.

name: rdi.first.day.of.week
short: This function returns the first day of the week as defined for the company of the user. The returned number is relative to Sunday (=1). So, for example, if the function returns 2, this indicates that Monday is the user's first day of the week.

name: rdi.format.digits
syntax: function long rdi.format.digits (string format(), ref long digits.before, ref long digits.after [, ref string display.format()])
short: This returns information about a specified format.

name: rdi.index
syntax: function long rdi.index (string table_name(9), long index_no, ref long parts(32, 3), ref boolean duplicate, ref boolean active)
short: This returns information about a specified index.

name: rdi.is.application.column
syntax: function boolean rdi.is.application.column (const string column.name [, long column.type] [, long column.offset] [, long table.real.length])
short: This function checks whether the given column is an application column, or one that is automatically added by tools.

name: rdi.reference
syntax: function long rdi.reference (string column_name(18), ref string ref_column(18), ref long ref_mode, ref string ref_mess() [, ref boolean check_by_db] [, ref long ref_update_mode] [, ref long ref_delete_mode])
short: If a database column references a column in another table, use this function to retrieve information about the referenced column.

name: rdi.report.sensitivity
short: Returns sensitivity of current report if no reportname was specified, otherwise the given reportname is used.

name: rdi.session.sensitivity
short: Returns sensitivity of current session. The function rdi.session.sensitivity also checks all table fields on a form (if any). The returned sensitivity is the highest sensitivity applicable to a session of table field on a form.

name: rdi.table
syntax: function long rdi.table (string table_name(9), ref long no_keys, ref long no_columns, ref long int_length, ref long real_length [, ref long no_cdf] [, ref boolean mlf_table_all_languages])
short: This returns information about a specified table.

name: rdi.table.column
syntax: function long rdi.table.column (string table_name(9), long column_number, ref string column_name, ref string domain_name(14), ref long offset, ref long size, ref long dept, ref long type, ref long flag, ref string default_value [, long flag_filter])
short: This returns information about a specified column which is identified by the table name and the column number. Note that the first columns in the table are reserved for the following columns: Refcntd, Refcntu, _compnr, _dlock, and _index<number> (one column for each index).

name: rdi.tablefield.sensitivity
short: Returns sensitivity of the provided table field.

name: reactivate
short: This activates the specified sleeping process.

name: rebuild.query
short: Use this function to rebuild a query. If the query.extend functions are used the default query should be rebuild. This is done automatically after the before.program and the before.open.object.set sections. If these functions are used in other sections (to adjust them dynamically), the 4GLE has to be informed when the query has to be rebuild.

name: receive.bucket$
short: This waits for a bucket message to be sent to the calling process by another process. It then returns that message. The processno argument returns the process ID of the sending process.

name: recv.message
syntax: function long recv.message (long key, long sender.key, long time, ref string message$ [, long fast])
short: This reads a message from the specified mailbox. The process must previously have connected to the mailbox by calling open.message() .

name: refresh
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: refresh.all.occs
short: This re-reads all records that are currently on the screen and refreshes them (after all processes are idle).

name: refresh.curr.occ
short: This reads the current record and refreshes it on screen. All references on the form are read again. For example, in the case of a zoom from a field to a session where the record can be modified, calling refresh.curr.occ() refreshes the occurrence on the parent form also.

name: refresh.graph
short: This function forces the display of all graph fields based on the most recent data (the current record buffer, the calculations made based on the current record buffer) of the session.

name: refresh.parent
short: This refreshes the parent session of the current session. The occurrence parameter determines which ocurrence of the child session must be refreshed in the parent session.

name: refresh.total.line
short: This triggers the 4GL-Engine to execute the program section: on.display.total.line . This section is not called directly but after all other sections have been executed. This function can be usefull when the total line must be updated immediately after a user action or a change of a field value. When this function is not used, the program section on.display.total.line is only called after reading a new set of records from the database.

name: register.webpart.handler
syntax: function void register.webpart.handler (const string type, const string handler)
short: Registers a handler for the specified message type. When a message of this type is received from a webpart the specified function is called.

name: remove.field.from.view
short: The view fields for a dynamic session are determined by the view-property of a field in the DFE or, in case of dynamic index switching, by the view column in the Available Indices by Session session. You can use this function to conditionally remove a field from the view-area. e.g. Based on the current index (the predefined variable session.current.index ).

name: remove.form.commands
short: This removes the specified form command(s). Form commands are identified either by a function name or a session code. There is no way to restore or create a new form command.

name: remove.local.directory
short: This deletes a specified directory on the client system.

name: remove.local.file
short: Deprecated. This deletes a specified file on the client system.

name: remove.mark
short: This function clears the selection.

name: remove.quick.flow
syntax: function void remove.quick.flow (const string frmcmd, const string ...)
short: This function can be used in the after.form.read section to remove the quick.flow support for one or more form commands. In this way the application script can decide to not support quick.flow based on a paremaeter.

name: remove.session.index
short: This removes the specified session index. Session index is identified by a session index number as defined by the session.

name: remove.textfields
syntax: function void remove.textfields (const string field.name.string [, const string ...])
short: The text manager completely ignores the named text field(s) for this session.

name: reset.numformat.symbols
short: Reset the decimal sign and thousand separator to the user defined values. The user defined settings will be used from this moment on for all formatted numbers.

name: resize.window
syntax: function void resize.window (long width, long height)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: restore.rcd.main
short: This updates the main table with the contents of the buffer of the specified occurrence. It also makes the specified occurrence the current occurrence.

name: rgb
syntax: function long rgb (long red, long green, long blue)
short: Use this to compose a color by specifying its red, green, and blue intensities. The intensities must be in the range 0 to 255.

name: rmdir
syntax: function long rmdir (const string spath [, boolean recursive])
short: This deletes the specified directory (local or remote). The path argument must include the full path to the directory, including the host name, where appropriate. For example: "host!c:\usr".

name: rnd.d
short: This function uses a system-independent random number generator. On all systems, the generator will generate the same random numbers, provided that the same seed is supplied.

name: rnd.i
short: This function uses a system-independent random number generator. On all systems, the generator will generate the same random numbers, provided that the same seed is supplied.

name: rnd.init
short: rnd.d() and rnd.i() use a system-independent random number generator to generate random numbers. On all systems, the generator will generate the same random numbers, provided that the same seed is supplied.

name: round
syntax: function double round (double value, long diga, long mode)
short: This rounds a given value to a specified number of decimal places.

name: rpos
syntax: function long rpos (string source, string part [, long offset])
short: This returns the start position of a specified substring ( part ) in a specified string ( source ). source and part can be either strings or string expressions.

name: rprt_close
short: This is a short version of brp.close() . It closes the report writer for the current report. You can use the function in a 4GL script in the subsection on.choice of the section choice.print.data . In this section, the predefined variable spool.report is available. This variable stores the name of the current report.

name: rprt_open
short: This is a short version of brp.open() . It has the same effect as:

name: rprt_send
short: This is a short version of brp.ready() . It has the same effect as:

name: rsc.boolean
syntax: function void rsc.boolean (string variable) function void rsc.double (string variable) function void rsc.enum (string variable) function void rsc.long (string variable) function void rsc.string (string variable)
short: These convert a specified program variable to the corresponding resource value format (boolean, double, enum, and so on).

name: rsc.font.spec
syntax: function string rsc.font.spec (long font_weight, long font_slant, long font_height, long font_points, long font_spacing, long font_width, long font_charwidth)
short: This returns a string that defines a font with the specified characteristics.

name: rsc.get
syntax: function void rsc.get (ref string values(), string package_code(2), string resource_set(16), string resource_id(24),...)

name: rsc.put
syntax: function void rsc.put (string package_code(2), string resource_set(16), string resource_id(16), value(40) [, string resource_id(16), value(40) . . .])
short: This updates one or more resource values in a specified resource set. You can use the following functions to convert program variables to a resource value format: rsc.boolean(), rsc.double(), rsc.enum(), rsc.long(), rsc.string() , rsc.boolean(), rsc.double(), rsc.enum(), rsc.long(), rsc.string() , rsc.boolean(), rsc.double(), rsc.enum(), rsc.long(), rsc.string() , rsc.boolean(), rsc.double(), rsc.enum(), rsc.long(), rsc.string() , and rsc.boolean(), rsc.double(), rsc.enum(), rsc.long(), rsc.string() .

name: rsc.setboolean
syntax: function void rsc.setboolean (string variable, string value(40)) function void rsc.setdouble (string variable, string value(40)) function void rsc.setenum (string variable, string value(40)) function void rsc.setlong (string variable, string value(40)) function void rsc.setstring (string variable, string value(40))
short: These store a resource value of a particular type in a specified program variable.

name: run.baan.prog
syntax: function long run.baan.prog (const string progname, const string arguments, long mode [, string stdin] [, string stdout] [, string stderr])
short: The function run.baan.prog() runs a program from $BSE/bin.

name: run.prog
syntax: function long run.prog (const string progname, const string arguments, long mode [, string stdin] [, string stdout] [, string stderr])
short: The function run.prog() runs an operating system command. It is a system-dependent function. It must not be used in applications that are distributed across different platforms.

name: s.expr$
syntax: function string s.expr$ (long expr_id [, void value] [, boolean suppressError])
short: Executes (or evaluates) an expression previously compiled by expr.compile() . The result is always converted to a string.

name: satellite.invisible
short: This hides the specified satellite. This function can only be used in section: after.form.read .

name: save.image.field
short: This function is used to save an image, which is dropped onto the image control, into the repository or delete the image from the repository if deleted by the user. When an image with the bound guid already exists, it will be overwritten. This function should be called from the after.update.db.commit: section in a UI script and is only allowed when the image field is bound using bind.image()

name: save.image.file
syntax: function boolean save.image.file (string guid, long sequence, string pathname [, string tablename])
short: This function will save an image file into the image repository (put it at proper place in directory and update the image table). This function can be used by an image import application.

name: scroll
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: sel.add.parent.tables
syntax: function boolean sel.add.parent.tables (long group_id, string parent_table)
short: In the Dynamic Form Editor you can already indicate the main table of the parent session for which a session can handle the selection. You should specify that table at the "selection range group" in which the user can specify the range if the selection of the parent session is not used. Because you can only specify one table per group, you need to use this function if you want to add one or more extra tables to a group.

name: sel.num.selected
short: This function returns the number of records that is selected in the session.

name: sel.parent.num.selected
short: This function returns the number of records that is selected in the parent of the current session.

name: sel.use.parent.selection
short: This function can be used in a print or a processing session to determine whether to user wants to print/process based on a selection range, or based on the selection that is made in the parent. If the user wants to use the selection of the parent, you should use the function do.parent.selection() to get the selection. The user can indicate his choice with an optionset. Read below how to create that option set.

name: send.bucket
syntax: function long send.bucket (long processno, string bucket)
short: This sends a bucket message to a specified process. If the specified process is sleeping, it is automatically started. It can retrieve the message by calling receive.bucket$() .

name: send.message
syntax: function long send.message (long dest.key, long sender.key, string message$, long fast)
short: This stores a message in the specified mailbox. The process must previously have connected to the mailbox by calling open.message() .

name: send.wait
syntax: function long send.wait (ref long processno, string bucket)
short: This sends a bucket message to a specified process and waits for a reply. The receiving process must send a reply by using send.bucket() or send.wait() . Note that the waiting process cannot receive any message string contained in the reply.

name: seq.clearerr
short: This resets the error and end-of-file indicators for the specified file. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the file was opened.

name: seq.close
short: This flushes the buffers associated with the specified file and closes the file. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the file was opened. Buffers allocated by the standard i/o system are also flushed and closed. These actions are performed automatically when the process exits.

name: seq.close.local
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated. Instead you should use functions: server2client() or client2server() .

name: seq.eof
short: This checks the end-of-file indicator of a specified file. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the file was opened.

name: seq.error
short: This checks the error indicator of a specified file. The error indicator is set when an error occurs while reading from or writing to the file. It lasts until it is cleared by seq.clearerr() or until the file is closed. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the file was opened.

name: seq.flush
short: This causes all buffered data for a specified file to be written to that file. The file remains open. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the file was opened.

name: seq.fstat.local
short: Deprecated. This retrieves information about a specified file on a client system.

name: seq.getc$
short: This returns the next character from a specified file. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the file was opened. An empty string (a string of length 0) indicates either that the end-of-file has been reached or that an error has occurred.

name: seq.gets
syntax: function long seq.gets (ref string line, long nrbytes, long fp [, long mode] [, ref long there.was.more])
short: This reads one or more characters from a specified file.

name: seq.islocked
syntax: function long seq.islocked (long mode, long offset, long size, long fp)
short: This checks whether a specified file or segment of a file has been locked by seq.lock() .

name: seq.lock
syntax: function long seq.lock (long mode, long offset, long size, long fp)
short: This sets read and write locks on a specified file or segment of a file.

name: seq.open
syntax: function long seq.open (string file, string openmode [, ref string pathnm])
short: This opens a specified file. It uses the file $BSE/lib/fd ver.pack_combination to find the file. ver refers to a particular release of the software; pack_combination refers to a particular package combination (see pathname() ).

name: seq.open.dialog.local
short: Deprecated. This shows the Windows file-open dialog, to allow the user to select one or more local files.

name: seq.open.dialog.next
short: Deprecated. Retrieve the next full pathname of the file selected by the user in a previous seq.open.dialog.local() function. This function should only be used when a previous call to seq.open.dialog.local() returned a value greater than 1.

name: seq.open.local
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated. Instead you should use functions: server2client() or client2server() .

name: seq.putc$
syntax: function string seq.putc$ (string char, long fp)
short: This writes a specified character to a specified file. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the particular file was opened.

name: seq.puts
syntax: function long seq.puts (const string line, long fp)
short: This writes the specified characters to a specified file, and appends a new line character. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the particular file was opened.

name: seq.r.long
short: Reads a 32-bit value from the file. The 4 bytes read from the file are interpreted as the 32-bit two�s complement representation of a signed integer value.

name: seq.r.short
short: Reads a 16-bit value from the file. The 2 bytes read from the file are interpreted as the 16-bit binary representation of an unsigned integer value.

name: seq.r.utc
syntax: function long seq.r.utc (long fp [, long byte.count])
short: Reads a specified amount of bytes from the file. The bytes read from the file are interpreted as the two�s complement representation of a signed integer value.

name: seq.read
syntax: function long seq.read (ref string buffer, long nrbytes, long fp)
short: This reads a specified number of bytes from a specified file into buffer . fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the particular file was opened.

name: seq.read.local
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated. Instead you should use function: client2server() .

name: seq.rewind
short: This sets the current file position to the beginning of the file. It is equivalent to: seq.seek() except that the return value is always -1 on error.

name: seq.saveas.dialog.local
short: Deprecated. This shows the Windows file save-as dialog, to allow the user to select a new or existing local file to be saved.

name: seq.seek
syntax: function long seq.seek (long offset, long opt, long fp)
short: This changes the current file position.

name: seq.skip
syntax: function long seq.skip (long nrbytes, long fp)
short: This skips nrbytes bytes, relative to the current file position, in a file represented by fp . fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the particular file was opened. It is equivalent to: seq.seek() .

name: seq.tell
short: This returns the current file position, relative to the beginning of the file. The file position is measured in bytes. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the particular file was opened.

name: seq.ungetc$
syntax: function string seq.ungetc$ (string char, long fp)
short: This puts back a specified character, retrieved by seq.getc$() . The character will be returned by the next seq.getc$() call on that file. This function works only if something has been read from the file and if the file is buffered. fp is the file pointer returned by seq.open() when the particular file was opened.

name: seq.unlink
short: This deletes the file indicated by the path_name argument.

name: seq.unlock
syntax: function long seq.unlock (long mode, long offset, long size, long fp)
short: This removes a lock set by seq.lock() .

name: seq.w.long
syntax: function long seq.w.long (long value, long fp)
short: Writes a 32-bit integer value into the file.

name: seq.w.short
syntax: function long seq.w.short (long value, long fp)
short: Writes a 16-bit integer value into the file.

name: seq.w.utc
syntax: function long seq.w.utc (long value, long fp [, long byte.count])
short: Writes an integer value into the file.

name: seq.write
syntax: function long seq.write (const string buffer, long nrbytes, long fp)
short: This function appends the specified number of bytes from the specified buffer to the specified file, beginning at the current file position.

name: seq.write.local
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated. Instead you should use function: server2client() .

name: server2client
short: Deprecated. This copies a specified file from the server to the client.

name: set.alarm
short: This starts a timer that sends a single EVTTIMEREVENT event to the calling process after the number of milliseconds specified in the msec argument. The timer automatically ends after sending the event. The timer also ends automatically when the process ends or when the program explicitly kills it with kill.timer() .

name: set.ask.enum.values
short: This restricts the values valid for the ask.enum() function. Only the values specified are shown as buttons.

name: set.bg.color
syntax: function void set.bg.color (long wind_id, long color)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.checked.command
syntax: function void set.checked.command (string command, boolean checked)
short: Use this to check or uncheck a command in the menubar or the toolbar. This can be used to indicate to the user that the command is activated. Example:

name: set.currencies
syntax: function void set.currencies (long seqno, string currency(3) [, string currency.desc mb])
short: Use this function to create and fill the multicurrency table. The function inserts a single entry in the table. Currency rotation is based on the order of currencies in this table. Make sure that all the indices of the table (seqno) form a consecutive range, starting at 1

name: set.dynamic.synchronized.dialog
syntax: function void set.dynamic.synchronized.dialog (const string sessioncode [, const string parent.field] [, const string child.field, ...])
short: This function can be used to set the synchronize session when the session to start depends on data of the record, or when the synchronized session uses a child table.

name: set.enum.array.for.field
syntax: function void set.enum.array.for.field (const string field.name, const long size, const long values)
short: In case the field is a listbox , this fills the list with a specified set of enumerate values.

name: set.enum.values
short: This restricts the values valid for the ask.enum() function. Only the values specified are shown as buttons.

name: set.enum.values.for.field
syntax: function void set.enum.values.for.field (const string field.name [, long ALL_ENUMS_EXCEPT] [, enum enum_value, ...])
short: In case the field is a listbox , this fills the list with a specified set of enumerate values.

name: set.fg.color
syntax: function void set.fg.color (long wind_id, long color)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.fields.default
short: It is possible to define default values for form fields with the form editor. For all fields of the current form, this function sets the corresponding script variables to the default form values.

name: set.file.for.textfield
syntax: function void set.file.for.textfield (const string field.name.string, string filename)
short: This fills the textbox of a text field with the contents of a specified file present on the server.

name: set.fmax
syntax: function void set.fmax (ref void variable [, string domain])
short: This sets a specified string variable to its maximum value.

name: set.fmin
syntax: function void set.fmin (ref void variable [, string domain])
short: This sets a specified string variable to its minimum value.

name: set.focus
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.initial.enum.array.for.field
syntax: function void set.initial.enum.array.for.field (const string field.name, long size, const long values)
short: This function applies to enumerated fields that are displayed as listbox or option set. It limits the number of options to the specified set of enum constants. Any options not specified will be hidden .

name: set.initial.enum.values.for.field
syntax: function void set.initial.enum.values.for.field (const string field.name, long ALL_ENUMS_EXCEPT, enum enum_value, ...)
short: This function applies to enumerated fields that are displayed as listbox or optionset. It limits the number of options to the specified set of enum constants. Any options not specified will be hidden .

name: set.initial.enum.values.for.workflow.status.field
short: This function applies to a workflow status field that is displayed as listbox. It limits the number of workflow statuses to the specified set. Any workflow status not specified will be hidden . Function set.initial.enum.values.for.workflow.status.field is equivalent to set.initial.enum.values.for.field() with the field.name argument set to �ttocm999.stts�

name: set.input.error
syntax: function void set.input.error (string mess.or.code [, void arg ...])
short: This causes the 4GL engine to display the specified error message and to force input again in the same input field. If you specify an empty string, no error message is displayed.

name: set.limits.off
short: This removes the limits set with the store.occ.max(), store.occ.min() and/or store.occ.max(), store.occ.min() functions. The entire table can then be accessed again.

name: set.list.values.for.field
syntax: function void set.list.values.for.field (const string field.name.string, long no.list.values, const string list.values(,))
short: This fills a listbox field or a combobox field with a specified set of values. The field must be a string type field, and the appearance must be set to Dropdown Listbox or Dropdown Combobox in the DFE.

name: set.max
syntax: function void set.max (ref void variable [, string domain])
short: This sets a specified standard variable to its maximum value.

name: set.mem
syntax: function long set.mem (ref void destination, void source [, long count])
short: The stores the value of source in the destination argument. By default, the value of source is repeated in destination until the latter is completely filled. Use the optional count argument to repeat the value of source a specific number of times only. Elements in the destination argument which are not overwritten remain unchanged.

name: set.min
syntax: function void set.min (ref void variable [, string domain])
short: This sets a specified standard variable to its minimum value.

name: set.multiline.text.in.html.mode
short: This switches the editing of a text_field to html mode in a Rich Text Editor. Text edited in this way is saved in html format.

name: set.node.class
syntax: function void set.node.class (string tree_name, string node_id, long node_class [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.node.class.color
syntax: function void set.node.class.color (string tree_name, long node_class, long class_color [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.numformat.symbols
syntax: function void set.numformat.symbols (string decimal(1), string grouping(1))
short: Set the decimal sign and thousand separator. These settings will be used from this moment on for all formatted numbers.

name: set.object.defaults
short: Use this hook to fill a new record with defaults.

name: set.pgrp
syntax: function long set.pgrp (long process_id, long group_id)
short: This places a specified process in a specified process group. If the process group ID is the same as the process ID, a new process group is created with the specified ID. The specified process becomes the leader of the new group.

name: set.refresh.rate
syntax: function long set.refresh.rate (long rateInSeconds [, long thresholdInSeconds])
short: With this function the refresh rate of the session will be overruled temporary.

name: set.sensitive
syntax: function void set.sensitive (long object_id, long status)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.spool.main.report
short: This stores a specified report name in the predefined variable spool.main.report .

name: set.starting.satellite
short: This function specifies which satellite should be active when the multi-main table session is started.

name: set.strip.mode
syntax: function long set.strip.mode (long table.id, long mode)
short: set.strip.mode() sets or resets the 'strip-on-assignment' flag for all string fields of the table specified by table_id . The mode argument indicates whether the flag is to be set on or off. 1 indicates set flag on, 0 indicates set flag off. Setting this flag on a symbol a means that assignments to other variables from this value will behave as an assignment from

name: set.symbol.strip.mode
syntax: function long set.symbol.strip.mode (ref string str, long mode)
short: set.symbol.strip.mode() sets or resets the 'strip-on-assignment' flag for all string fields of the table specified by table_id . The mode argument indicates whether the flag is to be set on or off. 1 indicates set flag on, 0 indicates set flag off. Setting this flag on a symbol a means that assignments to other variables from this value will behave as an assignment from

name: set.synchronized.dialog
syntax: function void set.synchronized.dialog (string sess_code [, boolean editable.grid] [, boolean use.dialog.for.insert])
short: This defines for the current session the dialog to synchronize with. Both sessions act on the same maintable.

name: set.time.zone
short: This sets the local time zone at run time.

name: set.timer
short: This starts a timer that sends an EVTTIMEREVENT event to the calling process every msec milliseconds. The timer continues to send events until the process ends or until the program explicitly terminates the timer using kill.timer() .

name: set.transaction.readonly
short: This defines a transaction as read only. The transaction can only read records (without locks) from the database; it cannot update the database.

name: set.tree.background
syntax: function void set.tree.background (string tree_name, long color [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.tree.font
syntax: function void set.tree.font (string tree_name, long visible_level, long font [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.tree.foreground
syntax: function void set.tree.foreground (string tree_name, long color [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.tree.linewidth
syntax: function void set.tree.linewidth (string tree_name, long visible_level, long linewidth [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: set.tree.name
syntax: function void set.tree.name (string tree_name, string tree_title [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: setenv
syntax: function long setenv (string env_var, string env_value)
short: This sets the value of a specified environment variable of the operating system. It returns non-zero in case of error.

name: sf$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: sha.add.data
syntax: function void sha.add.data (long id, string data.in)
short: Adds one block of data to be hashed. It is not needed to supply all input data at once in one large block. Sha.add.data() may be called several times with relatively small blocks. Internally, the SHA-1 algorithm processes the input in 512 bit blocks, i.e. 64 byte at a time.

name: sha.compute.output
syntax: function long sha.compute.output (long id, ref string data.out)
short: Adds some padding and a bit count to the message, as prescibed in the standard, and computes the resulting message digest. After this, the Secure Hash Algorithm state may be reused for hashing another message, by calling sha.initialize() , sha.add.data() , and sha.compute.output() again.

name: sha.create
short: Allocates memory to contain the state of the Secure Hash Algorithm.

name: sha.destroy
short: Destroys the Secure Hash Algorithm state.

name: sha.initialize
short: Initializes the state of the Secure Hash Algorithm.

name: shell
syntax: function long shell (string command, long mode)
short: Deprecated. This function is supported for backward compatibility only. In new applications, use run.prog() and run.baan.prog() instead.

name: shiftc$
short: This centers the specified string by equaling the number of leading and trailing spaces. If there is an odd number of spaces, the extra space becomes a trailing space. The returned string always has the same length as the input string.

name: shiftl$
short: This function returns the specified string with any leading spaces removed.

name: shiftr$
short: This function moves the contents of the specified string to the right, if there are trailing spaces. The length of the result is always the same as the length of the input string (this is not necessarily the declaration length).

name: show.dal.messages
short: Displays messages that are currently on the DAL message stack. Depending on the specified message type, you can display error, warning or info messages, or all messages. If no message type is specified, only error messages will be displayed.

name: signal
syntax: function void signal (long type, long action)
short: This specifies whether the process in which it is called ignores child process signals or not.

name: sin
short: This computes the sine of x , in radians. The x argument can be a long or a double.

name: sinh
short: This computes the hyperbolic sine of x .

name: skip.io
short: This function is deprecated!

name: sleep
short: This suspends execution of the specified process and places it in the sleeping process queue. To suspend execution of the your own process, specify the predefined variable pid in the argument.

name: soap.addheader
syntax: function void soap.addHeader (long soapMessage, long method)
short: Adds the specified Header Element to the Header of the SOAP Envelope of the given SOAP message.

name: soap.addmethod
syntax: function void soap.addMethod (long soapMessage, long method)
short: Adds the specified Method to the Body of the SOAP Envelope of the given SOAP message.

name: soap.deletemessage
short: Deletes the specified SOAP Message from memory, including all contained data. When the SOAP Message contains a SOAP Envelope, the SOAP Envelope is deleted as well. The passed soapMessage handle is set to 0 on return.

name: soap.getbody
short: Returns the Body of the SOAP Envelope of the given SOAP message.

name: soap.getenvelope
short: Returns the SOAP Envelope of the given SOAP message.

name: soap.getfault
short: Returns the Fault which is contained in the Body of the SOAP Envelope of the specified SOAP message.

name: soap.getheader
short: Returns the Header of the SOAP Envelope of the given SOAP message.

name: soap.getmethod
short: Returns the Method which is contained in the Body of the SOAP Envelope of the specified SOAP message.

name: soap.init
short: Initializes the SOAP client.

name: soap.invoke
syntax: function long soap.invoke (long soapMessage, const string url, ref long responseMessage)
short: Invokes a SOAP request as specified by the given SOAP Message. The request is sent to a SOAP service which is identified by the specified url. On return the response SOAP Message is returned in the responseMessage argument.

name: soap.newmessage
short: Creates a new SOAP Message, including a new SOAP Envelope and returns a handle to the new SOAP Message. The new SOAP Envelope will be created based on the specified SOAP namespace URI.

name: soap.setaction
syntax: function void soap.setAction (long soapMessage, const string soapAction)
short: Sets the SOAP Action of the specified SOAP Message. This action is sent together with the the SOAP Envelope to the SOAP service.

name: spool.buf
syntax: function void spool.buf (const string buffer, long length)
short: This sends the contents of the buffer argument to the current spooler. The current spooler must be already open. The name of the current spooler is available in the predefined variable spool.id .

name: spool.close
short: This closes the spooler specified by the predefined variable spool.id . By default spool.id contains the ID of the current spooler. If more than one spooler is currently open, set spool.id to the ID of the required spooler before you call this function. After the spooler is closed, spool.id is set to zero.

name: spool.line
short: This sends the contents of the predefined variable spool.pr.line and a newline character to the spooler specified by the predefined variable spool.id . By default spool.id contains the ID of the current spooler. If more than one spooler is currently open, set spool.id to the ID of the required spooler before you call this function. After this function has been executed, spool.pr.line is cleared.

name: spool.open
syntax: function long spool.open (string reportname, string device, string mode)
short: This opens a specified spooler device.

name: spool.restore.variables
short: This function sets the predefined spool variables to the values they had when the spooler was opened. If the optional argument is not specified, this function uses the predefined variable spool.id to look up the spooler to use.

name: sprintf$
short: This formats a string and returns the formatted string. The format argument contains zero or more ordinary characters and substitution symbols. The ordinary characters are copied directly to the output string. The substitution symbols specify formats for the values specified in the expression arguments and are substituted by these formatted values.

name: sql.break
short: This stops the specified query and clears any interim results. The sql_id argument indicates the query ID, as returned by sql.parse() . The function does not remove the query itself. So the query can be reused after binding to another variable, for example.

name: sql.close
short: This deletes all internal information relating to the specified query. The sql_id argument indicates the query ID, as returned by sql.parse() .

name: sql.exec
short: This initializes the specified query and evaluates any bind variables in the WHERE clause. Before calling this function, you must previously have called sql.parse() to define the query. The sql_id argument indicates the query ID, as returned by sql.parse() .

name: sql.fetch
short: This reads a single query result and stores the values retrieved in the variables specified in the SELECT list. The sql_id argument indicates the query ID, as returned by sql.parse() . You must call the function for each individual record in the result set.

name: sql.get.select.all.data.languages
short: This function retrieves the value of the select.all.data.languages flag of the current process.

name: sql.parse
syntax: function long sql.parse (string query(.) [, long mode] [, ref string err.msg] [, ref long err.line] [, const string annotation, ...])
short: This defines an SQL query that you can subsequently execute and retrieve the results of by using the other dynamic SQL functions. The query takes the form of a SELECT statement (see Database handling overview ).

name: sql.select.bind
syntax: function long sql.select.bind (long sql_id, long pseudo_var, varname var_name(.))
short: When you define an SQL statement with the sql.parse() function, you can define a pseudo variable for any or all of the fields specified in the SELECT statement. You do this by appending a number, prefixed by a colon [:], to each field. You use sql.select.bind() to bind a pseudo variable to a BAAN 4GL variable. As a result, the values of the field retrieved by the SELECT statement are stored in the 4GL variable. They can then be used elsewhere in the program.

name: sql.set.rds.full
syntax: function long sql.set.rds.full (long sql_id, long size)
short: This sets the size of the RDBMS buffer. The buffer is used to send the result rows of a query from the database back to the client (that is, the bshell). For example, if a query fetches 20 rows and you have set the size of the buffer to 5, then the database sends the rows back to the client five at a time.

name: sql.set.select.all.data.languages
short: This function sets the value of the select.all.data.languages flag of the current process. The specified value of the flag is valid until the end of the current 3GL function. After return from the current 3GL function, the flag is set back to the value which it had in the calling 3GL function. When the program is set back to a retry point , the flag is set back to the value which it had at the moment that the retry point was set.

name: sql.where.bind
syntax: function long sql.where.bind (long sql_id, long pseudo_var, varname var_name(.))
short: This binds a pseudo variable from the WHERE clause of a specified SQL query to a BAAN 4GL variable. This enables the BAAN 4GL variable to be used in the WHERE clause. Note that there is no need to bind external variables.

name: sqrt
short: This computes the non-negative square root of x . The x argument must not be less than zero. It can be of type long or double.

name: srand
short: random() generates random numbers using a multiplicative congruential random number generator. The default seed is 1. srand() resets the random number generator to the starting point specified by the seed argument (the seed can be any long value).

name: standard.command.is.allowed
syntax: function boolean standard.command.is.allowed () function boolean add.set.is.allowed () function boolean dupl.occur.is.allowed () function boolean modify.set.is.allowed () function boolean mark.delete.is.allowed () function boolean global.delete.is.allowed () function boolean text.manager.is.allowed ()
short: You can use these hooks in your UI script to define the conditions under which the specific standard command should become enabled in the UI. The 4GL engine will use these hooks to determine whether the standard commands must be enabled or disabled.

name: standard.commands.off
short: In session Standard Commands (ttadv3110s000) you can define which standard commands are available to the user. E.g. you can permanently disable the File | New (ADD.SET) command by unchecking its check box.

name: start.application.local
short: Deprecated. This starts the client application specified in the commandline argument.

name: start.ext.desk
syntax: function long start.ext.desk (string application [, long options] [, string title])
short: Start the Workbench (desk) application. This function will return when the Workbench application is closed by the user.

name: start.session
syntax: function string start.session (long mode, const string session.code, const string zoomname, const string returnfld)
short: This starts a session from a program script.

name: start.synchronized.child
syntax: function long start.synchronized.child (string sess_code [, string parent.var child.var] [, long start.mode])
short: Use this to synchronize two sessions that act on different main tables. The function starts the specified child session when the user chooses a particular form command in the multioccurrence parent session. The primary key of the parent's main table must be a subset of the primary key of the child's main table.

name: start.synchronized.child.with
short: To start a synchronized child with a command other than the default synchronization command, call this function before calling start.synchronized.child() .

name: stat.info
syntax: function long stat.info (string file_name, ref long size, ref long mode, ref long inode, ref long dev, ref long uid, ref long gid, ref long nlink, ref long ctime, ref long mtime, ref long atime)
short: This returns information about a named file. It provides the same information as fstat.info() , but for a named file.

name: status.del
short: This clears the first status field in the status area. Abbreviation for status.mess("").

name: status.mess
short: This displays the specified message in the first status field of a 4GL form.

name: stop
short: This ends the program. The program immediately exits without updating the database and without executing any further sections. The function has the same effect in both 3GL and 4GL scripts.

name: stop.synchronized.child
short: This ends a child session.

name: store.byte
syntax: function void store.byte (long value, ref string rec$)
short: The function store.byte() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes.

name: store.double
syntax: function void store.double (double value, ref string rec$)
short: The store.byte(), store.short(), store.long(), store.float() and store.double() functions treat the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes. The bytes written to the string are not the encoding of certain characters, but the encoding of the numerical value of the first argument of each function.

name: store.float
syntax: function void store.float (double value, ref string rec$)
short: The store.byte(), store.short(), store.long(), store.float() and store.double() functions treat the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes. The bytes written to the string are not the encoding of certain characters, but the encoding of the numerical value of the first argument of each function.

name: store.long
syntax: function void store.long (long value, ref string rec$)
short: The function store.long() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes.

name: store.occ.max
syntax: function void store.occ.max () function void store.occ.min ()
short: Normally, standard commands that access records of the main table can access all records of that table. You can use these functions to limit the records that can be accessed to those whose key values are within a specified range. Use store.occ.max() to define the upper limit of the range. Use store.occ.min() to define the lower limit of the range. If you wish, you can define only a maximum or only a minimum limit.

name: store.short
syntax: function void store.short (long value, ref string rec$)
short: The function store.short() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes.

name: store.utc
syntax: function void store.utc (long value, ref string rec$ [, long byte.count])
short: The function store.utc() treats the supplied string merely as a sequence of bytes.

name: str.compare
syntax: function long str.compare (const string a$, const string b$ [, boolean ignorecase])
short: Compares two strings on equality and returns whether string a$ is greater than, equal to or less than string b$ . By default the test is done in a case sensitive way, e.g. "A" is not equal to "a". Optionally the comparison can be done case insensitive.

name: str.containsmbchar
short: Tests whether the specified string contains at least one multi byte character. It does not matter if the string to search in is declared as a single byte or a multi byte string.

name: str.endswith
syntax: function boolean str.endswith (const string string$, const string part$ [, boolean ignorecase])
short: Determines whether the end of the specified string matches the specified part. Optionally the test can be done case insensitive.

name: str.equals
syntax: function boolean str.equals (const string a$, const string b$ [, boolean ignorecase])
short: Tests two strings on equality. By default the test is done in a case sensitive way, e.g. "A" is not equal to "a". Optionally the test can be done case insensitive.

name: str.insert$
syntax: function string str.insert$ (const string string$, long offset, const string part$)
short: Returns a copy of a string having a specified part inserted at a specified character position.

name: str.join$
syntax: function string str.join$ (const string separator$, void ...)
short: Joins the specified arguments to a single string. Non-string arguments are first converted to strings. The strings are separated with the specified separator.

name: str.remove$
syntax: function string str.remove$ (const string string$, long offset, long nchars)
short: Returns a copy of a string having a number of characters deleted, beginning at a specified character position.

name: str.replace
syntax: function void str.replace (const string string$, const string oldstr$, const string newstr$, ref string result$)
short: Returns as an output argument a (null terminated) copy of string$ that will have all instances of oldstr$ replaced with newstr$ .

name: str.replace$
syntax: function string str.replace$ (const string string$, const string oldstr$, const string newstr$)
short: Returns a (null terminated) copy of string$ that will have all instances of oldstr$ replaced with newstr$ .

name: str.sizeof
short: Returns the size of the specified string, i.e. the number of bytes the string can contain.

name: str.startswith
syntax: function boolean str.startswith (const string string$, const string part$ [, boolean ignorecase])
short: Determines whether the beginning of the specified string matches the specified part. Optionally the test can be done case insensitive.

name: str.substring$
syntax: function string str.substring$ (const string string$, long beginpos [, long endpos])
short: Returns a substring from the specified string. The substring starts at the specified begin position. When an end position is specified, the substring extends to the character at position endpos - 1 .

name: str$
short: The function str$ converts the supplied input value from its original type to type string.

name: string.scan
syntax: function long string.scan (string value, string format [, void ...])
short: This scans an input string ( value ) for one or more fields and stores each individual field found in the first available variable argument. The format argument contains conversion symbols that the function uses to interpret the input string and retrieve the individual field values. The conversion symbols indicate the types of values expected:

name: string.set$
syntax: function string string.set$ (string string_expr, long num_expr)
short: This returns a string that contains string_expr repeated num_expr times.

name: string.to.bounded.long
syntax: function long string.to.bounded.long (string string$, long lowerbound, long upperbound [, ref long appliedbounds])
short: This function performs explicit string to long type conversion . If the resulting value is within the specified bounds, that value is returned. Otherwise, the concerned bound is returned.

name: strip$
short: This returns a specified string without trailing spaces. The input string remains unchanged.

name: sub.window
syntax: function long sub.window (long parent_wind, long height, long width, long row, long col)
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: substitute.session
syntax: function long substitute.session (long old.pid, string new.session, long new.pid [, void ...])
short: This function overlays (substitutes) one session with another. The old session will be no longer visible and the new session will be placed on the same position with exactly the same dimensions.

name: sum.records.in.view
syntax: function void sum.records.in.view (const string column1.var, double result1.var [, const string, double ..., ...])
short: This function performs a query on the maintable of the session, including all reference tables, and will sum the values of each specified column. The query will take the current view fields, active user filter and any query extensions into account. Preconditions - an even number of parameters must be passed - any specified column must exist in the datadictionary if one of these conditions is not met, an assert is given Parameters column the name of column to sum result the result of the sum operation for 'column' ... more pairs of 'column' and 'result'

name: suspend
short: This stops execution of the current process for a specified number of milliseconds. You can specify any number of milliseconds in the range 0 to 2147483647 (the maximum value for a long).

name: switch.to.company
short: This switches to another company and sets the read-only variable COMPNR to the specified company number. It performs several checks before switching company and switches company only if the checks are successful. For example, it checks if the user is authorized to change to the new company, it checks if the package combination linked to the old company contains the same package VRC's as the package combination linked to the new company, and it checks if the old and new companies have the same first day of the week.

name: synchronize.satellite
short: Calling this function triggers a synchronization between the header and the active satellite. Since the controller does not know which satellite is currently active, the optional argument is used to indicate for which satellites a synchronization is needed. If the active satellite is not one of the specified satellites, no synchronization is performed. If no arguments are passed a synchronization is performed regardless of which satellite is active.

name: synchronize.with.child
short: This refreshes (that is, resynchronizes) a child session. If the specified child session does not exist, the child.id argument is set to 0 on return.

name: tab$
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: table.round
syntax: function void table.round ( [void field [, field] ...] [, string table [, table] ...])
short: This rounds the values in certain tables and table fields according to parameters defined in the domain definition in the data dictionary.

name: tan
short: This computes the tangent of x , in radians. The x argument can be a long or a double.

name: tanh
short: This computes the hyperbolic tangent of x .

name: tc.ignore.process
syntax: function void tc.ignore.process (boolean flag [, long processno])
short: This function indicates if the WebUI or LN UI should ignore this session (process). By default, the WebUI/LN UI does not ignore a session. Therefore this function should only be called from a 3GL session which does not present a User Interface. When this function is not called from such 3GL session, the WebUI/LN UI will seriously delay when such a 3GL Session is started.

name: tc.is.html.ui
short: This function returns if the running thin-client is supporting HTMLUI mode.

name: tc.is.thin.client
short: This function returns whether you are running in thin-client mode.

name: text.buf.to.field
syntax: function boolean text.buf.to.field (string text_field, string buf)
