short: This function stores the text of a buffer in the specified multiline text formfield. This is only relevant for multiline text formfields in a non-maintable session. An additional 'display' of this field is needed to see the changes on the form.

name: text.copy
syntax: function long text.copy (string text_field_to, string text_field_from, string kw1, string kw2, string kw3, string kw4, string tgroup, string edit_opt)
short: This makes a copy of the entire text of a specified text field, for all languages, and assigns it a new text number.

name: text.copy.between.companies
syntax: function long text.copy.between.companies (string text_field_to, string text_field_from, long source_company, long target_company, string kw1, string kw2, string kw3, string kw4, string tgroup, string edit_opt)
short: This copies the entire text of a specified text field, for all languages, from one company to another.

name: text.copy.language
syntax: function long text.copy.language (long textnr, string lang_from, string lang_to)
short: Deprecated. This function doesn't support shared tables and its usage is therefore deprecated. Use text.copy.language.shared() instead.

name: text.copy.language.shared
syntax: function long text.copy.language.shared (string text_field, string lang_from, string lang_to)
short: This copies a specified text from one language to another. This function takes table sharing into account.

name: text.defaults
syntax: function long text.defaults (string text_field, ref string tgroup, ref string edit_opt [, long comp_number])
short: This retrieves the defaults for a specified text field.

name: text.delete
syntax: function long text.delete (string text_field, string lang)
short: This deletes a specified text.

name: text.edit
syntax: function long text.edit (string text_field, string lang, string kw1, string kw2, string kw3, string kw4, string tgroup, string edit_opt, long mode)
short: This opens an edit window in which the specified text can be edited. If the text number associated with the specified text (i.e., the value of the field with name text_field ) is 0, the text manager prompts the user to confirm whether or not a new text must be created. After editing, the text number is stored in the field with name text_field .

name: text.find.other.language.shared
short: This function returns the language in which the most recent version of the text is stored. This function takes table sharing into account.

name: text.present.in.language
syntax: function long text.present.in.language (long textnr, string lang [, ref long nr_lines])
short: Deprecated. This function doesn't support shared tables and its usage is therefore deprecated. Use text.present.in.language.shared() instead.

name: text.present.in.language.shared
syntax: function long text.present.in.language.shared (string text_field, string lang [, ref long nr_lines])
short: This tests whether a specified text is available in a specified language. This function takes table sharing into account.

name: text.read
syntax: function long text.read (string text_field, string lang, string kw1, string kw2, string kw3, string kw4, ref string tgroup, ref string edit_opt, string tmp_file, long lock [, string rtf_file])
short: This reads a specified text and stores it in a temporary file. If this file already exists, it will be overwritten.

name: text.rewrite
syntax: function long text.rewrite (string text_field, string lang, string kw1, string kw2, string kw3, string kw4, string tgroup, string edit_opt, string tmp_file [, long bidi] [, string rtf_file])
short: This writes text from a specified file to a specified text field. The new text and new text attributes replace the existing text and text attributes.

name: text.set.keywords
syntax: function boolean text.set.keywords (string text_field, string keyword1, string keyword2, string keyword3, string keyword4)
short: This stores keyword(s) to the specified multiline text formfield. When the field can be edited with the textmanager (also), attr.textkw1$, attr.textkw2$, attr.textkw3$, attr.textkw4$ in the on.choice of 4gl-section choice.text.manager. In session "Texts overview" (tttxt1500m000) you can search for texts based on keywords.

name: text.set.language
syntax: function boolean text.set.language (string text_field, string language, void ...)
short: This function changes the language for multiline textfields that are displayed on the form and are part of the maintable. That language will be used when (one of) the textfields are/is read from the text tables. The language that is set with this function can still be overridden by setting attr.textlang$ in the before.choice section for the text.manager.

name: text.to.buf
syntax: function long text.to.buf (string text_field, string lang, long nr_lines, ref string buf(,) [, long rtf.text])
short: This stores the text of a specified text field in a two-dimensional string array.

name: text.window
syntax: function long text.window (string edit_opt, ref long start_column, ref long start_row, ref long number_columns, ref long number_rows)
short: This returns information about a specified window type.

name: text.write
syntax: function long text.write (string text_field, string lang, string kw1, string kw2, string kw3, string kw4, string tgroup, string edit_opt, string tmp_file [, long bidi] [, string rtf_file])
short: This adds a new text to the text manager and assigns a new text number to the text.

name: textfield.to.buf
syntax: function long textfield.to.buf (string text_field, string buffer)
short: Reads the text of a multiline text formfield and stores the text into the passed buffer. The passed buffer should be defined as a based string. This is only relevant for multiline text formfields in a non-maintable session.

name: textfield.to.database
short: Gets the text from the text part of the specified field, and writes it into the texttable. If the text does not exist yet in the texttable, a new texttable record is created. This is only relevant for multiline text formfields in a non-maintable session.

name: this.dal
short: Returns the name of the current DAL.

name: time.num
short: This returns the current time as the number of seconds since 00:00.

name: timezone.exists
short: This checks that the input argument contains the name of a valid time zone.

name: to.field
syntax: function void to.field (field field [, long occ])
short: This transfers control of the 4GL engine to the specified field after input to or display of the current field. This overrides the TAB sequence of the form. You can specify the field by using the field number or a string containing the field name.

name: to.form
short: This forces a switch from the current form to the specified form. The form_number argument must specify an existing form in the session, and must be in the range one to the value of the predefined variable number.forms . During the switch operation, the 4GL form sections subsection of the current form is executed and the 4GL form sections and 4GL form sections subsections of the new form are executed. The init.form subsection is executed only the first time a form becomes current.

name: to.group
short: Use this to make the first form on which the specified group occurs the current form. This function is relevant to dynamic forms only.

name: to.key
syntax: function void to.key (long key_number [, long nr.view.fields])
short: Use this to change the key of the main table without user interaction. The key_number argument specifies the new key.

name: to.satellite
short: This function can be used in UI scripts for multi main table controller sessions to switch to another satellite session. It can be used after the form definition has been read; it cannot be used in the before.program section.

name: tolower$
short: This function converts all upper case characters in its argument to lower case. It returns the converted string expression. The input string remains unchanged.

name: toupper$
short: This function converts all lower case characters in its argument to upper case. It returns the converted string expression. The input string remains unchanged.

name: trim$
short: This returns a specified string without the leading and trailing spaces. The input string remains unchanged.

name: tt.align.according.domain
syntax: function long tt.align.according.domain (string string_in(.), string string_out(), ref string domain_name)
short: This aligns a string according to the alignment method of a specified domain.

name: tt.bobject.desc
syntax: function string tt.bobject.desc (string b_object(10), ref string desc() mb)
short: This retrieves the description of a specified business object ( b_object ). It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.cdf
syntax: function long tt.cdf (const string cdf, ref boolean active, ref boolean internal)
short: This function returns information about the given given Customer Defined Field (CDF) as defined for the current Package Combination.

name: tt.chart.desc
syntax: function string tt.chart.desc (string chart [, ref string desc() mb])
short: This retrieves the name of the specified chart ( chart ). It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.chm.appl.desc
syntax: function long tt.chm.appl.desc (string appl(40), ref string desc() mb)
short: This retrieves the description (in the user's current language) of a specified Chart Manager application.

name: tt.chm.application
short: This checks if the specified Chart Manager application is present in the runtime dictionary.

name: tt.chm.chart
syntax: function boolean tt.chm.chart (string appl(40), string chart_name(16))
short: This checks if the specified chart is present in the specified Chart Manager application.

name: tt.chm.charttype
syntax: function boolean tt.chm.charttype (string appl(40), string chart_type(16))
short: This checks if the specified chart type is present in the specified Chart Manager application.

name: tt.comp.desc
syntax: function string tt.comp.desc ( [ref string desc() mb])
short: This retrieves the name of the current company. It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.company
syntax: function boolean tt.company (long company, ref string comp_desc() mb, ref string deflt_curr(), ref long first_weekday)
short: This returns information about a specified company.

name: tt.currency
syntax: function boolean tt.currency (string cur(3), ref string cur_desc() mb, ref string thous_sign, ref string dec_sign, ref string symbol())
short: This returns information about a specified currency.

name: tt.device
syntax: function boolean tt.device (string device(9), ref string desc() mb, ref long device_type)
short: This returns information about a specified device.

name: tt.field.desc
syntax: function string tt.field.desc (string field(17), ref string desc() mb)
short: This retrieves information about a specified table field. It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.index.desc
syntax: function string tt.index.desc (string tabl(8), long indexnr [, ref string desc() mb])
short: This returns information about a specified table index. It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.is.domain.separated
syntax: function boolean tt.is.domain.separated (const string a_domain() [, ref long numberOfSeparators] [, ref string separatorCharacter()])
short: Returns whether or not a segmented domain should be printed with separators

name: tt.label.desc
syntax: function string tt.label.desc (string label_code(19), domain ttadv.cont label_context, ref string desc)
short: This returns information of the specified label. It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.label.desc.by.lang
syntax: function string tt.label.desc.by.lang (string label_code(19), string language(1) [, long label_width] [, long label_height] [, domain ttadv.cont label_context])
short: Returns the label description of the specified label in the specified language.

name: tt.langdesc
syntax: function boolean tt.langdesc (string language, ref string desc() mb)

name: tt.language
syntax: function boolean tt.language (string lang, ref string desc() mb, ref string dec_sign, ref string thous_sign, ref string date_sep, ref string time_sep)
short: This returns information about a specified language.

name: tt.languages
syntax: function boolean tt.languages (boolean isolanguagecodes, ref long languages)
short: This returns information about all available LN software languages.

name: tt.library
syntax: function boolean tt.library (string library.code, ref string library.desc() mb)

name: tt.menu.desc
syntax: function string tt.menu.desc (string menu(13), string par_menu [, ref string desc() mb])
short: This returns information about a specified menu. It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.menu.present
syntax: function boolean tt.menu.present (string menu(13), string par_menu)
short: This checks if the specified menu of the current package is present in the runtime dictionary.

name: tt.report.desc
syntax: function string tt.report.desc (string reprt(15) [, ref string desc() mb])
short: This retrieves the description (in the user's current language) of a specified report ( reprt ). It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.reportgroup.exists
syntax: function boolean tt.reportgroup.exists (string session(13), long report_group)
short: This checks if a specified report group ( report_group ) is present in the definition of the specified session ( session ).

name: tt.session.desc
syntax: function string tt.session.desc (string session(13) [, ref string desc() mb] [, string language])
short: This retrieves the description of a specified session ( session ). It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.session.present
short: This checks if the specified session is present in the runtime dictionary.

name: tt.short.field.desc
syntax: function string tt.short.field.desc (string field(17), long length, ref string desc() mb)
short: This returns the description (in the user's current language) of a specified table field. It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.table.desc
syntax: function string tt.table.desc (string table(8), ref string desc() mb)
short: This retrieves the description (in the user's current language) of a specified table ( table ). It is returned, and optionally also stored in the desc argument. (The optional argument is only present for backward compatibility.)

name: tt.user
syntax: function boolean tt.user (string user(12), ref string name() mb)
short: This retrieves the name of the specified user ( user ) and stores it in the name argument.

name: tt.user.data
syntax: function boolean tt.user.data (string user(12), long property, ...)
short: This function retrieves one or more properties of an Infor LN user.

name: ue.after.after.destroy.object
short: This hook is called in case data is deleted, either by the user pressing the delete button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.destroy.object() or dal.destroy() is called.

name: ue.after.after.save.object
short: This hook is called in case data is saved, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.save.object() , dal.new() , or dal.update() is called.

name: ue.after.before.destroy.object
short: This hook is called in case data is deleted, either by the user pressing the delete button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.destroy.object() or dal.destroy() is called.

name: ue.after.before.save.object
short: This hook is called in case data is saved, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.save.object() , dal.new() , or dal.update() is called.

name: ue.before.after.destroy.object
short: This hook is called in case data is deleted, either by the user pressing the delete button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.destroy.object() or dal.destroy() is called.

name: ue.before.after.save.object
short: This hook is called in case data is saved, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.save.object() , dal.new() , or dal.update() is called.

name: ue.before.before.destroy.object
short: This hook is called in case data is deleted, either by the user pressing the delete button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.destroy.object() or dal.destroy() is called.

name: ue.before.before.save.object
short: This hook is called in case data is saved, either by the user pressing the save button on the UI, or programmatically when one of the functions dal.save.object() , dal.new() , or dal.update() is called.

name: ue.get.origin
short: This function returns the origin of the execution of the User Exit hook.

name: uni.export
syntax: function long uni.export (ref string target$, const string source$ [, long sb_flag])
short: This function converts a string from the TSS Encoding character set to Unicode , using a byte serialized UTF-16 encoding scheme. The default encoding scheme is UTF-16BE, i.e. each UTF-16 code unit is serialized with the most significant byte first.

name: uni.import
syntax: function long uni.import (ref string target$, const string source$ [, long sb_flag])
short: This function converts a string from Unicode (encoded according to a byte serialized UTF-16 encoding scheme) to the TSS Encoding character set. The default encoding scheme is UTF-16BE, i.e. each UTF-16 code unit is assumed to be serialized with the most significant byte first.

name: unlink.from.maintable
short: By default, when a session has a maintable, all form fields are treated as if they have a link to the maintable. When such fields are modified by the user, the maintable's update.status is set and the current record is marked as changed.

name: unmap.object
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: unmap.window
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: unset.focus
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: update.object
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: update.occ
short: The 4GL engine automatically detects changes a user makes to a field. However, it cannot detect changes to field values made in the program script. When you modify a field of the main table in the program script, you must call update.occ() to lock the record (delayed lock) and to switch on the update.status flag of the 4GL engine . This ensures when that the database is next updated, the modifications are saved to the database. The database update action can be initiated either by the user or within the script (use execute(update.db)).

name: user.exists
short: This checks whether a specified user is defined on the system. Whether user names are case-sensitive or case-insensitive is a system-dependent feature.

name: utc.add
syntax: function long utc.add (long i.utc, long year, long month, long day, long hour, long minute, long second, long o.utc)
short: This adds years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds to the input UTC value and makes corrections if necessary.

name: utc.num
short: This returns the current local date and time in UTC long format.

name: utc.to.date
syntax: function long utc.to.date (domain ttutc utc, ref long yearno, ref long monthno, ref long month_dayno, ref long hours, ref long minutes, ref long seconds)
short: This converts a UTC long format value to the corresponding year, month, day, and so on, in local time.

name: utc.to.date.with.timezone.info
syntax: function long utc.to.date.with.timezone.info (domain ttutc utc, ref long yearno, ref long monthno, ref long month_dayno, ref long hours, ref long minutes, ref long seconds, ref long utcdiff)
short: This converts a UTC long format value to the corresponding year, month, day, and so on, in local time. The difference in seconds to UTC is returned in the variable utcdiff.

name: utc.to.input
syntax: function string utc.to.input (domain ttutc lvalue, const string format())
short: This converts a UTC long format value to an input date string or an input time string (in local time). The format specified determines whether the function returns a date string or a time string.

name: utc.to.inputstr$
syntax: function long utc.to.inputstr$ (domain ttutc utc, string date.format(7), string time.format(7), ref string local.date(), ref string local.time())
short: This converts a UTC long format value to a local date string and a local time string.

name: utc.to.iso
syntax: function string utc.to.iso (domain ttutc utc, long format)
short: This converts a UTC into a string representation of the UTC in ISO8601 format.

name: utc.to.local
syntax: function long utc.to.local (long utc, ref long local_days, ref long local_time [, ref string local_dst])
short: This converts a UTC long format value to local date and time.

name: utc.to.local.with.timezone.info
syntax: function long utc.to.local.with.timezone.info (domain ttutc utc, ref long local_days, ref long local_time, ref long utcdiff)
short: This converts a UTC long format value to local date and time. The difference in seconds to UTC is returned in the variable utcdiff.

name: utc.to.week
syntax: function long utc.to.week (domain ttutc utc, ref long week_dayno, ref long year_dayno, ref long weekno, ref long hours, ref long minutes, ref long seconds [, ref long yearno])
short: This converts a UTC long format value to the corresponding day of the week, day of the year, week of the year, and so on, in local time.

name: utf8.export
syntax: function long utf8.export (ref string target$, const string source$, long option_mask)
short: This function converts a string from the TSS Encoding character set to Unicode , using a UTF-8 Encoding encoding.

name: utf8.import
syntax: function long utf8.import (ref string target$, const string source$, long option_mask)
short: This function converts a string from Unicode (encoded according to a UTF-8 Encoding encoding) to the TSS Encoding character set.

name: uuid.format$
short: Computes the standard string representation, e.g. "17293b6c-4d4d-11d6-af08-080009da70ff", of a UUID which is supplied in compact string representation, e.g. "Fyk4JE1NEdaO4AgACdpw/w".

name: uuid.generate$
short: Generates a UUID and returns its compact string representation, e.g. "Fyk4JE1NEdaO4AgACdpw/w".

name: val
short: This function converts the supplied textual representation to the represented floating point value or to the floating point value corresponding to the represented integer value.

name: varying numbers of arguments
short: No description available

name: varying numbers of arguments sample program
short: No description available

name: view.tree
syntax: function void view.tree (string tree_name, string node_id, long depth [, long process_id])
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: vsprintf$
short: This acts the same as sprintf$() , except that the arguments to be substituted for the substitution symbols in the format argument are not known until run time.

name: vwr.bms.received
short: This is the callback function which must be defined in the 3GL script. This function will be called by the Document Viewer when a BMS message is received which is not internally known by the Document Viewer library. This can be used to receive PRCM messages. While in this callback function, the script can call functions like : prcm.bms.is.notification() and prcm.get.data().

name: vwr.init
short: This function must be the first to be called, it initializes the Document Viewer. The Document Viewer is not supported in Worktop. When this session was started from a parent session in modeless mode, this function will reactive the parent session. So any imports which must be done by this session from the parent should be done before this function is called.

name: vwr.start
short: This function activates the Document Viewer. Control will be returned to the script after the Viewer has been closed. Function vwr.init must have been called before vwr.start can be called.

name: wait
syntax: function string wait (ref long process_id, long option)
short: This waits for one or all child processes to exit.

name: wait.and.activate
syntax: function long wait.and.activate (string procname(.) [, long arg1, arg2, ...])
short: This activates the specified program. The calling program is put in a waiting state. Because the calling program has not ended, it retains all its values.

name: week.to.num
syntax: function long week.to.num (long weekno, long yearno, long week_dayno)
short: This returns the number of days since 01-01-0001 for a specified week number, year number, and day of the week. The day of the week is interpreted by using the day defined as the first day of the week in the user data settings in the data dictionary (see Week handling ).

name: week.to.utc
syntax: function domain ttutc week.to.utc (long weekno, long yearno, long week_dayno, long hours, long minutes, long seconds)
short: This converts a specified week number, year number, day number in week, and so on, in local time, to UTC long format. For information on week numbering, see Week handling . Input values must be in the signed 32-bit value range.

name: with.object.set.do
short: With this function you can perform actions on records in the DAL's table, without affecting the current record. First the current record is saved into a temporary record buffer, then the specified function is executed. Afterwards the current record is restored from the temporary buffer.

name: with.old.object.values.do
short: This executes the specified function for the current record, using the old values of the record. The record must have been previously modified.

name: wrebuild
short: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: xmladd
syntax: function long xmlAdd (long destinationNode [, long fromNode], long toNode)
short: Unlink a tree or a list of trees and add this list to a new list after the node referred to by destinationNode .

name: xmlallocattribute
syntax: function long xmlAllocAttribute (ref string basedString(), long node, string attributeName, string default.value)
short: Get an attribute of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlallocattributename
syntax: function long xmlAllocAttributeName (ref string basedString(), long node, long attributeNr [, string default.value])
short: Get an attribute name of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node by specifying its position.

name: xmlallocattributens
syntax: function long xmlAllocAttributeNs (ref string basedString, long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string attributeName [, const string default.value])
short: Get the value of an attribute of the specified node. If an attribute with the specified attributeName and with a namespace whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI exists, then its value is returned. The function fails if the node is invalid or the namespaceOrURI is invalid.

name: xmlallocattributeprefix
syntax: function long xmlAllocAttributePrefix (ref string basedString, long node, long attributeNr [, const string default.value])
short: Get the prefix of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlallocattributequalifiedname
syntax: function long xmlAllocAttributeQualifiedName (ref string basedString, long node, long attributeNr [, const string default.value])
short: Get the qualified name of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlallocattributeuri
syntax: function long xmlAllocAttributeURI (ref string basedString, long node, long attributeNr [, const string default.value])
short: Get the URI of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlallocdata
syntax: function long xmlAllocData (ref string basedString, long node [, string default.value])
short: Get the data of a node. When node is of type XML_DATA or XML_PI, only the data from this node is obtained. When node is of type XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, the data from all child XML_DATA and XML_PI nodes is concatenated.

name: xmlallocdataelement
syntax: function long xmlAllocDataElement (ref string basedString(), long node, string name [, string default.value])
short: For each child XML_ELEMENT node that has a name equal to name , get the data contained in XML_DATA child nodes. The data from all matching nodes is concatenated.

name: xmlallocdataelementns
syntax: function long xmlAllocDataElementNs (ref string basedString, long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string name [, const string default.value])
short: Get the data of all child nodes of type XML_DATA of those child nodes of type XML_ELEMENT of the node whose local name matches the specified name and whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI . All data of the XML_DATA nodes is concatenated into a single string. If an XML_ELEMENT node has multiple XML_DATA nodes, then a single space is used as seperator.

name: xmlallocname
syntax: function long xmlAllocName (ref string basedString, long node [, string default.value])
short: Get the name of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlallocprefix
syntax: function long xmlAllocPrefix (ref string basedString, long node [, const string default.value])
short: Get the prefix of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlallocprettystring
syntax: function long xmlAllocPrettyString (ref string basedString(), long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an in-memory string buffer. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: xmlallocqualifiedname
syntax: function long xmlAllocQualifiedName (ref string basedString, long node [, const string default.value])
short: Get the qualified name of the specified node.

name: xmlallocstring
syntax: function long xmlAllocString (ref string basedString(), long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an in-memory string buffer. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: xmlallocuri
syntax: function long xmlAllocURI (ref string basedString, long node [, const string default.value])
short: Get the URI of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlappend
syntax: function long xmlAppend (long destinationNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Unlink a tree or a list of trees and append this list to the end of the list referred to by destinationNode .

name: xmlappendtochilds
syntax: function long xmlAppendToChilds (long parentNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Unlink a tree or a list of trees and append this list as the last child of the node referred to by parentNode .

name: xmlattribute$
syntax: function string xmlAttribute$ (long node, string attributeName [, ref string default.value])
short: Get an attribute of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlattributename$
syntax: function string xmlAttributeName$ (long node, long attributeNr [, string default.value])
short: Get an attribute name of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node by specifying its position.

name: xmlattributens$
syntax: function string xmlAttributeNs$ (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string attributeName [, const string default.value])
short: Get the value of an attribute of the specified node. If an attribute with the specified attributeName and with a namespace whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI exists, then its value is returned. The function fails if the node is invalid or the namespaceOrURI is invalid.

name: xmlattributeprefix$
syntax: function string xmlAttributePrefix$ (long node, long attributeNr [, const string default.value])
short: Get the prefix of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlattributequalifiedname$
syntax: function string xmlAttributeQualifiedName$ (long node, long attributeNr [, const string default.value])
short: Get the qualified name of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlattributeuri$
syntax: function string xmlAttributeURI$ (long node, long attributeNr [, const string default.value])
short: Get the URI of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlbuildnamespacelist$
syntax: function string xmlBuildNamespaceList$ (const string prefix, const string URI [, ... ])
short: This is a utility function that creates a string of namespace bindings, to be used for the xmlFindFirstMatchNs() and xmlFindMatchNs() functions.

name: xmlcontainsvalidcharactersonly
short: This function verifies whether the supplied string contains valid characters only.

name: xmldata$
syntax: function string xmlData$ (long node [, ref string default.value])
short: Get the data of a node. When node is of type XML_DATA or XML_PI, only the data from this node is obtained. When node is of type XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, the data from all child XML_DATA and XML_PI nodes is concatenated.

name: xmldataelement$
syntax: function string xmlDataElement$ (long node, string name [, string default.value])
short: For each child XML_ELEMENT node that has a name equal to name , get the data contained in XML_DATA child nodes. The data from all matching nodes is concatenated.

name: xmldataelementns$
syntax: function string xmlDataElementNs$ (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string name [, const string default.value])
short: Get the data of all child nodes of type XML_DATA of those child nodes of type XML_ELEMENT of the node whose local name matches the specified name and whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI . All data of the XML_DATA nodes is concatenated into a single string. If an XML_ELEMENT node has multiple XML_DATA nodes, then a single space is used as seperator.

name: xmldelete
syntax: function long xmlDelete (long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Delete a tree or a list of trees. When this tree is a sub-tree of a larger tree, it is unlinked from this larger tree.

name: xmldeleteattribute
syntax: function long xmlDeleteAttribute (long node, string attribute)
short: Delete an attribute of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmldeleteattributens
syntax: function long xmlDeleteAttributeNs (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string name)
short: Delete an attribute with a namespace. If an attribute with the specified name and with a namespace whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI exists, then this attribute is deleted. The function fails if the node is invalid or the namespaceOrURI is invalid.

name: xmlduplicate
syntax: function long xmlDuplicate (long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Duplicate a tree or a list of trees.

name: xmlduplicateandadd
syntax: function long xmlDuplicateAndAdd (long destinationNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Duplicate a tree or a list of trees and add this list to an existing list after the node referred to by destinationNode .

name: xmlduplicateandappend
syntax: function long xmlDuplicateAndAppend (long destinationNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Duplicate a tree or a list of trees and append this list to the end of the list referred to by destinationNode .

name: xmlduplicateandappendtochilds
syntax: function long xmlDuplicateAndAppendToChilds (long parentNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Duplicate a tree or a list of trees and append this list as the last child of the node referred to by parentNode .

name: xmlduplicateandinsert
syntax: function long xmlDuplicateAndInsert (long destinationNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Duplicate a tree or a list of trees and insert this list in an existing list before the node referred to by destinationNode .

name: xmlduplicateandinsertinchilds
syntax: function long xmlDuplicateAndInsertInChilds (long parentNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Duplicate a tree or a list of trees and insert this list as the first child of the node referred to by parentNode .

name: xmlduplicatetoprocess
syntax: function long xmlDuplicateToProcess (long processId, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Duplicate a tree or a list of trees into another 3GL-process space.

name: xmlfindfirst
syntax: function long xmlFindFirst (string tagName, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Search in a tree or a list of trees and return the first XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, which name is equal to the string tagName .

name: xmlfindfirstmatch
syntax: function long xmlFindFirstMatch (string pattern, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Search in a tree or a list of trees and return the first XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, which matches with the string pattern. The string pattern contains a search path relative to the starting node. The starting node is the list of nodes indicated by fromNode to toNode .

name: xmlfindfirstmatchns
syntax: function long xmlFindFirstMatchNs (string pattern, const string namespaceList, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Search in a tree or a list of trees and return the first XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, which matches with the string pattern. The string pattern contains a search path relative to the starting node. The starting node is the list of nodes indicated by fromNode to toNode .

name: xmlfindfirstns
syntax: function long xmlFindFirstNs (void namespaceOrURI, const string name, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: In an XML tree, or a list of XML trees, find the first XML node of type XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, whose local name matches the specified name and whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI . This is a depth first search.

name: xmlfindmatch
syntax: function long xmlFindMatch (string pattern, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Search in a tree or a list of trees and create a new tree containing references to all occurrences of XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD nodes, which match with the pattern . The pattern contains a search path relative to the starting node. The starting node is the list of nodes indicated by fromNode to toNode .

name: xmlfindmatchns
syntax: function long xmlFindMatchNs (string pattern, const string namespaceList, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Search in a tree or a list of trees and create a new tree containing references to all occurrences of XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD nodes, which match with the pattern . The pattern contains a search path relative to the starting node. The starting node is the list of nodes indicated by fromNode to toNode .

name: xmlfindnamespace
syntax: function long xmlFindNamespace (long node, const string URI)
short: Find the namespace with the specified URI. This function searches the specified XML node and all parent nodes. If successful, this function returns a handle to the namespace as created by the xmlNewNamespace() function. The handle can be used in for example the xmlNewNodeNs() function.

name: xmlfindnodes
syntax: function long xmlFindNodes (long node, string criteria, long maxFound [, ref long numFound])
short: Search in a tree starting at node and create a new tree containing references to all occurrences of XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD nodes, which name matches with the string criteria . Searching stops when maxFound number of Nodes is found. When maxFound has value 0, searching stops when the complete tree has been traversed. The tree is traversed in the order as shown in Figure 2 - Depth first Tree traversal order .

name: xmlfindnodesns
syntax: function long xmlFindNodesNs (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string name, long maxFound [, ref long numFound])
short: In an XML tree, find all XML nodes of type XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, whose local name matches the specified name and whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI . This is a depth first search.

name: xmlfindsetofsiblingnodes
syntax: function long xmlFindSetOfSiblingNodes (long node, string criteria, long maxFound [, ref long numFound])
short: Traverse the tree starting at node and return all occurrences of XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD nodes which name matches with the string criteria . Searching will stop when maxFound number of Nodes have been found. When maxFound has value 0, searching will stop when the complete tree has been traversed. The tree is traversed in the breadth first order as shown in the Figure 3 - Breadth first Tree traversal order .

name: xmlfirstnamespacedecl
short: Get the first namespace declaration from an XML node.

name: xmlgetattribute
syntax: function long xmlGetAttribute (long node, string attributeName, ref void data)
short: Get an attribute of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlgetattributelength
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeLength (long node, string attributeName)
short: Get the length of an attribute.

name: xmlgetattributelengthns
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeLengthNs (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string attributeName)
short: Get the length of the value of an attribute of the specified node. If an attribute with the specified attributeName and with a namespace whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI exists, then the length of its value is returned. The function fails if the node is invalid or the namespaceOrURI is invalid.

name: xmlgetattributename
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeName (long node, long attributeNr, ref string attributeName)
short: Get an attribute name of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node by specifying its position.

name: xmlgetattributenamelength
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeNameLength (long node, int attributeNr)
short: Get the length of an attribute name.

name: xmlgetattributens
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeNs (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string attributeName, ref void value)
short: Get the value of an attribute of the specified node. If an attribute with the specified attributeName and with a namespace whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI exists, then its value is returned. The function fails if the node is invalid or the namespaceOrURI is invalid.

name: xmlgetattributeprefix
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributePrefix (long node, long attributeNr, ref string prefix)
short: Get the prefix of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlgetattributeprefixlength
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributePrefixLength (long node, long attributeNr)
short: Get the length of the prefix of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlgetattributequalifiedname
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeQualifiedName (long node, long attributeNr, ref string name)
short: Get the qualified name of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlgetattributequalifiednamelength
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeQualifiedNameLength (long node, long attributeNr)
short: Get the length of the qualified name of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlgetattributeuri
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeURI (long node, long attributeNr, ref string URI)
short: Get the URI of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlgetattributeurilength
syntax: function long xmlGetAttributeURILength (long node, long attributeNr)
short: Get the length of the URI of an attribute of the specified node.

name: xmlgetdata
syntax: function long xmlGetData (long node, ref string data)
short: Get the data of a node. When node is of type XML_DATA or XML_PI, only the data from this node is obtained. When node is of type XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, the data from all child XML_DATA and XML_PI nodes is concatenated.

name: xmlgetdataelement
syntax: function long xmlGetDataElement (long node, string name, ref string data)
short: For each child XML_ELEMENT node that has a name equal to name , get the data contained in XML_DATA child nodes. The data from all matching nodes is concatenated.

name: xmlgetdataelementlength
syntax: function long xmlGetDataElementLength (long node, string name)
short: Get the data length of a node. For each child XML_ELEMENT node that has a name equal to name , the length of the data contained in XML_DATA child nodes is counted.

name: xmlgetdataelementlengthns
syntax: function long xmlGetDataElementLengthNs (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string name)
short: Get the length of the data of all child nodes of type XML_DATA of those child nodes of type XML_ELEMENT of the node whose local name matches the specified name and whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI . All data of the XML_DATA nodes is concatenated into a single string. If an XML_ELEMENT node has multiple XML_DATA nodes, then a single space is used as seperator.

name: xmlgetdataelementns
syntax: function long xmlGetDataElementNs (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string name, ref string data)
short: Get the data of all child nodes of type XML_DATA of those child nodes of type XML_ELEMENT of the node whose local name matches the specified name and whose URI matches the URI specified by namespaceOrURI . All data of the XML_DATA nodes is concatenated into a single string. If an XML_ELEMENT node has multiple XML_DATA nodes, then a single space is used as seperator.

name: xmlgetdatalength
short: Get the data length of a node. When node is of type XML_DATA or XML_PI, only the length of the data from this node is obtained. When node is of type XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD, the length of the data from all child XML_DATA and XML_PI nodes is counted.

name: xmlgetfirstchild
short: Get the first (most left) child node of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlgetlastchild
short: Get the last (most right) child node of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlgetleftsibling
short: Get the left sibling node of a node.

name: xmlgetname
syntax: function long xmlGetName (long node, ref string name)
short: Get the name of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlgetnamelength
short: Get the length of a node name.

name: xmlgetnamespace
short: Get the namespace of an XML node. This function returns a reference to the namespace as created by the xmlNewNamespace() function. The reference can be used in for example the xmlNewNodeNs() function.

name: xmlgetnumattributes
short: Get the number of attributes of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlgetnumchilds
short: Get the number of child nodes of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlgetnumleftsiblings
short: Get the number of left sibling nodes.

name: xmlgetnumrightsiblings
short: Get the number of right sibling nodes.

name: xmlgetnumsiblings
short: Get the total number of sibling nodes.

name: xmlgetparent
short: Get the parent of a node.

name: xmlgetprefix
syntax: function long xmlGetPrefix (long node, ref string prefix)
short: Get the prefix of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlgetprefixlength
short: Get the length of the prefix of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlgetprettystringlength
syntax: function long xmlGetPrettyStringLength (long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Get the length of the serialized form of an XML Object. The additional new-lines and tabs for human-readable formatting are taken into account.

name: xmlgetqualifiedname
syntax: function long xmlGetQualifiedName (long node, ref string name)
short: Get the qualified name of the specified node.

name: xmlgetqualifiednamelength
short: Get the length of the qualified name of the specified node.

name: xmlgetrightsibling
short: Get the right sibling node of a node.

name: xmlgetsamlnode
short: Get the root-node of the XML document that contains the SAML (Security Assertion Markup Language) data that has been passed by the security and authentication system. This will contain details about the user, authentication and authorisation data.

name: xmlgetstringlength
syntax: function long xmlGetStringLength (long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Get the length of the serialized form of an XML Object.

name: xmlgettype
short: Get the type of a node.

name: xmlgeturi
syntax: function long xmlGetURI (long node, ref string URI)
short: Get the URI of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlgeturilength
short: Get the length of the URI of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlinsert
syntax: function long xmlInsert (long destinationNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Unlink a tree or a list of trees and insert this list in a new list before the node referred to by destinationNode .

name: xmlinsertinchilds
syntax: function long xmlInsertInChilds (long parentNode, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Unlink a tree or a list of trees and insert this list as the first child of the node referred to by parentNode .

name: xmlisnode
short: Check whether the value supplied is a valid XML node.

name: xmlname$
syntax: function string xmlName$ (long node [, string default.value])
short: Get the name of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlnamespaceprefix$
short: Get the prefix of the specified namespace.

name: xmlnamespaceuri$
short: Get the URI of the specified namespace.

name: xmlnewdataelement
syntax: function long xmlNewDataElement (string name, string data [, long parentNode])
short: Create a new XML_ELEMENT node and new XML_DATA node. The XML_DATA node is the first child of the XML_ELEMENT node.

name: xmlnewdataelementns
syntax: function long xmlNewDataElementNs (long namespace, const string name, void data [, long parentNode])
short: Create a new XML node of type XML_ELEMENT with local name as specified by name and in the namespace as specified by namespace . A new XML node of type XML_DATA is created as the first child of the newly created XML_ELEMENT node, with data as specified by data . The function fails if namespace is invalid or parentNode is invalid.

name: xmlnewnamespace
syntax: function long xmlNewNamespace (long node, const string prefix, const string URI)
short: Create a new namespace with the specified prefix and URI. The specified node becomes the carrier of the namespace, but the node itself is not yet in the namespace.

name: xmlnewnode
syntax: function long xmlNewNode (string name [, long type] [, long parentNode])
short: Create a new XML node.

name: xmlnewnodens
syntax: function long xmlNewNodeNs (long namespace, const string name [, long type] [, long parentNode])
short: Create a new XML node in the specified namespace.

name: xmlnextnamespacedecl
short: Get the next namespace declaration of an XML node.

name: xmlprefix$
syntax: function string xmlPrefix$ (long node [, const string default.value])
short: Get the prefix of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlprettystring$
syntax: function string xmlPrettyString$ (long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an in-memory string. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: xmlqualifiedname$
syntax: function string xmlQualifiedName$ (long node [, const string default.value])
short: Get the qualified name of the specified node.

name: xmlread
syntax: function long xmlRead (long fp, ref string error [, long whitespacehandling])
short: De-serialize an XML object by parsing an XML document and creating an in-memory object tree.

name: xmlreadfromstring
syntax: function long xmlReadFromString (string xmlString, ref string error [, long whitespacehandling])
short: De-serialize an XML object by parsing an XML document and creating an in-memory object tree.

name: xmlreadfromstringns
syntax: function long xmlReadFromStringNs (string xmlString, ref string error [, long whitespacehandling])
short: De-serialize an XML object by parsing an XML document and creating an in-memory object tree. This function supports XML namespaces, and will create namespace declarations carried by the respective XML nodes, and put XML nodes in their appropriate namespace.

name: xmlreadns
syntax: function long xmlReadNs (long fp, ref string error [, long whitespacehandling])
short: De-serialize an XML object by parsing an XML document and creating an in-memory object tree. This function supports XML namespaces, and will create namespace declarations carried by the respective XML nodes, and put XML nodes in their appropriate namespace.

name: xmlreplaceinvalidcharacters
syntax: function long xmlReplaceInvalidCharacters (ref string inputstring, string replacementCharacter(1))
short: This function replaces any character that is invalid in an XML document by the specified replacement character. The replacement character must be a single-byte ASCII character in the range from #20 (ASCII space) to #7e (ASCII tilde).

name: xmlrewritedataelement
syntax: function long xmlRewriteDataElement (long node, string name, string data)
short: Find first child XML_ELEMENT node that has a name equal to name. If a matching node is found and this node does not have any child node, a new XML_DATA node with value data is added as a child node.

name: xmlrewritedataelementns
syntax: function long xmlRewriteDataElementNs (long node, void namespaceOrURI, const string name, void data)
short: If node has no child node of type XML_ELEMENT whose local name equals name and whose URI equals the URI specified by namespaceOrURI , then a new XML node of type XML_ELEMENT is created, with an XML node of type XML_DATA with the specified data .

name: xmlsetattribute
syntax: function long xmlSetAttribute (long node, string attributeName, void data)
short: Set an attribute of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlsetattributens
syntax: function long xmlSetAttributeNs (long node, long namespace, const string name, void value)
short: Set the value of an attribute with a namespace. If no attribute with the specified name and with a namespace whose URI matches the URI of the specified namespace exists, then a new attribute with the specified name , namespace and value is created. If the XML node is not of type XML_ELEMENT then the function fails.

name: xmlsetdata
syntax: function long xmlSetData (long node, string data)
short: Set the data of an XML_DATA or XML_PI node.

name: xmlsetname
syntax: function long xmlSetName (long node, string name)
short: Set the name of an XML_ELEMENT or XML_DTD node.

name: xmlsetnamespace
syntax: function long xmlSetNamespace (long node, long namespace)
short: Set the namespace of an XML node to the specified namespace. The specified node does not become the carrier of the namespace. In other words, the node does not declare the namespace, but it is put in the namespace. If the XML node is not of type XML_ELEMENT then the function fails.

name: xmlstring$
syntax: function string xmlString$ (long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an in-memory string. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: xmlunlink
syntax: function long xmlUnlink (long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Unlink a tree or a list of trees.

name: xmluri$
syntax: function string xmlURI$ (long node [, const string default.value])
short: Get the URI of the namespace of the specified node.

name: xmlwrite
syntax: function long xmlWrite (long fp, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an open stream. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: xmlwritepretty
syntax: function long xmlWritePretty (long fp, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an open stream. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: xmlwriteprettytostring
syntax: function long xmlWritePrettyToString (ref string buffer, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an in-memory string. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: xmlwritetostring
syntax: function long xmlWriteToString (ref string buffer, long fromNode [, long toNode])
short: Serialize an XML object to XML and write resulting XML document to an in-memory string. Any string information in the XML document is converted to UTF-8 format.

name: zipfile.build
short: Builds a zip file based on the specified zipinfo object.

name: zipfile.create
syntax: function long zipfile.create (const string zipfile, const string entry)
short: Creates a zip file for the specified entry. This may be a file or a directory. In case of a directory, all files and subdirectories in that directory are added to the zip file. In case the zip file already exists, it is overwritten.

name: zipfile.extract
syntax: function long zipfile.extract (const string zipfile, const string dir)
short: Extracts all files from a zip file to the specified directory. Any files in the zip file that already exist in the specified directory, will be overwritten. In case the extracted files are to be removed after processing them, it is advised to extract the files to a just created temporary directory, which can be removed when no longer needed. See rmdir() for more information regarding removing a directory structure.

name: zipfile.info
short: Retrieves a zipinfo object providing information regarding all entries in a zipfile.

name: zipinfo.add
syntax: function [long] zipinfo.add (long handle, const string entry [, long type])
short: Adds an entry to a zipinfo object. The entry may either be a directory or a file. Optionally, the entry type (directory or file) may be specified.

name: zipinfo.count
short: Returns the number of entries in a zipinfo object.

name: zipinfo.delete
short: Deletes a zipinfo object.

name: zipinfo.file
short: Retrieves attribute file.

name: zipinfo.first
syntax: function boolean zipinfo.first (long handle, ref string entry, ref long type)
short: Retrieves the first entry from a zipinfo object.

name: zipinfo.new
short: Returns a new empty zipinfo object for the specified zipfile.

name: zipinfo.next
syntax: function boolean zipinfo.next (long handle, ref string entry, ref long type)
short: Retrieves the next entry from a zipinfo object.

short: Data is selected on the basis of the condition specified in the SELECT statement. The operations between SELECTDO and ENDSELECT are performed on each record from the selected set. The loop ends either when the program has handled the entire set or the program encounters a BREAK command.

name: store.occ.min
syntax: function void store.occ.max () function void store.occ.min ()
short: Normally, standard commands that access records of the main table can access all records of that table. You can use these functions to limit the records that can be accessed to those whose key values are within a specified range. Use store.occ.max() to define the upper limit of the range. Use store.occ.min() to define the lower limit of the range. If you wish, you can define only a maximum or only a minimum limit.
